verses.textEn: Then the Lord called Moses and spoke to him from the tabernacle of the testimony, saying:
verses.textLa: Vocavit autem Moysen, et locutus est ei Dominus de tabernaculo testimonii, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: The man among you who will offer to the Lord a sacrifice from the cattle, that is, an offering of victims of oxen or sheep:
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Homo, qui obtulerit ex vobis hostiam Domino de pecoribus, id est, de bobus et ovibus offerens victimas,

verses.textEn: if his offering will be a holocaust, as well as from the herd, he shall offer an immaculate male at the door of the tabernacle of the testimony, to make himself pleasing to the Lord.
verses.textLa: si holocaustum fuerit eius oblatio, ac de armento; masculum immaculatum offeret ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii, ad placandum sibi Dominum:

verses.textEn: And he shall place his hand on the head of the sacrifice, and so it shall be acceptable and effective, in its expiation.
verses.textLa: ponetque manum super caput hostiæ, et acceptabilis erit, atque in expiationem eius proficiens.

verses.textEn: And he shall immolate the calf in the sight of the Lord. And the priests, the sons of Aaron, shall offer its blood, pouring it all around the altar, which is before the door of the tabernacle.
verses.textLa: Immolabitque vitulum coram Domino, et offerent filii Aaron sacerdotes sanguinem eius, fundentes per altaris circuitum, quod est ante ostium tabernaculi.

verses.textEn: And having pulled away the skin of the victim, they shall cut up the joints into pieces,
verses.textLa: Detractaque pelle hostiæ, artus in frusta concident,

verses.textEn: and they shall toss fire under the altar, having arranged beforehand a stack of wood.
verses.textLa: et subiicient in altari ignem, strue lignorum ante composita:

verses.textEn: And they shall lay the parts which are cut up in order upon it: namely, the head, and all the things that adjoin to the liver,
verses.textLa: et membra quæ sunt cæsa, desuper ordinantes, caput videlicet, et cuncta quæ adhærent iecori,

verses.textEn: the intestines and feet having been washed with water. And the priest shall burn them on the altar as a holocaust and as a sweet odor to the Lord.
verses.textLa: intestinis et pedibus lotis aqua: adolebitque ea sacerdos super altare in holocaustum et suavem odorem Domino.

verses.textEn: But if the offering is from the flocks, a holocaust either of sheep or goats, he shall offer a male without blemish.
verses.textLa: Quod si de pecoribus oblatio est, de ovibus sive de capris holocaustum, masculum absque macula offeret:

verses.textEn: And he shall immolate it at the side of the altar which looks out toward the north, in the sight of the Lord. Yet truly, the sons of Aaron shall pour its blood upon the altar all around.
verses.textLa: immolabitque ad latus altaris, quod respicit ad Aquilonem, coram Domino: sanguinem vero illius fundent super altare filii Aaron per circuitum:

verses.textEn: And they shall divide the limbs, the head, and everything that adjoins to the liver. And they shall place them on the wood, under which the fire is to be thrown.
verses.textLa: dividentque membra, caput, et omnia quæ adhærent iecori: et ponent super ligna, quibus subiiciendus est ignis:

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the intestines and the feet they shall wash with water. And the priest, having offered everything, shall burn it upon the altar as a holocaust and as a most sweet odor to the Lord.
verses.textLa: intestina vero et pedes lavabunt aqua. Et oblata omnia adolebit sacerdos super altare in holocaustum et odorem suavissimum Domino.

verses.textEn: But if the oblation of a holocaust to the Lord is of birds, either of turtledoves, or young pigeons,
verses.textLa: Si autem de avibus, holocausti oblatio fuerit Domino, de turturibus, aut pullis columbæ,
verses.notes: A dove is another name for a pigeon. Turtledoves are white pigeons. Young pigeons are generally white, no matter what color they will have as adults. So this verse calls for white birds, symbolizing purity.

verses.textEn: the priest shall offer it at the altar: and twisting back the neck with the head, and also rupturing the place of the wound, he shall make the blood run down over the edge of the altar.
verses.textLa: offeret eam sacerdos ad altare: et retorto ad collum capite, ac rupto vulneris loco, decurrere faciet sanguinem super crepidinem altaris:

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the craw of the throat and the feathers he shall cast near the altar at the eastern section, in the place where the ashes are usually poured out.
verses.textLa: vesiculam vero gutturis, et plumas proiiciet prope altare ad orientalem plagam, in loco in quo cineres effundi solent,

verses.textEn: And he shall break its wing joints, but he shall neither cut, nor divide it with metal, and he shall burn it upon the altar, placing fire under the wood. It is a holocaust and an oblation of a most sweet odor to the Lord.
verses.textLa: confringetque ascellas eius, et non secabit, neque ferro dividet eam, et adolebit super altare, lignis igne supposito. Holocaustum est et oblatio suavissimi odoris Domino.

verses.textEn: When a soul will offer an oblation of sacrifice to the Lord, his oblation shall be of fine wheat flour, and he shall pour oil over it, and he shall set down frankincense,
verses.textLa: Anima cum obtulerit oblationem sacrificii Domino, simila erit eius oblatio; fundetque super eam oleum, et ponet thus,

verses.textEn: and he shall bring it to the sons of Aaron, the priests. One of them shall take a handful of the flour with oil, as well as all the frankincense, and he shall place it as a memorial upon the altar, as a most sweet odor to the Lord.
verses.textLa: ac deferet ad filios Aaron sacerdotes: quorum unus tollet pugillum plenum similæ et olei, ac totum thus, et ponet memoriale super altare in odorem suavissimum Domino.

verses.textEn: Then what will remain of the sacrifice shall be for Aaron and his sons, the Holy of holies from the oblations of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Quod autem reliquum fuerit de sacrificio, erit Aaron et filiorum eius, Sanctum sanctorum de oblationibus Domini.

verses.textEn: But when you will offer a sacrifice baked in the oven from fine wheat flour, specifically: loaves without leaven, sprinkled with oil, and unleavened wafers, rubbed with oil:
verses.textLa: Cum autem obtuleris sacrificium coctum in clibano: de simila, panes scilicet absque fermento, conspersos oleo, et lagana azyma oleo lita.

verses.textEn: if your oblation will be from the frying pan, of flour tempered with oil and without leaven,
verses.textLa: Si oblatio tua fuerit de sartagine, similæ conspersæ oleo et absque fermento,

verses.textEn: you shall divide it into little pieces and pour oil over it.
verses.textLa: divides eam minutatim, et fundes super eam oleum.

verses.textEn: But if the sacrifice will be from the oven grating, equally the fine wheat flour shall be sprinkled with oil.
verses.textLa: Sin autem de craticula fuerit sacrificium, æque simila oleo conspergetur:

verses.textEn: When you are offering it to the Lord, you shall deliver it into the hands of the priest.
verses.textLa: quam offerens Domino, trades manibus sacerdotis.

verses.textEn: And when he has offered it, he shall take a memorial from the sacrifice and burn it upon the altar as a sweet odor to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Qui cum obtulerit eam, tollet memoriale de sacrificio, et adolebit super altare in odorem suavitatis Domino,

verses.textEn: But whatever is left shall be for Aaron and his sons, the Holy of holies from the oblations of the Lord.
verses.textLa: quidquid autem reliquum est, erit Aaron, et filiorum eius, Sanctum sanctorum de oblationibus Domini.

verses.textEn: Every oblation that is offered to the Lord shall be made without leaven; neither shall any leaven or honey be burned with the sacrifice to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Omnis oblatio, quæ offeretur Domino, absque fermento fiet, nec quidquam fermenti ac mellis adolebitur in sacrificio Domino.

verses.textEn: You shall offer only the first-fruits of these along with the gifts. Yet truly, these shall not be placed upon the altar as an odor of sweetness.
verses.textLa: Primitias tantum eorum offeretis ac munera: super altare vero non imponentur in odorem suavitatis.
verses.notes: So the first fruits of leaven and honey were to be offered along with the gifts, but these were not to be combined with flour, or baked into loaves, for the oblations or offerings on the altar.

verses.textEn: Whatever sacrifice you will offer, you shall season it with salt; neither shall you take away the salt of the covenant of your God from your sacrifice. In all your oblations, you shall offer salt.
verses.textLa: Quidquid obtuleris sacrificii, sale condies, nec auferes sal fœderis Dei tui de sacrificio tuo. In omni oblatione tua offeres sal.

verses.textEn: But if you will offer a gift of the first-fruits of your grain to the Lord, from ears of grain still green, you shall parch it at the fire, and break it open in the manner of meal. And so shall you offer your first-fruits to the Lord:
verses.textLa: Si autem obtuleris munus primarum frugum tuarum Domino de spicis adhuc virentibus, torrebis igni, et confringes in morem farris, et sic offeres primitias tuas Domino,

verses.textEn: pouring oil over it, and imposing frankincense, because it is an oblation of the Lord.
verses.textLa: fundens supra oleum, et thus imponens, quia oblatio Domini est.

verses.textEn: From this, the priest shall burn, as a memorial of the gift, a portion of the cracked grain and the oil, as well as all of the frankincense.
verses.textLa: De qua adolebit sacerdos in memoriam muneris partem farris fracti, et olei, ac totum thus.

verses.textEn: But if his oblation will be a sacrifice of peace offerings, and he wishes to offer it from the oxen, whether male or female, he shall offer what is immaculate, in the sight of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Quod si hostia pacificorum fuerit eius oblatio, et de bobus voluerit offerre, marem sive feminam, immaculata offeret coram Domino.

verses.textEn: And he shall place his hand upon the head of his victim, which shall be immolated at the entrance of the tabernacle of the testimony. And the sons of Aaron, the priests, shall pour the blood all around the altar.
verses.textLa: Ponetque manum super caput victimæ suæ, quæ immolabitur in introitu tabernaculi testimonii, fundentque filii Aaron sacerdotes, sanguinem per altaris circuitum.

verses.textEn: And they shall offer from the sacrifice of peace offerings, as an oblation to the Lord: the fat which covers the vital organs, and whatever fat is interior,
verses.textLa: Et offerent de hostia pacificorum in oblationem Domino, adipem qui operit vitalia, et quidquid pinguedinis est intrinsecus:

verses.textEn: the two kidneys with the fat that covers the sides, and the mesh of the liver with the two little kidneys.
verses.textLa: duos renes cum adipe quo teguntur ilia, et reticulum iecoris cum renunculis.

verses.textEn: And they shall burn them upon the altar as a holocaust, placing fire under the wood, as an oblation of a most sweet odor to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Adolebuntque ea super altare in holocaustum, lignis igne supposito: in oblationem suavissimi odoris Domino.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, if his oblation and the sacrifice of peace offerings will be from the sheep, whether he will offer a male or a female, they shall be immaculate.
verses.textLa: Si vero de ovibus fuerit eius oblatio et pacificorum hostia, sive masculum obtulerit, sive feminam, immaculata erunt.

verses.textEn: If he will offer a lamb in the sight of the Lord,
verses.textLa: Si agnum obtulerit coram Domino,

verses.textEn: he shall place his hand upon the head of the victim. And it shall be immolated at the vestibule of the tabernacle of the testimony. And the sons of Aaron shall pour its blood all around the altar.
verses.textLa: ponet manum suam super caput victimæ suæ: quæ immolabitur in vestibulo tabernaculi testimonii: fundentque filii Aaron sanguinem eius per circuitum altaris.

verses.textEn: And they shall offer from the victim of peace offerings, as a sacrifice to the Lord: the fat, and the entire rump
verses.textLa: Et offerent de pacificorum hostia sacrificium Domino: adipem et caudam totam

verses.textEn: with the kidneys, and the fat that covers the abdomen, and all the vital organs, and both the little kidneys with the fat that is near the sides, and the mesh of the liver with the little kidneys.
verses.textLa: cum renibus, et pinguedinem quæ operit ventrem atque universa vitalia, et utrumque renunculum cum adipe qui est iuxta ilia, reticulumque iecoris cum renunculis.

verses.textEn: And the priest shall burn them upon the altar, as fuel for the fire and as an oblation of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Et adolebit ea sacerdos super altare in pabulum ignis et oblationis Domini.

verses.textEn: If his oblation will be a goat, and he will offer it to the Lord,
verses.textLa: Si capra fuerit eius oblatio, et obtulerit eam Domino,

verses.textEn: he shall place his hand upon its head, and he shall immolate it at the entrance of the tabernacle of the testimony. And the sons of Aaron shall pour its blood all around the altar.
verses.textLa: ponet manum suam super caput eius: immolabitque eam in introitu tabernaculi testimonii. Et fundent filii Aaron sanguinem eius per altaris circuitum.

verses.textEn: And they shall take from it, to feed the Lord’s fire: the fat which covers the abdomen, and that which covers all the vital organs,
verses.textLa: Tollentque ex ea in pastum ignis Dominici, adipem qui operit ventrem, et qui tegit universa vitalia:

verses.textEn: the two little kidneys with the mesh that is over them near the sides, and the fat of the liver with the little kidneys.
verses.textLa: duos renunculos cum reticulo, quod est super eos iuxta ilia, et arvinam iecoris cum renunculis.

verses.textEn: And the priest shall burn them upon the altar, as nourishment for the fire and as a most sweet odor. All the fat shall be for the Lord;
verses.textLa: Adolebitque ea super altare sacerdos in alimoniam ignis, et suavissimi odoris. Omnis adeps, Domini erit:

verses.textEn: by a perpetual law, in your generations and in all of your habitations, neither blood nor fat shall you eat at all.
verses.textLa: iure perpetuo in generationibus, et cunctis habitaculis vestris: nec sanguinem nec adipem omnino comedetis.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Say to the sons of Israel: The soul which will have sinned through ignorance, and concerning any of the commandments of the Lord that he instructed not to be done, if anything at all has been done:
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel: Anima, quæ peccaverit per ignorantiam, et de universis mandatis Domini, quæ præcepit ut non fierent, quippiam fecerit:

verses.textEn: if the priest, who is anointed, will have sinned, causing the people to commit a transgression, he shall offer to the Lord for his sin an immaculate calf.
verses.textLa: si sacerdos, qui unctus est, peccaverit, delinquere faciens populum, offeret pro peccato suo vitulum immaculatum Domino:

verses.textEn: And he shall lead it to the door of the tabernacle of the testimony in the sight of the Lord. And he shall place his hand upon its head, and he shall immolate it to the Lord.
verses.textLa: et adducet illum ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii coram Domino, ponetque manum super caput eius, et immolabit eum Domino.

verses.textEn: Likewise, he shall take from the blood of the calf, carrying it into the tabernacle of the testimony,
verses.textLa: Hauriet quoque de sanguine vituli, inferens illum in tabernaculum testimonii,

verses.textEn: and having dipped his finger into the blood, he shall sprinkle it seven times in the sight of the Lord, opposite the veil of the Sanctuary.
verses.textLa: cumque intinxerit digitum in sanguine, asperget eo septies coram Domino contra velum Sanctuarii.

verses.textEn: And he shall place some of the same blood over the horns of the altar of most pleasing incense to the Lord, which is in the tabernacle of the testimony. Then he shall pour out the remainder of the blood at the base of the altar of holocaust at the entrance of the tabernacle.
verses.textLa: Ponetque de eodem sanguine super cornua altaris thymiamatis gratissimi Domino, quod est in tabernaculo testimonii. Omnem autem reliquum sanguinem fundet in basim altaris holocausti in introitu tabernaculi.

verses.textEn: And, on behalf of the sin, he shall take the fat of the calf, both that which covers the vital organs and all that is interior,
verses.textLa: Et adipem vituli auferet pro peccato, tam eum qui vitalia operit quam omnia quæ intrinsecus sunt:

verses.textEn: the two little kidneys, and the mesh that is on them near the sides, and the fat of the liver with the little kidneys,
verses.textLa: duos renunculos et reticulum quod est super eos iuxta ilia, et adipem iecoris cum renunculis,

verses.textEn: just as it is taken from the calf of the sacrifice of peace offerings. And he shall burn them upon the altar of holocaust.
verses.textLa: sicut aufertur de vitulo hostiæ pacificorum: et adolebit ea super altare holocausti.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the skin and all the flesh, with the head and the feet, and the intestines and the dung,
verses.textLa: Pellem vero et omnes carnes cum capite et pedibus et intestinis et fimo,

verses.textEn: and the remainder of the body, he shall carry away, beyond the camp, to the clean place where the ashes are usually poured out. And he shall burn them upon a stack of wood. There, in the place where the ashes have been poured out, they will be burned.
verses.textLa: et reliquo corpore, efferet extra castra in locum mundum, ubi cineres effundi solent: incendetque ea super lignorum struem, quæ in loco effusorum cinerum cremabuntur.

verses.textEn: But if all the crowd of Israel will have been ignorant, and through inexperience will have done what is contrary to the commandment of the Lord,
verses.textLa: Quod si omnis turba Israel ignoraverit, et per imperitiam fecerit quod contra mandatum Domini est,

verses.textEn: and afterwards shall understand their sin: they shall offer a calf on behalf of their sin, and they shall lead it to the door of the tabernacle.
verses.textLa: et postea intellexerit peccatum suum, offeret pro peccato suo vitulum, adducetque eum ad ostium tabernaculi.

verses.textEn: And the elders of the people shall place their hands upon its head in the sight of the Lord. And when the calf has been immolated in the sight of the Lord,
verses.textLa: Et ponent seniores populi manus super caput eius coram Domino. Immolatoque vitulo in conspectu Domini,

verses.textEn: the priest who is anointed shall carry some of its blood into the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.textLa: inferet sacerdos, qui unctus est, de sanguine eius in tabernaculum testimonii,

verses.textEn: and he shall dip his finger in it, sprinkling it seven times opposite the veil.
verses.textLa: tincto digito aspergens septies contra velum.

verses.textEn: And he shall place some of the same blood on the horns of the altar, which is in the presence of the Lord in the tabernacle of the testimony. But the remainder of the blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of holocaust, which is at the door of the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.textLa: Ponetque de eodem sanguine in cornibus altaris, quod est coram Domino in tabernaculo testimonii: reliquum autem sanguinem fundet iuxta basim altaris holocaustorum, quod est in ostio tabernaculi testimonii.

verses.textEn: And he shall take all its fat and burn it upon the altar,
verses.textLa: Omnemque eius adipem tollet, et adolebit super altare:

verses.textEn: doing so with this calf in the same manner as he did before. And while the priest is praying for them, the Lord will forgive them.
verses.textLa: sic faciens et de hoc vitulo quo modo fecit et prius: et rogante pro eis sacerdote, propitius erit eis Dominus.

verses.textEn: But the calf itself he shall carry away, beyond the camp, and he shall also burn it, just as with the previous calf, because it is for the sin of the multitude.
verses.textLa: Ipsum autem vitulum efferet extra castra, atque comburet sicut et priorem vitulum: quia est pro peccato multitudinis.

verses.textEn: If a leader will have sinned, and through ignorance will have done one of the many things which the law of the Lord prohibits,
verses.textLa: Si peccaverit princeps, et fecerit unum e pluribus per ignorantiam, quod Domini lege prohibetur:

verses.textEn: and afterwards he shall understand his sin: he shall offer an immaculate he-goat from among the goats, as a sacrifice to the Lord.
verses.textLa: et postea intellexerit peccatum suum, offeret hostiam Domino, hircum de capris immaculatum.

verses.textEn: And he shall place his hand upon its head. And when he will have immolated it, in the place where the holocaust is usually slain, in the sight of the Lord, because it is for sin,
verses.textLa: Ponetque manum suam super caput eius: cumque immolaverit eum loco ubi solet mactari holocaustum coram Domino, quia pro peccato est,

verses.textEn: the priest shall dip his finger in the blood of the victim for sin, touching the horns of the altar of holocaust, and pouring out the remainder at its base.
verses.textLa: tinget sacerdos digitum in sanguine hostiæ pro peccato, tangens cornua altaris holocausti, et reliquum fundens ad basim eius.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the fat he shall burn upon it, just as is usually done with the victims of peace offerings. And the priest shall pray for him and for his sin, and he shall be released from it.
verses.textLa: Adipem vero adolebit supra, sicut in victimis pacificorum fieri solet: rogabitque pro eo sacerdos, et pro peccato eius, et dimittetur ei.

verses.textEn: But if a soul from the people of the land will have sinned through ignorance, so as to have done any of those things that the law of the Lord prohibits, and so commit a transgression,
verses.textLa: Quod si peccaverit anima per ignorantiam, de populo terræ, ut faciat quidquam de his, quæ Domini lege prohibentur, atque delinquat,

verses.textEn: and he shall realize his sin: he shall offer an immaculate she-goat.
verses.textLa: et cognoverit peccatum suum, offeret capram immaculatam.

verses.textEn: And he shall place his hand upon the head of the victim which is for sin. And he shall immolate it in the place of the holocaust.
verses.textLa: Ponetque manum super caput hostiæ quæ pro peccato est, et immolabit eam in loco holocausti.

verses.textEn: And the priest shall take some of the blood with his finger, and touching the horns of the altar of holocaust, he shall pour out the remainder at its base.
verses.textLa: Tolletque sacerdos de sanguine in digito suo: et tangens cornua altaris holocausti, reliquum fundet ad basim eius.

verses.textEn: But taking away all the fat, just as it is usually taken away from the victims of peace offerings, he shall burn it upon the altar as a sweet odor to the Lord. And he shall pray for him, and he shall be released from it.
verses.textLa: Omnem autem adipem auferens, sicut auferri solet de victimis pacificorum, adolebit super altare in odorem suavitatis Domino: rogabitque pro eo, et dimittetur ei.

verses.textEn: But if instead he will offer from the flock a victim for his sin, specifically, an immaculate female sheep:
verses.textLa: Sin autem de pecoribus obtulerit victimam pro peccato, ovem scilicet immaculatam;
verses.notes: It is more expedient to use the translation ‘female sheep’ than ‘ewe’ because Scripture is often read aloud, in which case ‘ewe’ sounds identical to ‘you’.

verses.textEn: he shall place his hand upon its head, and he shall immolate it in the place where the victims of holocausts are usually slain.
verses.textLa: ponet manum super caput eius, et immolabit eam in loco ubi solent cædi holocaustorum hostiæ.

verses.textEn: And the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger, and touching the horns of the altar of holocaust, he shall pour out the remainder at its base.
verses.textLa: Sumetque sacerdos de sanguine eius digito suo, et tangens cornua altaris holocausti, reliquum fundet ad basim eius.

verses.textEn: Likewise, all of the fat shall be taken away, just as the fat of the ram, which is immolated for peace offerings, is usually taken away. And he shall burn it upon the altar as an incense of the Lord. And he shall pray for him and for his sin, and he shall be released from it.
verses.textLa: Omnem quoque adipem auferens, sicut auferri solet adeps arietis, qui immolatur pro pacificis: cremabit super altare in incensum Domini: rogabitque pro eo, et pro peccato eius, et dimittetur ei.

verses.textEn: If a soul will have sinned, and heard the voice of one testifying under oath, and he is a witness because either he has seen it himself, or he is aware of it: if he does not reveal it, he shall carry his iniquity.
verses.textLa: Si peccaverit anima, et audierit vocem iurantis, testisque fuerit quod aut ipse vidit, aut conscius est: nisi indicaverit, portabit iniquitatem suam.
verses.notes: The word ‘jurantis’ can be translated as ‘swearing’, but might be misunderstood as if it meant ‘cussing’, so it is translated more loosely and more clearly as ‘testifying under oath.’

verses.textEn: The soul that will have touched anything unclean, either that which has been killed by a beast, or that which has died on its own, or any other creeping thing, and will have forgotten its uncleanness, he is guilty and has committed a transgression.
verses.textLa: Anima, quæ tetigerit aliquid immundum, sive quod occisum a bestia est, aut per se mortuum, aut quodlibet aliud reptile: et oblita fuerit immunditiæ suæ, rea est, et deliquit:

verses.textEn: And if he will have touched anything from the uncleanness of man, according to every kind of impurity by which he may be defiled, and having forgotten it, afterwards realizes it, he shall be guilty of committing a transgression.
verses.textLa: et si tetigerit quidquam de immunditia hominis iuxta omnem impuritatem, qua pollui solet, oblitaque cognoverit postea, subiacebit delicto.

verses.textEn: The soul who swears and offers from his own lips that he would do either evil or good, and who will have bound the same with an oath and with his own words, and, having forgotten it, afterwards understands his transgression,
verses.textLa: Anima, quæ iuraverit, et protulerit labiis suis ut vel male quid faceret, vel bene, et idipsum iuramento et sermone firmaverit, oblitaque postea intellexerit delictum suum,
verses.notes: If he swears to do evil, this is one type of sin; whereas, if he swears to do good and does not do it, this is another type of sin.

verses.textEn: let him do penance for his sin,
verses.textLa: agat pœnitentiam pro peccato,

verses.textEn: and let him offer from the flocks a female lamb or a she-goat, and the priest shall pray for him and for his sin.
verses.textLa: et offerat de gregibus agnam sive capram, orabitque pro ea sacerdos et pro peccato eius:

verses.textEn: But if he is not able to offer a beast, let him offer two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the Lord, one for sin, and the other for a holocaust.
verses.textLa: sin autem non potuerit offerre pecus, offerat duos turtures, vel duos pullos columbarum Domino, unum pro peccato, et alterum in holocaustum,

verses.textEn: And he shall give them to the priest, who, offering the first for sin, shall twist back its head to the little wings, so that it adheres to the neck and is not entirely broken off.
verses.textLa: dabitque eos sacerdoti: qui primum offerens pro peccato, retorquebit caput eius ad pennulas, ita ut collo hæreat, et non penitus abrumpatur.

verses.textEn: And he shall sprinkle some of its blood at the side of the altar. But whatever will remain, he shall cause it to drip down to the base, because it is for sin.
verses.textLa: Et asperget de sanguine eius parietem altaris. Quidquid autem reliquum fuerit, faciet distillare ad fundamentum eius, quia pro peccato est.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the other he shall burn as a holocaust, just as is usually done. And the priest shall pray for him, and for his sin, and he shall be released from it.
verses.textLa: Alterum vero adolebit in holocaustum, ut fieri solet: rogabitque pro eo sacerdos et pro peccato eius, et dimittetur ei.

verses.textEn: But if his hand is unable to offer two turtledoves or two young pigeons, he shall offer, for his sin, the tenth part of an ephah of fine wheat flour. He shall not put oil in it, nor place upon it any frankincense, because it is for sin.
verses.textLa: Quod si non quiverit manus eius duos offerre turtures, aut duos pullos columbarum, offeret pro peccato suo similæ partem ephi decimam. Non mittet in eam oleum, nec thuris aliquid imponet, quia pro peccato est.

verses.textEn: And he shall deliver it to the priest, who shall take a handful of it, and shall burn it upon the altar as a memorial for him who offered it,
verses.textLa: Tradetque eam sacerdoti: qui plenum ex ea pugillum hauriens, cremabit super altare in monimentum eius qui obtulerit,

verses.textEn: praying for him and making atonement. Yet truly, the remaining part he himself shall have as a gift.
verses.textLa: rogans pro illo et expians: reliquam vero partem ipse habebit in munere.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: If a soul, by mistake, shall have transgressed the ceremonies in those things that are sanctified to the Lord, he shall offer for his offense an immaculate ram from the flocks, such as can be bought for two shekels, according to the weight of the Sanctuary.
verses.textLa: Anima si prævaricans ceremonias, per errorem in his, quæ Domino sunt sanctificata, peccaverit, offeret pro delicto suo arietem immaculatum de gregibus, qui emi potest duobus siclis, iuxta pondus Sanctuarii:

verses.textEn: And he shall make restitution for the damage that he has brought, and he shall add a fifth part more, delivering it to the priest, who shall pray for him while offering the ram, and he shall be released from it.
verses.textLa: ipsumque quod intulit damni restituet, et quintam partem ponet supra, tradens sacerdoti, qui rogabit pro eo offerens arietem, et dimittetur ei.

verses.textEn: If a soul will have sinned through ignorance, and will have done one of those things which the law of the Lord prohibits, and, being guilty of sin, understands his iniquity,
verses.textLa: Anima si peccaverit per ignorantiam, feceritque unum ex his quæ Domini lege prohibentur, et peccati rea intellexerit iniquitatem suam,

verses.textEn: he shall offer from the flocks an immaculate ram to the priest, according to the measure and estimation of the sin, who shall pray for him, because he did it unknowingly, and he shall be released from it,
verses.textLa: offeret arietem immaculatum de gregibus sacerdoti, iuxta mensuram, æstimationemque peccati: qui orabit pro eo, quia nesciens fecerit: et dimittetur ei,

verses.textEn: because by mistake he transgressed against the Lord.
verses.textLa: quia per errorem deliquit in Dominum.

verses.textEn: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: The soul who will have sinned, and, despising the Lord, will have denied to his neighbor the deposit which he had entrusted to his safekeeping, or who will have extorted anything by force, or who will have made a false accusation,
verses.textLa: Anima quæ peccaverit, et contempto Domino, negaverit proximo suo depositum quod fidei eius creditum fuerat, vel vi aliquid extorserit, aut calumniam fecerit,

verses.textEn: or who will have found a lost thing and then also withheld it by swearing falsely, or who will have done any other of the many things by which men usually sin:
verses.textLa: sive rem perditam invenerit, et inficians insuper peieraverit, et quodlibet aliud ex pluribus fecerit, in quibus solent peccare homines,

verses.textEn: being convicted of the offense, he shall restore
verses.textLa: convicta delicti, reddet

verses.textEn: all that he wanted to obtain by fraud, the whole plus an additional fifth part, to the owner against whom he brought the damage.
verses.textLa: omnia quæ per fraudem voluit obtinere, integra, et quintam insuper partem domino cui damnum intulerat.

verses.textEn: Then, on behalf of his sin, he shall offer an immaculate ram from the flock, and he shall give it to the priest, according to the estimation and measure of the offense.
verses.textLa: Pro peccato autem suo offeret arietem immaculatum de grege, et dabit eum sacerdoti, iuxta æstimationem, mensuramque delicti:

verses.textEn: And he shall pray for him in the sight of the Lord, and he shall be released from any one of those things that he did when he sinned.
verses.textLa: qui rogabit pro eo coram Domino, et dimittetur illi pro singulis quæ faciendo peccavit.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Instruct Aaron and his sons: This is the law of a holocaust. It shall be burned upon the altar, all night until morning. The fire shall be from the same altar.
verses.textLa: Præcipe Aaron et filiis eius: Hæc est lex holocausti: Cremabitur in altari tota nocte usque mane: ignis ex eodem altari erit.

verses.textEn: The priest shall be vested with the tunic and the linen undergarments. And he shall take up the ashes of that which the devouring fire has consumed, and, placing them next to the altar,
verses.textLa: Vestietur tunica sacerdos et feminalibus lineis: tolletque cineres, quos vorans ignis exussit, et ponens iuxta altare,

verses.textEn: he shall strip off his former vestments, and being clothed with others, he shall carry them beyond the camp, and he shall cause them to be consumed, even to glowing embers, in a very clean place.
verses.textLa: spoliabitur prioribus vestimentis, indutusque aliis, efferret eos extra castra, et in loco mundissimo usque ad favillam consumi faciet.

verses.textEn: But the fire on the altar shall burn always, for the priest shall nourish it by placing wood under it each day in the morning. And, laying down the holocaust, he shall burn the fat of the peace offerings upon it.
verses.textLa: Ignis autem in altari semper ardebit, quem nutriet sacerdos subiiciens ligna mane per singulos dies, et imposito holocausto, desuper adolebit adipes pacificorum.

verses.textEn: This is the perpetual fire which shall never fail upon the altar.
verses.textLa: Ignis est iste perpetuus, qui numquam deficiet in altari.

verses.textEn: This is the law of the sacrifice and the libations, which the sons of Aaron shall offer in the sight of the Lord, and before the altar.
verses.textLa: Hæc est lex sacrificii et libamentorum, quæ offerent filii Aaron coram Domino, et coram altari.

verses.textEn: The priest shall take a handful of fine wheat flour, which has been sprinkled with oil, and all the frankincense, which has been placed upon the flour, and he shall burn it upon the altar as a memorial of most sweet odor to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Tollet sacerdos pugillum similæ, quæ conspersa est oleo, et totum thus, quod super similam positum est: adolebitque illud in altari in monimentum odoris suavissimi Domino:

verses.textEn: And the remaining portion of the flour, Aaron shall eat with his sons, without leaven. And he shall eat it in the holy place, in the atrium of the tabernacle.
verses.textLa: reliquam autem partem similæ comedet Aaron cum filiis suis, absque fermento: et comedet in loco sancto atrii tabernaculi.

verses.textEn: Yet for this reason, it shall not be leavened, because part of it is offered as an incense of the Lord. The Holy of holies shall it be, just as what is offered on behalf of sin and of transgression.
verses.textLa: Ideo autem non fermentabitur, quia pars eius in Domini offertur incensum. Sanctum sanctorum erit, sicut pro peccato atque delicto.

verses.textEn: Only the males of the stock of Aaron shall eat it. This shall be an everlasting ordinance in your generations concerning the sacrifices of the Lord. All who will touch these shall be sanctified.
verses.textLa: Mares tantum stirpis Aaron comedent illud. Legitimum ac sempiternum erit in generationibus vestris de sacrificiis Domini. Omnis, qui tetigerit illa, sanctificabitur.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: This is the oblation of Aaron and of his sons, which they must offer to the Lord in the day of their anointing. They shall offer a tenth part of an ephah of fine wheat flour as a perpetual sacrifice, half of it in the morning, and half of it in the evening.
verses.textLa: Hæc est oblatio Aaron, et filiorum eius, quam offerre debent Domino in die unctionis suæ. Decimam partem ephi offerent similæ in sacrificio sempiterno, medium eius mane, et medium eius vespere:

verses.textEn: It shall be sprinkled with oil and fried in a frying pan. Then it shall be offered hot, as a most sweet odor to the Lord,
verses.textLa: quæ in sartagine oleo conspersa frigetur. Offeret autem eam calidam in odorem suavissimum Domino

verses.textEn: by the priest who by law succeeds his father. And it shall be entirely burned on the altar.
verses.textLa: sacerdos, qui iure patri successerit, et tota cremabitur in altari.

verses.textEn: For every sacrifice of the priest shall be consumed by fire; neither shall anyone eat from it.
verses.textLa: Omne enim sacrificium sacerdotum igne consumetur, nec quisquam comedet ex eo.

verses.textEn: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutus est autem Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Say to Aaron and his sons: This is the law of the victim for sin. In the place where the holocaust is offered, it shall be immolated in the sight of the Lord. It is the Holy of holies.
verses.textLa: Loquere Aaron et filiis eius: Ista est lex hostiæ pro peccato: In loco ubi offertur holocaustum, immolabitur coram Domino. Sanctum sanctorum est.

verses.textEn: The priest who offers it shall eat it in the holy place, in the atrium of the tabernacle.
verses.textLa: Sacerdos qui offert, comedet eam in loco Sancto, in atrio tabernaculi.

verses.textEn: Whatever will touch its flesh shall be sanctified. If a garment will be sprinkled with its blood, it shall be washed in a holy place.
verses.textLa: Quidquid tetigerit carnes eius, sanctificabitur. Si de sanguine illius vestis fuerit aspersa, lavabitur in loco sancto.

verses.textEn: Then the earthen vessel, in which it was soaked, shall be broken. But if the vessel will be of brass, it shall be scoured and washed with water.
verses.textLa: Vas autem fictile, in quo cocta est, confringetur. Quod si vas æneum fuerit, defricabitur, et lavabitur aqua.

verses.textEn: Every male of priestly descent shall feed on its flesh, because it is the Holy of holies.
verses.textLa: Omnis masculus de genere sacerdotali vescetur de carnibus eius, quia Sanctum sanctorum est.

verses.textEn: For the victim that is slain for sin, whose blood is carried into the tabernacle of the testimony, for expiation in the Sanctuary, shall not be eaten, but it shall be consumed by fire.
verses.textLa: Hostia enim quæ cæditur pro peccato, cuius sanguis infertur in tabernaculum testimonii ad expiandum in Sanctuario, non comedetur, sed comburetur igni.

verses.textEn: Likewise, this is the law of the sacrifice for a transgression. It is the Holy of holies.
verses.textLa: Hæc quoque lex hostiæ pro delicto, Sancta sanctorum est:

verses.textEn: Therefore, where the holocaust is immolated, the victim for a transgression shall also be slain. Its blood shall be poured out all around the altar.
verses.textLa: idcirco ubi immolabitur holocaustum, mactabitur et victima pro delicto: sanguis eius per gyrum altaris fundetur.

verses.textEn: They shall offer from it: the rump, and the fat that covers the vital organs,
verses.textLa: Offerent ex ea caudam et adipem qui operit vitalia,

verses.textEn: the two little kidneys, and the fat that is near the sides, and the mesh of the liver with the little kidneys.
verses.textLa: duos renunculos, et pinguedinem quæ iuxta ilia est, reticulumque iecoris cum renunculis.

verses.textEn: And the priest shall burn them upon the altar. It is the incense of the Lord on behalf of a transgression.
verses.textLa: Et adolebit ea sacerdos super altare: incensum est Domini pro delicto.

verses.textEn: Every male of priestly descent shall feed on this flesh in a holy place, because it is the Holy of holies.
verses.textLa: Omnis masculus de sacerdotali genere, in loco sancto vescetur his carnibus, quia Sanctum sanctorum est.

verses.textEn: Just as the sacrifice for sin is offered, so also for a transgression; one law shall be for both sacrifices. It shall belong to the priest who offers it.
verses.textLa: Sicut pro peccato offertur hostia, ita et pro delicto: utriusque hostiæ lex una erit: ad sacerdotem, qui eam obtulerit, pertinebit.

verses.textEn: The priest who offers the victim of holocaust shall have its skin.
verses.textLa: Sacerdos qui offert holocausti victimam, habebit pellem eius.

verses.textEn: And every sacrifice of fine wheat flour which is baked in the oven, and whatever is prepared on the oven grating or in the frying pan, shall be for the priest who offers it.
verses.textLa: Et omne sacrificium similæ, quod coquitur in clibano, et quidquid in craticula, vel in sartagine præparatur, eius erit sacerdotis a quo offertur:

verses.textEn: Whether these will be sprinkled with oil, or left dry, an equal measure shall be divided to each one of the sons of Aaron.
verses.textLa: sive oleo conspersa, sive arida fuerint, cunctis filiis Aaron mensura æqua per singulos dividetur.

verses.textEn: This is the law of the victim of peace offerings, which is offered to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Hæc est lex hostiæ pacificorum quæ offertur Domino.

verses.textEn: If the oblation will be an act for giving thanks, they shall offer bread without leaven sprinkled with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and fine wheat flour fried, and cakes sprinkled and mixed with oil,
verses.textLa: Si pro gratiarum actione oblatio fuerit, offerent panes absque fermento conspersos oleo, et lagana azyma uncta oleo, coctamque similam, et collyridas olei admistione conspersas:

verses.textEn: and also, leavened bread with the sacrifice of thanksgiving, which is immolated for peace offerings.
verses.textLa: panes quoque fermentatos cum hostia gratiarum, quæ immolatur pro pacificis:

verses.textEn: Of these, one shall be offered to the Lord as the first-fruits, and one shall be for the priest who will pour out the blood of the victim.
verses.textLa: ex quibus unus pro primitiis offeretur Domino, et erit sacerdotis qui fundet hostiæ sanguinem.

verses.textEn: The flesh of it shall be eaten on the same day; neither shall any of it remain until morning.
verses.textLa: Cuius carnes eadem comedentur die, nec remanebit ex eis quidquam usque mane.

verses.textEn: If anyone, by a vow or of his own accord, will have offered a sacrifice, it shall be eaten in a similar manner on the same day. But then if any of it will have remained until tomorrow, it is lawful to eat it.
verses.textLa: Si voto, vel sponte quispiam obtulerit hostiam, eadem similiter edetur die: sed et si quid in crastinum remanserit, vesci licitum est:

verses.textEn: Then whatever will be found on the third day shall be consumed with fire.
verses.textLa: quidquid autem tertius invenerit dies, ignis absumet.

verses.textEn: If anyone will have eaten from the flesh of the victim of peace offerings on the third day, the oblation will be nullified; neither will it benefit the one who offered it. But instead, whatever soul will contaminate itself with such foods will be guilty of a betrayal.
verses.textLa: Si quis de carnibus victimæ pacificorum die tertio comederit, irrita fiet oblatio, nec proderit offerenti: quin potius quæcumque anima tali se edulio contaminaverit, prævaricationis rea erit.

verses.textEn: The flesh that has touched anything unclean shall not be eaten, but it shall be burnt with fire. He that is clean will feed on it.
verses.textLa: Caro, quæ aliquid tetigerit immundum, non comedetur, sed comburetur igni: qui fuerit mundus, vescetur ex ea.
verses.notes: The phrase ‘he that is clean’ may refer to the Lord, because the burned flesh is consumed due to God’s law. Or it may refer to the cleansing fire; the fire cleans it by feeding on it.

verses.textEn: If a soul which is polluted will have eaten from the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which is offered to the Lord, he shall perish from his people.
verses.textLa: Anima polluta quæ ederit de carnibus hostiæ pacificorum, quæ oblata est Domino, peribit de populis suis.

verses.textEn: And whoever will have touched the uncleanness of man, or of beast, or of anything which is able to defile, and who will have eaten from this kind of flesh, shall be cut off from his people.
verses.textLa: Et quæ tetigerit immunditiam hominis, vel iumenti, sive omnis rei, quæ polluere potest, et comederit de huiuscemodi carnibus, interibit de populis suis.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Say to the sons of Israel: The fat of a sheep, and of an ox, and of a goat you shall not eat.
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel: Adipem ovis, et bovis, et capræ non comedetis.

verses.textEn: The fat of a carcass that has died on its own, or of an animal that has been seized by a wild beast, you shall have for various uses.
verses.textLa: Adipem cadaveris morticini, et eius animalis, quod a bestia captum est, habebitis in varios usus.

verses.textEn: If anyone will have eaten the fat which ought to be offered as a burnt sacrifice of the Lord, he shall perish from his people.
verses.textLa: Si quis adipem, qui offerri debet in incensum Domini, comederit, peribit de populo suo.

verses.textEn: Likewise, you shall not take as food the blood of any animals at all, whether of birds or beasts.
verses.textLa: Sanguinem quoque omnis animalis non sumetis in cibo, tam de avibus quam de pecoribus.

verses.textEn: Every soul that will have eaten blood shall perish from his people.
verses.textLa: Omnis anima, quæ ederit sanguinem, peribit de populis suis.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to the sons of Israel, saying: Whoever offers a victim of peace offerings to the Lord, let him also offer at the same time a sacrifice, that is, its libations.
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel, dicens: Qui offert victimam pacificorum Domino, offerat simul et sacrificium, id est, libamenta eius.

verses.textEn: He shall hold in his hands the fat of the victim, and the breast. And when he will have offered and consecrated both to the Lord, he shall deliver them to the priest,
verses.textLa: Tenebit manibus adipem hostiæ, et pectusculum: cumque ambo oblata Domino consecraverit, tradet sacerdoti,

verses.textEn: who shall burn the fat upon the altar. But the breast shall be for Aaron and his sons.
verses.textLa: qui adolebit adipem super altare: pectusculum autem erit Aaron, et filiorum eius.

verses.textEn: Likewise also, the right shoulder of the victim of peace offerings shall fall to the priest as first-fruits.
verses.textLa: Armus quoque dexter de pacificorum hostiis cedet in primitias sacerdotis.

verses.textEn: Among the sons of Aaron, whoever will have offered the blood and the fat, the same one shall also have the right shoulder for his portion.
verses.textLa: Qui obtulerit sanguinem et adipem, filiorum Aaron, ipse habebit et armum dextrum in portione sua.

verses.textEn: So then, the breast that is lifted up, and the shoulder that is separated, I have taken from the sons of Israel, from their victims of peace offerings, and I have given these to Aaron the priest and to his sons, as a law in perpetuity, from all the people of Israel.
verses.textLa: Pectusculum enim elevationis, et armum separationis tuli a filiis Israel de hostiis eorum pacificis, et dedi Aaron sacerdoti, et filiis eius lege perpetua, ab omni populo Israel.

verses.textEn: This is the anointing of Aaron and his sons, by the ceremonies of the Lord, in the day when Moses offered them, so that they may fulfill the priesthood,
verses.textLa: Hæc est unctio Aaron et filiorum eius in ceremoniis Domini die qua obtulit eos Moyses, ut sacerdotio fungerentur,

verses.textEn: and this is what the Lord instructed to be given to them by the sons of Israel, as a perpetual observance in their generations.
verses.textLa: et quæ præcepit eis dari Dominus a filiis Israel religione perpetua in generationibus suis.

verses.textEn: This is the law of the holocaust, and of the sacrifice for sin, and for transgression, and for consecration, and for the victims of peace offerings,
verses.textLa: Ista est lex holocausti, et sacrificii pro peccato atque delicto, et pro consecratione et pacificorum victimis:

verses.textEn: which the Lord appointed to Moses on mount Sinai, when he commanded the sons of Israel to offer their oblations to the Lord in the desert of Sinai.
verses.textLa: quam constituit Dominus Moysi in monte Sinai, quando mandabit filiis Israel ut offerrent oblationes suas Domino in deserto Sinai.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Take Aaron, with his sons, their vestments, and the oil of anointing, a calf for sin, two rams, and a basket with unleavened bread,
verses.textLa: Tolle Aaron cum filiis suis, vestes eorum, et unctionis oleum, vitulum pro peccato, duos arietes, canistrum cum azymis,

verses.textEn: and gather together all the assembly at the door of the tabernacle.
verses.textLa: et congregabis omnem cœtum ad ostium tabernaculi.

verses.textEn: And Moses did as the Lord had commanded. And when all the crowd was gathered together before the entrance of the tabernacle,
verses.textLa: Fecit Moyses ut Dominus imperaverat. Congregataque omni turba ante fores tabernaculi,

verses.textEn: he said: “This is the word that the Lord has ordered to be done.”
verses.textLa: ait: Iste est sermo, quem iussit Dominus fieri.

verses.textEn: And immediately, he brought forward Aaron and his sons. And when he had washed them,
verses.textLa: Statimque obtulit Aaron et filios eius. Cumque lavisset eos,

verses.textEn: he vested the high priest with the linen undergarment, wrapped him with the wide belt, and clothed him with the hyacinth tunic, and over it he imposed the ephod.
verses.textLa: vestivit pontificem subucula linea, accingens eum balteo, et induens eum tunica hyacinthina, et desuper humerale imposuit,

verses.textEn: And tying it to the belt, he fitted it to the breastplate, on which was Doctrine and Truth.
verses.textLa: quod astringens cingulo aptavit rationali, in quo erat Doctrina et Veritas.

verses.textEn: Also, he wrapped the headdress on his head, and over it, opposite the forehead, he placed the plate of gold, consecrated with sanctification, just as the Lord had instructed him.
verses.textLa: Cidari quoque texit caput: et super eam, contra frontem, posuit laminam auream consecratam in sanctificatione, sicut præceperat ei Dominus.

verses.textEn: He also took up the oil of anointing, with which he anointed the tabernacle, along with all of its articles.
verses.textLa: Tulit et unctionis oleum, quo linivit tabernaculum cum omni supellectili sua.

verses.textEn: And when he had sprinkled the altar seven times to sanctify it, he anointed it and all its vessels. And the washtub with its base he sanctified with the oil.
verses.textLa: Cumque sanctificans aspersisset altare septem vicibus, unxit illud, et omnia vasa eius, labrumque cum basi sua sanctificavit oleo.

verses.textEn: And pouring the oil over Aaron’s head, he anointed and consecrated him.
verses.textLa: Quod fundens super caput Aaron, unxit eum, et consecravit:

verses.textEn: Likewise, after he had offered his sons, he vested them with linen tunics, and wrapped them with wide belts, and placed headdresses on them, just as the Lord had ordered.
verses.textLa: filios quoque eius oblatos vestivit tunicis lineis, et cinxit balteis, imposuitque mitras, ut iusserat Dominus.

verses.textEn: He also offered the calf for sin. And when Aaron and his sons had placed their hands upon its head,
verses.textLa: Obtulit et vitulum pro peccato. Cumque super caput eius posuisset Aaron, et filii eius manus suas,

verses.textEn: he immolated it. And drawing the blood, and dipping his finger in it, he touched the horns of the altar all around. And when it was expiated and sanctified, he poured out the remainder of the blood at its base.
verses.textLa: immolavit eum: hauriens sanguinem, et tincto digito, tetigit cornua altaris per gyrum. Quo expiato et sanctificato, fudit reliquum sanguinem ad fundamenta eius.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the fat which was on the vital organs, and the mesh of the liver, and the two little kidneys with their fat, he burned upon the altar.
verses.textLa: Adipem vero qui erat super vitalia, et reticulum iecoris, duosque renunculos, cum arvinulis suis adolevit super altare:

verses.textEn: And the calf with the skin, and the flesh, and the dung, he burned beyond the camp, just as the Lord had instructed.
verses.textLa: vitulum cum pelle, et carnibus, et fimo, cremans extra castra, sicut præceperat Dominus.

verses.textEn: He also offered a ram as a holocaust. And when Aaron and his sons had imposed their hands upon its head,
verses.textLa: Obtulit et arietem in holocaustum: super cuius caput cum imposuissent Aaron et filii eius manus suas,

verses.textEn: he immolated it, and he poured out its blood around the altar.
verses.textLa: immolavit eum, et fudit sanguinem eius per circuitum altaris.

verses.textEn: And cutting the ram into pieces, he burned its head, and the limbs, and the fat in the fire,
verses.textLa: Ipsumque arietem in frusta concidens, caput eius, et artus, et adipem adolevit igni,

verses.textEn: having first washed the intestines and the feet. And then he burned the whole of the ram upon the altar, because it was a holocaust of most sweet odor to the Lord, just as he had instructed him.
verses.textLa: lotis prius intestinis et pedibus. Totumque simul arietem incendit super altare, eo quod esset holocaustum suavissimi odoris Domino, sicut præceperat ei.
verses.notes: It is unclear from the text whether all of the pieces were burned at the same time, or if some pieces (verse 20) were burned first (head, limbs, etc.), and then the remaining whole of the ram, i.e. the main body of the ram which was not cut up, was burned separately.

verses.textEn: He also offered the second ram, as a consecration of priests. And Aaron and his sons placed their hands upon its head.
verses.textLa: Obtulit et arietem secundum, in consecratione sacerdotum: posueruntque super caput eius Aaron et filii eius manus suas.

verses.textEn: And when Moses had immolated it, taking up some of its blood, he touched the tip of Aaron’s right ear, and the thumb of his right hand, and similarly also his foot.
verses.textLa: Quem cum immolasset Moyses, sumens de sanguine eius, tetigit extremum auriculæ dextræ Aaron, et pollicem manus eius dextræ, similiter et pedis.

verses.textEn: He also offered the sons of Aaron. And when, from the blood of the ram which was immolated, he had touched the tip of the right ear of each one, and the thumbs of their right hands, as well as their feet, he poured out the remainder upon the altar all around.
verses.textLa: Obtulit et filios Aaron. Cumque de sanguine arietis immolati tetigisset extremum auriculæ singulorum dextræ, et pollices manus ac pedis dextri, reliquum fudit super altare per circuitum:

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the fat, and the rump, and all the fat that covers the intestines, and the mesh of the liver, and the two kidneys with their fat, and the right shoulder, he separated.
verses.textLa: adipem vero, et caudam, omnemque pinguedinem quæ operit intestina, reticulumque iecoris, et duos renes cum adipibus suis, et armo dextro separavit.

verses.textEn: Then, taking bread without leaven from the basket of unleavened bread, which was before the Lord, and a cake sprinkled with oil, and a wafer, he placed them upon the fat and the right shoulder,
verses.textLa: Tollens autem de canistro azymorum, quod erat coram Domino, panem absque fermento, et collyridam conspersam oleo, laganumque posuit super adipes, et armum dextrum,

verses.textEn: delivering all these to Aaron and his sons. And when they had lifted them up in the sight of the Lord,
verses.textLa: tradens simul omnia Aaron et filiis eius. Qui postquam levaverunt ea coram Domino,

verses.textEn: he received them again from their hands, and he burned them upon the altar of holocaust, because it was an oblation of consecration, as a sweet odor of sacrifice to the Lord.
verses.textLa: rursum suscepta de manibus eorum, adolevit super altare holocausti, eo quod consecrationis esset oblatio, in odorem suavitatis, sacrificii Domino.

verses.textEn: And he took his portion from the ram of consecration, and he lifted up its breast in the sight of the Lord, just as the Lord had instructed him.
verses.textLa: Tulitque pectusculum elevans illud coram Domino, de ariete consecrationis in partem suam, sicut præceperat ei Dominus.

verses.textEn: And taking up the ointment, and the blood that was on the altar, he sprinkled it over Aaron and his vestments, and over his sons and their vestments.
verses.textLa: Assumensque unguentum, et sanguinem qui erat in altari, aspersit super Aaron et vestimenta eius, et super filios illius ac vestes eorum.

verses.textEn: And when he had sanctified them with their vestments, he instructed them, saying: “Cook the flesh before the entrance of the tabernacle, and eat it there. Likewise, eat the loaves of consecration, which have been placed in the basket, just as the Lord instructed me, saying: ‘Aaron and his sons shall eat them.’
verses.textLa: Cumque sanctificasset eos in vestitu suo, præcepit eis, dicens: Coquite carnes ante fores tabernaculi, et ibi comedite eas. Panes quoque consecrationis edite, qui positi sunt in canistro, sicut præcepit mihi Dominus, dicens: Aaron et filii eius comedent eos:

verses.textEn: Then whatever will remain of the flesh and the loaves shall be consumed with fire.
verses.textLa: quidquid autem reliquum fuerit de carne et panibus, ignis absumet.

verses.textEn: Also, you shall not exit from the door of the tabernacle for seven days, until the day on which the time of your consecration shall be completed. For in seven days the consecration is finished,
verses.textLa: De ostio quoque tabernaculi non exibitis septem diebus, usque ad diem quo complebitur tempus consecrationis vestræ. Septem enim diebus finitur consecratio:

verses.textEn: even as it has begun at this present time, so that the rite of the sacrifice might be accomplished.
verses.textLa: sicut et impræsentiarum factum est, ut ritus sacrificii compleretur.

verses.textEn: Day and night you shall remain in the tabernacle, observing the watches of the Lord, otherwise you shall die. For so it has been commanded to me.”
verses.textLa: Die ac nocte manebitis in tabernaculo observantes custodias Domini, ne moriamini: sic enim mihi præceptum est.

verses.textEn: And Aaron and his sons did everything that the Lord spoke by the hand of Moses.
verses.textLa: Feceruntque Aaron et filii eius cuncta quæ locutus est Dominus per manum Moysi.

verses.textEn: Then, the eighth day having arrived, Moses called Aaron and his sons, and those greater by birth from Israel, and he said to Aaron:
verses.textLa: Facto autem octavo die, vocavit Moyses Aaron et filios eius, ac maiores natu Israel, dixitque ad Aaron:

verses.textEn: “Take a calf for sin from the herd, and a ram as a holocaust, both immaculate, and offer them in the sight of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Tolle de armento vitulum pro peccato, et arietem in holocaustum, utrumque immaculatum, et offer illos coram Domino.

verses.textEn: And to the sons of Israel, you shall say: ‘Take a he-goat for sin, and a calf as well as a lamb, both one-year-old and without blemish, as a holocaust.
verses.textLa: Et ad filios Israel loqueris: Tollite hircum pro peccato, et vitulum, atque agnum anniculos, et sine macula in holocaustum,
verses.notes: The word ‘anniculos’ is plural, so it refers to both the calf and the lamb. The word ‘atque’ unites those two more closely than the word ‘et’ unites them with ‘hircum’.

verses.textEn: Take also an ox and a ram for peace offerings. And immolate them before the Lord, offering with the sacrifice of each one fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil. For today the Lord will appear to you.’ ”
verses.textLa: bovem et arietem pro pacificis: et immolate eos coram Domino, in sacrificio singulorum similam conspersam oleo offerentes. Hodie enim Dominus apparebit vobis.

verses.textEn: And so they brought everything that Moses had ordered before the door of the tabernacle, where, when all the multitude stood together,
verses.textLa: Tulerunt ergo cuncta quæ iusserat Moyses ad ostium tabernaculi: ubi cum omnis multitudo astaret,

verses.textEn: Moses said: “This is the word, which the Lord has instructed. Accomplish it, and his glory will appear to you.”
verses.textLa: ait Moyses: Iste est sermo, quem præcepit Dominus: facite, et apparebit vobis gloria eius.

verses.textEn: And he said to Aaron: “Approach toward the altar, and immolate on behalf of your sin. Offer the holocaust, and pray for yourself and for the people. And when you have slain the victim for the people, pray for them, just as the Lord has instructed.”
verses.textLa: Et dixit ad Aaron: Accede ad altare, et immola pro peccato tuo: offer holocaustum, et deprecare pro te et pro populo. Cumque mactaveris hostiam populi, ora pro eo, sicut præcepit Dominus.

verses.textEn: And immediately Aaron, approaching toward the altar, immolated the calf for his sin.
verses.textLa: Statimque Aaron accedens ad altare, immolavit vitulum pro peccato suo:

verses.textEn: And his sons brought its blood to him, and dipping his finger in it, he touched the horns of the altar, and he poured out the remainder at its base.
verses.textLa: cuius sanguinem obtulerunt ei filii sui: in quo tingens digitum, tetigit cornua altaris, et fudit residuum ad basim eius.

verses.textEn: And the fat, and the little kidneys, and the mesh of the liver, which are for sin, he burned upon the altar, just as the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: Adipemque et renunculos, ac reticulum iecoris, quæ sunt pro peccato, adolevit super altare, sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi:

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the flesh and its skins he burned with fire beyond the camp.
verses.textLa: carnes vero et pellem eius extra castra combussit igni.

verses.textEn: He also immolated the victim of holocaust. And his sons brought its blood to him, which he poured out all around the altar.
verses.textLa: Immolavit et holocausti victimam: obtuleruntque ei filii sui sanguinem eius, quem fudit per altaris circuitum.

verses.textEn: And when the victim itself was cut into pieces, they brought him the head and each of the limbs, all of which he burned with fire upon the altar,
verses.textLa: Ipsam etiam hostiam in frusta concisam, cum capite et membris singulis obtulerunt. Quæ omnia super altare cremavit igni,

verses.textEn: having first washed the intestines and the feet with water.
verses.textLa: lotis aqua prius intestinis et pedibus.

verses.textEn: And making an offering for the sin of the people, he slew the he-goat. And expiating the altar,
verses.textLa: Et pro peccato populi offerens, mactavit hircum: expiatoque altari,

verses.textEn: he accomplished the holocaust,
verses.textLa: fecit holocaustum,

verses.textEn: adding to it the sacrifice of the libations, which are to be offered together, and burning them upon the altar, separately from the ceremonies of the morning holocaust.
verses.textLa: addens in sacrificio libamenta, quæ pariter offeruntur, et adolens ea super altare, absque ceremoniis holocausti matutini.

verses.textEn: He also immolated the ox, as well as the ram, as peace offerings for the people. And his sons brought him the blood, which he poured out upon the altar all around.
verses.textLa: Immolavit et bovem atque arietem, hostias pacificas populi: obtuleruntque ei filii sui sanguinem, quem fudit super altare in circuitum.

verses.textEn: Then the fat of the ox, and the rump of the ram, and the two little kidneys with their fat, and the mesh of the liver,
verses.textLa: Adipem autem bovis, et caudam arietis, renunculosque cum adipibus suis, et reticulum iecoris

verses.textEn: they placed upon the breasts. And when the fat had been burned upon the altar,
verses.textLa: posuerunt super pectora. Cumque cremati essent adipes super altare,

verses.textEn: Aaron separated their breasts and the right shoulders, lifting them up in the sight of the Lord, as Moses had instructed.
verses.textLa: pectora eorum, et armos dextros separavit Aaron, elevans coram Domino, sicut præceperat Moyses.

verses.textEn: And extending his hands to the people, he blessed them. And so, the victims for sin, and the holocausts, and the peace offerings being completed, he descended.
verses.textLa: Et extendens manus ad populum, benedixit ei. Sicque completis hostiis pro peccato, et holocaustis, et pacificis, descendit.

verses.textEn: Then Moses and Aaron entered the tabernacle of the testimony, and afterwards came out and blessed the people. And the glory of the Lord appeared to the entire multitude.
verses.textLa: Ingressi autem Moyses et Aaron in tabernaculum testimonii, et deinceps egressi benedixerunt populo. Apparuitque gloria Domini omni multitudini:

verses.textEn: And, behold, a fire from the Lord devoured the holocaust, and the fat which was on the altar. When the crowd had seen this, they praised the Lord, falling on their faces.
verses.textLa: et ecce egressus ignis a Domino, devoravit holocaustum, et adipes qui erant super altare. Quod cum vidissent turbæ, laudaverunt Dominum, ruentes in facies suas.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, picking up their censers, placed fire in them and incense upon them, offering in the sight of the Lord a strange fire, such as was not instructed of them.
verses.textLa: Arreptisque Nadab, et Abiu filii Aaron thuribulis, posuerunt ignem, et incensum desuper, offerentes coram Domino ignem alienum: quod eis præceptum non erat.

verses.textEn: And fire coming out from the Lord destroyed them, and they died in the sight of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Egressusque ignis a Domino, devoravit eos, et mortui sunt coram Domino.

verses.textEn: And Moses said to Aaron: “This is what the Lord has spoken: ‘I will be sanctified in those who approach me, and I will be glorified in the sight of all the people.’ ” And upon hearing this, Aaron was silent.
verses.textLa: Dixitque Moyses ad Aaron: Hoc est quod locutus est Dominus: Sanctificabor in iis, qui appropinquant mihi, et in conspectu omnis populi glorificabor. Quod audiens tacuit Aaron.

verses.textEn: Then Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel, the paternal uncle of Aaron, and he said to them, “Go and take your brothers from the sight of the Sanctuary, and carry them beyond the camp.”
verses.textLa: Vocatis autem Moyses Misaele, et Elisaphan filiis Oziel, patrui Aaron, ait ad eos: Ite et tollite fratres vestros de conspectu Sanctuarii, et asportate extra castra.

verses.textEn: And moving quickly, they took them as they lay, vested with linen tunics, and cast them outside, just as had been commanded them.
verses.textLa: Confestimque pergentes, tulerunt eos sicut iacebant, vestitos lineis tunicis, et eiecerunt foras, ut sibi fuerat imperatum.

verses.textEn: And Moses said to Aaron, and to his sons, Eleazar and Ithamar: “Do not uncover your heads, and do not rend your garments, lest perhaps you may die, and indignation may rise up over the entire assembly. Let your brothers, and all the house of Israel, bewail the burning that the Lord has kindled.
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Moyses ad Aaron, et ad Eleazar, et Ithamar filios eius: Capita vestra nolite nudare, et vestimenta nolite scindere, ne forte moriamini, et super omnem cœtum oriatur indignatio. Fratres vestri, et omnis domus Israel plangant incendium quod Dominus suscitavit:

verses.textEn: But you shall not depart from the door of the tabernacle; otherwise, you shall perish. For certainly the oil of holy anointing is upon you.” And they did all things according to the precept of Moses.
verses.textLa: vos autem non egrediemini fores tabernaculi, alioquin peribitis: oleum quippe sanctæ unctionis est super vos. Qui fecerunt omnia iuxta præceptum Moysi.

verses.textEn: The Lord also said to Aaron:
verses.textLa: Dixit quoque Dominus ad Aaron:

verses.textEn: “You shall not drink wine, nor anything that is able to inebriate you or your sons, when you enter into the tabernacle of the testimony, lest you die. For it is an everlasting precept in your generations.
verses.textLa: Vinum, et omne quod inebriare potest, non bibetis tu et filii tui, quando intratis in tabernaculum testimonii, ne moriamini: quia præceptum sempiternum est in generationes vestras.

verses.textEn: And so may you have the knowledge to discern between holy and profane, between polluted and clean.
verses.textLa: Et ut habeatis scientiam discernendi inter sanctum et profanum, inter pollutum et mundum:

verses.textEn: And so may you teach the sons of Israel all my ordinances, which the Lord has spoken to them by the hand of Moses.”
verses.textLa: doceatisque filios Israel omnia legitima mea quæ locutus est Dominus ad eos per manum Moysi.

verses.textEn: And Moses spoke to Aaron, and to his sons, Eleazar and Ithamar, who were remaining: “Take the sacrifice which remains from the oblation of the Lord, and eat it without leaven next to the altar, because it is the Holy of holies.
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Moyses ad Aaron, et ad Eleazar, et Ithamar filios eius, qui erant residui: Tollite sacrificium, quod remansit de oblatione Domini, et comedite illud absque fermento iuxta altare, quia Sanctum sanctorum est.

verses.textEn: For you shall eat it in a holy place, which is given to you and to your sons, from the oblations of the Lord, just as has been instructed me.
verses.textLa: Comedetis autem in loco sancto: quod datum est tibi et filiis tuis de oblationibus Domini, sicut præceptum est mihi.

verses.textEn: Likewise, the breast which is offered, and the shoulder which is separated, you shall eat in a most clean place, you and your sons, and your daughters with you. For these have been set aside for you and your children from the victims which benefit the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Pectusculum quoque quod oblatum est, et armum qui separatus est, edetis in loco mundissimo tu et filii tui, et filiæ tuæ tecum. Tibi enim ac liberis tuis reposita sunt de hostiis salutaribus filiorum Israel:

verses.textEn: Since they have lifted up in the sight of the Lord, the shoulder, and the breast, and the fat that is burned on the altar, these also belong to you and to your sons as a perpetual law, just as the Lord has instructed.”
verses.textLa: eo quod armum et pectus, et adipes qui cremantur in altari, elevaverunt coram Domino, et pertineant ad te, et ad filios tuos lege perpetua, sicut præcepit Dominus.

verses.textEn: Meanwhile, when Moses was searching for the he-goat, which had been offered for sin, he discovered it burned up. And being angry against Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron who were remaining, he said:
verses.textLa: Inter hæc, hircum, qui oblatus fuerat pro peccato, cum quæreret Moyses, exustum reperit: iratusque contra Eleazar et Ithamar filios Aaron, qui remanserant, ait:

verses.textEn: “Why did you not eat the sacrifice for sin in the holy place, which is the Holy of holies, and which was given to you, so that you might carry the iniquity of the people, and might pray for them in the sight of the Lord,
verses.textLa: Cur non comedistis hostiam pro peccato in loco sancto, quæ Sancta sanctorum est, et data vobis ut portetis iniquitatem multitudinis, et rogetis pro ea in conspectu Domini,

verses.textEn: especially since none of its blood has been brought into the holy places, and since you should have eaten it in the Sanctuary, as was instructed me?”
verses.textLa: præsertim cum de sanguine illius non sit illatum intra sancta, et comedere debueritis eam in Sanctuario, sicut præceptum est mihi?

verses.textEn: Aaron responded: “This day, the victim for sin has been offered, and the holocaust in the sight of the Lord. But you see what has happened to me. How could I eat it, or please the Lord in the ceremonies, having a sorrowful mind?”
verses.textLa: Respondit Aaron: Oblata est hodie victima pro peccato, et holocaustum coram Domino: mihi autem accidit quod vides. Quomodo potui comedere eam, aut placere Domino in ceremoniis mente lugubri?

verses.textEn: But when Moses had heard this, he was satisfied.
verses.textLa: Quod cum audisset Moyses, recepit satisfactionem.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:

verses.textEn: Say to the sons of Israel: These are the animals that you ought to eat out of all the living things of the earth.
verses.textLa: Dicite filiis Israel: Hæc sunt animalia quæ comedere debetis de cunctis animantibus terræ:

verses.textEn: All that has a divided hoof, and that chews over again, among the cattle, you shall eat.
verses.textLa: Omne quod habet divisam ungulam, et ruminat in pecoribus, comedetis.

verses.textEn: But whatever certainly chews over again, but has a hoof that is not divided, such as the camel and others, these you shall not eat, and you shall consider them to be among what is unclean.
verses.textLa: Quidquid autem ruminat quidem, et habet ungulam, sed non dividit eam, sicut camelus et cetera, non comedetis illud, et inter immunda reputabitis.

verses.textEn: The rock rabbit which chews over again, and whose hoof is not divided, is unclean,
verses.textLa: Chœrogryllus qui ruminat, ungulamque non dividit, immundus est.
verses.notes: This particular animal is also called a hyrax, or a daman, or a cherogril. This animal is not scientifically categorized as a ruminant, but the Scripture passage uses ruminant with a broader meaning than science today uses. Rabbits chew over again in the sense of consuming a certain type of their own droppings, in order to derive additional nutrition.

verses.textEn: and so also is the hare, for it too chews over again, yet its hoof is not divided,
verses.textLa: Lepus quoque: nam et ipse ruminat, sed ungulam non dividit.

verses.textEn: and also the swine, which, though its hoof is divided, does not chew over again.
verses.textLa: Et sus: qui cum ungulam dividat, non ruminat.

verses.textEn: The flesh of these you shall not eat, nor shall you touch their carcasses, because they are unclean to you.
verses.textLa: Horum carnibus non vescemini, nec cadavera contingetis, quia immunda sunt vobis.

verses.textEn: These are the things that breed in the waters, and which it is lawful to eat. All that has little fins and scales, as much in the sea, as in the rivers and ponds, you shall eat.
verses.textLa: Hæc sunt quæ gignuntur in aquis, et vesci licitum est. Omne quod habet pinnulas et squamas, tam in mari quam in fluminibus et stagnis, comedetis.

verses.textEn: But whatever does not have fins and scales, of those things that live and move in the waters, shall be abominable to you,
verses.textLa: Quidquid autem pinnulas et squamas non habet eorum quæ in aquis moventur et vivunt, abominabile vobis,

verses.textEn: and detestable; their flesh you shall not eat, and their carcasses you shall avoid.
verses.textLa: execrandumque erit, carnes eorum non comedetis, et morticina vitabitis.

verses.textEn: All that does not have fins and scales in the waters shall be polluted.
verses.textLa: Cuncta quæ non habent pinnulas et squamas in aquis, polluta erunt.

verses.textEn: These are those things among the birds which you must not eat, and which are to be avoided by you: the eagle, and the griffin, and the osprey,
verses.textLa: Hæc sunt quæ de avibus comedere non debetis, et vitanda sunt vobis: Aquilam, et gryphem, et haliæetum,

verses.textEn: and the kite, as well as the vulture, according to their kind,
verses.textLa: et milvum ac vulturem iuxta genus suum,

verses.textEn: and all that is of the raven kind, according to their likeness,
verses.textLa: et omne corvini generis in similitudinem suam,
verses.notes: These categories are according to their likeness, i.e. according to appearances, which is a natural and practical way to categorize such animals.

verses.textEn: the ostrich, and the owl, and the gull, and the hawk, according to its kind,
verses.textLa: struthionem, et noctuam, et larum, et accipitrem iuxta genus suum:

verses.textEn: the owl, and the sea bird, and the ibis,
verses.textLa: bubonem, et mergulum, et ibin,

verses.textEn: and the swan, and the pelican, and the marsh hen,
verses.textLa: et cygnum, et onocrotalum, et porphyrionem,

verses.textEn: the heron, and the plover according to its kind, the crested hoopoe, and also the bat.
verses.textLa: herodionem, et charadrion iuxta genus suum, upupam quoque, et vespertilionem.
verses.notes: Bats are classified with birds because they fly; the ancient categories for animals (as well as their names) do not always match modern scientific categories.

verses.textEn: Of all that flies, whatever steps upon four feet shall be abominable to you.
verses.textLa: Omne de volucribus quod graditur super quattuor pedes, abominabile erit vobis.

verses.textEn: But whatever certainly walks upon four feet, and also has longer legs behind, with which it hops upon the earth,
verses.textLa: Quidquid autem ambulat quidem super quattuor pedes, sed habet longiora retro crura, per quæ salit super terram,
verses.notes: So these insects would have four walking legs, plus a longer pair behind for hopping or jumping.

verses.textEn: you shall eat, such as the beetle in its kind, and the cricket, and grasshopper, and the locust, each one according to its kind.
verses.textLa: comedere debetis, ut est bruchus in genere suo, et attacus atque ophiomachus, ac locusta, singula iuxta genus suum.
verses.notes: Since ancient classifications of insects do not match modern classifications, the translation uses the more commonly understood words describing these types of insects.

verses.textEn: But among flying things, whatever has only four feet shall be detestable to you.
verses.textLa: Quidquid autem ex volucribus quattuor tantum habet pedes, execrabile erit vobis:

verses.textEn: And whoever will have touched their carcasses shall be defiled, and he shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: et quicumque morticina eorum tetigerit, polluetur, et erit immundus usque ad vesperum:

verses.textEn: And if it will be necessary to carry any of these dead things, he shall wash his clothes, and he shall be unclean until the sun sets.
verses.textLa: et si necesse fuerit ut portet quippiam horum mortuum, lavabit vestimenta sua, et immundus erit usque ad occasum solis.
