verses.textEn: Every animal that certainly has a hoof, but which is not divided, nor does it chew over again, shall be unclean. And whoever will have touched it shall be contaminated.
verses.textLa: Omne animal quod habet quidem ungulam, sed non dividit eam, nec ruminat, immundum erit: et qui tetigerit illud, contaminabitur.

verses.textEn: Whatever walks upon its hands, out of all the animals that advance on all fours, shall be unclean. Whoever will have touched their carcasses shall be polluted until evening.
verses.textLa: Quod ambulat super manus ex cunctis animantibus, quæ incedunt quadrupedia, immundum erit: qui tetigerit morticina eorum, polluetur usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: And whoever will have carried this kind of carcass shall wash his clothes, and he shall be unclean until evening. For all these are unclean to you.
verses.textLa: Et qui portaverit huiuscemodi cadavera, lavabit vestimenta sua, et immundus erit usque ad vesperum: quia omnia hæc immunda sunt vobis.

verses.textEn: Likewise, these shall be considered among the polluted things, out of all that moves upon the earth: the weasel, and the mouse, and the crocodile, each one according to its kind,
verses.textLa: Hæc quoque inter polluta reputabuntur de his, quæ moventur in terra, mustela et mus et crocodilus, singula iuxta genus suum,

verses.textEn: the shrew, and the chameleon, and the gecko, and the lizard, and the mole.
verses.textLa: mygale, et chamæleon, et stellio, et lacerta, et talpa:

verses.textEn: All these are unclean. Whoever will have touched their carcasses shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: omnia hæc immunda sunt. Qui tetigerit morticina eorum, immundus erit usque ad vesperum:

verses.textEn: And anything upon which something from their carcasses will have fallen shall be defiled, whether it is a vessel of wood, or a garment, or skins, or haircloths, or anything by which work is done. These shall be dipped in water and shall be defiled until evening, but then afterwards these shall be clean.
verses.textLa: et super quod ceciderit quidquam de morticinis eorum, polluetur tam vas ligneum et vestimentum, quam pelles et cilicia: et in quocumque fit opus, tingentur aqua, et polluta erunt usque ad vesperum, et sic postea mundabuntur.

verses.textEn: But an earthen vessel, into which something from these will fall, shall be defiled; and therefore it is to be broken.
verses.textLa: Vas autem fictile, in quod horum quidquam intro cecidit, polluetur, et idcirco frangendum est.

verses.textEn: Any of the foods that you eat, if water from such a vessel will have been poured upon it, it shall be unclean. And every liquid which one may drink from such a vessel shall be unclean.
verses.textLa: Omnis cibus, quem comedetis, si fusa fuerit super eum aqua, immundus erit: et omne liquens quod bibitur de universo vase, immundum erit.

verses.textEn: And if anything from among these kinds of dead things has fallen upon it, it shall be unclean, whether it be an oven, or a pot with feet, these shall be unclean and shall be destroyed.
verses.textLa: Et quidquid de morticinis huiuscemodi ceciderit super illud, immundum erit: sive clibani, sive chytropodes, destruentur, et immundi erunt.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, fountains and cisterns, and all reservoirs of water shall be clean. Whoever will have touched their carcasses shall be defiled.
verses.textLa: Fontes vero et cisternæ, et omnis aquarum congregatio munda erit. Qui morticinum eorum tetigerit, polluetur.

verses.textEn: If it falls upon seed grain, it shall not defile it.
verses.textLa: Si ceciderit super sementem, non polluet eam.

verses.textEn: But if anyone has poured water upon the seed grain, and afterwards it was touched by the carcasses, it shall be immediately defiled.
verses.textLa: Si autem quispiam aqua sementem perfuderit, et postea morticinis tacta fuerit, illico polluetur.

verses.textEn: If any animals will have died, from which it is lawful for you to eat, whoever will have touched its carcass shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Si mortuum fuerit animal, quod licet vobis comedere, qui cadaver eius tetigerit, immundus erit usque ad vesperum:

verses.textEn: And whoever will have eaten or carried anything of these shall wash his clothes, and he shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: et qui comederit ex eo quippiam, sive portaverit; lavabit vestimenta sua, et immundus erit usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: All that creeps across the earth shall be abominable, neither shall it be taken up as food.
verses.textLa: Omne quod reptat super terram, abominabile erit, nec assumetur in cibum.

verses.textEn: Whatever advances by four feet upon the chest, or that has many feet, or that drags across the soil, you shall not eat, because it is abominable.
verses.textLa: Quidquid super pectus quadrupes graditur, et multos habet pedes, sive per humum trahitur, non comedetis, quia abominabile est.

verses.textEn: Do not be willing to contaminate your souls, nor shall you touch any of these, lest you become unclean.
verses.textLa: Nolite contaminare animas vestras, nec tangatis quidquam eorum, ne immundi sitis.

verses.textEn: For I am the Lord your God. Be holy, for I am Holy. Do not pollute your souls with any creeping thing, which moves across the land.
verses.textLa: Ego enim sum Dominus Deus vester: sancti estote, quia ego Sanctus sum. Ne polluatis animas vestras in omni reptili quod movetur super terram.

verses.textEn: For I am the Lord, who led you away from the land of Egypt, so that I would be your God; you shall be holy, for I am Holy.
verses.textLa: Ego enim sum Dominus, qui eduxi vos de Terra Ægypti, ut essem vobis in Deum: sancti eritis, quia ego Sanctus sum.

verses.textEn: This is the law of animals and flying things, and of every living soul that moves in the waters or creeps upon the land,
verses.textLa: Ista est lex animantium ac volucrum, et omnis animæ viventis, quæ movetur in aqua, et reptat in terra,

verses.textEn: so that you may know the difference between clean and unclean, and so that you may know what you ought to eat, and what you ought to refuse.
verses.textLa: ut differentias noveritis mundi, et immundi, et sciatis quid comedere et quid respuere debeatis.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: A woman, if she has received the seed to bear a male, shall be unclean for seven days, just as in the days of separation due to menstruation.
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Mulier, si suscepto semine pepererit masculum, immunda erit septem diebus iuxta dies separationis menstruæ.

verses.textEn: And on the eighth day, the little infant shall be circumcised.
verses.textLa: Et die octavo circumcidetur infantulus:

verses.textEn: Yet truly, she herself shall remain for thirty-three days in the blood of her purification. She shall not touch anything holy, nor shall she enter into the Sanctuary, until the days of her purification are completed.
verses.textLa: ipsa vero triginta tribus diebus manebit in sanguine purificationis suæ. Omne sanctum non tanget, nec ingredietur in Sanctuarium, donec impleantur dies purificationis suæ.

verses.textEn: But if she will bear a female, she shall be unclean for two weeks, according to the custom of her monthly flow, and she shall remain in the blood of her purification for sixty-six days.
verses.textLa: Sin autem feminam pepererit, immunda erit duabus hebdomadibus iuxta ritum fluxus menstrui, et sexaginta sex diebus manebit in sanguine purificationis suæ.

verses.textEn: And when the days of her purification have been completed, for a son or for a daughter, she shall bring to the door of the tabernacle of the testimony, a one-year-old lamb as a holocaust, and a young pigeon or a turtledove for sin, and she shall deliver them to the priest.
verses.textLa: Cumque expleti fuerint dies purificationis suæ, pro filio, sive pro filia, deferet agnum anniculum in holocaustum, et pullum columbæ sive turturem pro peccato, ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii, et tradet sacerdoti
verses.notes: The time for bringing the sacrifice to the tabernacle of the testimony is after the days of purification are completed, but it does not specify that the sacrifice has to be made on exactly the next day after those days of seclusion. There is no exact day given, merely sometime after the days of purification. An exact day is not specified so that the mother can use her discretion and prudence, because the child is still very young and needs much care (especially in ancient times, prior to modern medicine).

verses.textEn: He shall offer them in the sight of the Lord, and he shall pray for her. And so she shall be cleansed from the issue of her blood. This is the law for one who bears a male or a female.
verses.textLa: qui offeret illa coram Domino, et orabit pro ea, et sic mundabitur a profluvio sanguinis sui. Ista est lex parientis masculum aut feminam.

verses.textEn: And if her hand has not obtained or been able to offer a lamb, she shall take two turtledoves or two young pigeons: one as a holocaust, and the other for sin. And the priest shall pray for her, and so she shall be cleansed.
verses.textLa: Quod si non invenerit manus eius, nec potuerit offerre agnum, sumet duos turtures vel duos pullos columbarum, unum in holocaustum, et alterum pro peccato. Orabitque pro ea sacerdos, et sic mundabitur.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, et Aaron, dicens:

verses.textEn: The man in whose skin or flesh there will have arisen a diverse color, or a pustule, or something that seems to shine, which is the mark of leprosy, shall be brought to Aaron the priest, or to anyone you wish among his sons.
verses.textLa: Homo, in cuius cute et carne ortus fuerit diversus color sive pustula, aut quasi lucens quippiam, id est plaga lepræ, adducetur ad Aaron sacerdotem, vel ad unum quemlibet filiorum eius.
verses.notes: The term ‘leprosy’ in ancient times was probably used to refer to a variety of different diseases affecting the skin.

verses.textEn: And if he sees that leprosy is in his skin, and that the hair has turned a white color, and that the place where the leprosy appears is lower than the rest of the skin and the flesh, then it is the mark of leprosy, and at his judgment he shall be separated.
verses.textLa: Qui cum viderit lepram in cute, et pilos in album mutatos colorem, ipsamque speciem lepræ humiliorem cute et carne reliqua; plaga lepræ est, et ad arbitrium eius separabitur.

verses.textEn: But if there will be a shining whiteness in the skin, but it is not lower than the rest of the flesh, and the hair is of unaffected color, the priest shall seclude him for seven days.
verses.textLa: Sin autem lucens candor fuerit in cute, nec humilior carne reliqua, et pili coloris pristini, recludet eum sacerdos septem diebus,

verses.textEn: And on the seventh day he shall examine him, and if the leprosy certainly has not increased further, and has not spread itself in the skin, he shall seclude him again, for another seven days.
verses.textLa: et considerabit die septimo: et si quidem lepra ultra non creverit, nec transierit in cute priores terminos, rursum recludet eum septem diebus aliis.

verses.textEn: And on the seventh day, he shall evaluate him. If the leprosy has become obscured, and has not increased in the skin, he shall declare him clean, because it is a scab. And the man shall wash his clothes, and he shall be clean.
verses.textLa: Et die septimo contemplabitur: si obscurior fuerit lepra, et non creverit in cute, mundabit eum, quia scabies est: lavabitque homo vestimenta sua, et mundus erit.

verses.textEn: But if the leprosy increases again, after he was seen by the priest and restored to cleanness, he shall be brought to him,
verses.textLa: Quod si postquam a sacerdote visus est, et redditus munditiæ, iterum lepra creverit; adducetur ad eum,

verses.textEn: and he shall be condemned of uncleanness.
verses.textLa: et immunditiæ condemnabitur.

verses.textEn: If the mark of leprosy has been in a man, he shall be brought to the priest,
verses.textLa: Plaga lepræ si fuerit in homine, adducetur ad sacerdotem,

verses.textEn: and he shall look upon him. And when there is a white color in the skin, and it has an altered appearance in its hair, and also the same flesh seems alive,
verses.textLa: et videbit eum. Cumque color albus in cute fuerit, et capillorum mutaverit aspectum, ipsa quoque caro viva apparuerit:

verses.textEn: it shall be judged a chronic leprosy, which has grown into the skin. And so the priest shall declare him contaminated, and he shall not seclude him, because he is clearly unclean.
verses.textLa: lepra vetustissima iudicabitur, atque inolita cuti. Contaminabit itaque eum sacerdos, et non recludet, quia perspicuæ immunditiæ est.

verses.textEn: But if the leprosy will have flourished, coursing through the skin, and will have covered all the skin from the head even to the feet, whatever falls under the sight of the eyes,
verses.textLa: Sin autem effloruerit discurrens lepra in cute, et operuerit omnem cutem a capite usque ad pedes, quidquid sub aspectum oculorum cadit,

verses.textEn: the priest shall examine him, and he shall judge that the leprosy that he possesses is very clean, because it has all turned to whiteness, and for this reason the man shall be clean.
verses.textLa: considerabit eum sacerdos, et teneri lepra mundissima iudicabit: eo quod omnis in candorem versa sit, et idcirco homo mundus erit.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, when the living flesh shall appear in him,
verses.textLa: Quando vero caro vivens in eo apparuerit,

verses.textEn: then by the judgment of the priest he shall be polluted, and he shall be considered to be among the unclean. For the live flesh, if it is spotted with leprosy, is unclean.
verses.textLa: tunc sacerdotis iudicio polluetur, et inter immundos reputabitur. Caro enim viva si lepra aspergitur, immunda est.

verses.textEn: And if again it will have turned into whiteness, and will have covered the entire man,
verses.textLa: Quod si rursum versa fuerit in alborem, et totum hominem operuerit,

verses.textEn: the priest shall examine him, and he shall discern him to be clean.
verses.textLa: considerabit eum sacerdos, et mundum esse decernet.

verses.textEn: But when there has been an ulcer in the flesh and the skin, and it has healed,
verses.textLa: Caro autem et cutis in qua ulcus natum est et sanatum,

verses.textEn: and in the place of the ulcer, there appears a white or reddish scar, the man shall be brought to the priest.
verses.textLa: et in loco ulceris cicatrix alba apparuerit, sive subrufa, adducetur homo ad sacerdotem:

verses.textEn: And when he will have seen the place of the leprosy lower than the rest of the flesh, and that the hair has turned white, he shall declare him contaminated. For the plague of leprosy has arisen from the ulcer.
verses.textLa: qui cum viderit locum lepræ humiliorem carne reliqua, et pilos versos in candorem, contaminabit eum: plaga enim lepræ orta est in ulcere.

verses.textEn: But if the hair is of the usual color, and the scar is somewhat obscure and is not lower than the nearby flesh, he shall seclude him for seven days.
verses.textLa: Quod si pilus coloris est pristini, et cicatrix subobscura, et vicina carne non est humilior, recludet eum septem diebus.

verses.textEn: And if it will have certainly increased, he shall judge him to have leprosy.
verses.textLa: Et si quidem creverit, adiudicabit eum lepræ.

verses.textEn: But if it stays in its place, it is the scar of an ulcer, and the man shall be clean.
verses.textLa: Sin autem steterit in loco suo, ulceris est cicatrix, et homo mundus erit.

verses.textEn: But if flesh and skin has been burned by fire, and, having been healed, now has a white or red scar,
verses.textLa: Caro autem et cutis, quam ignis exusserit, et sanata albam sive rufam habuerit cicatricem,

verses.textEn: the priest shall examine it, and if he sees that it has turned white, and that its place is lower than the rest of the skin, he shall declare him contaminated, for the mark of leprosy has arisen in the scar.
verses.textLa: considerabit eam sacerdos, et ecce versa est in alborem, et locus eius reliqua cute est humilior: contaminabit eum, quia plaga lepræ in cicatrice orta est.

verses.textEn: But if the color of the hair has not been changed, nor is the mark lower than the rest of the flesh, and the leprosy itself appears to be somewhat obscure, he shall seclude him for seven days,
verses.textLa: Quod si pilorum color non fuerit immutatus, nec humilior plaga carne reliqua, et ipsa lepræ species fuerit subobscura, recludet eum septem diebus,

verses.textEn: and on the seventh day he shall evaluate him. If the leprosy will have increased further in the skin, he shall declare him contaminated.
verses.textLa: et die septimo contemplabitur: si creverit in cute lepra, contaminabit eum.

verses.textEn: But if the whiteness stays in its place and is not very clear, it is the mark of a burn, and for this reason he shall be declared clean, because it is only the scar from a burn.
verses.textLa: Sin autem in loco suo candor steterit non satis clarus, plaga combustionis est, et idcirco mundabitur, quia cicatrix est combusturæ.

verses.textEn: If leprosy will have sprung up in the head or the beard of a man or woman, the priest shall look upon them,
verses.textLa: Vir, sive mulier, in cuius capite vel barba germinaverit lepra, videbit eos sacerdos,

verses.textEn: and if the place is certainly lower than the rest of the flesh, and the hair is golden, and thinner than usual, he shall declare them contaminated, because it is the leprosy of the head and the beard.
verses.textLa: et si quidem humilior fuerit locus carne reliqua, et capillus flavus, solitoque subtilior; contaminabit eos, quia lepra capitis ac barbæ est.

verses.textEn: But if he sees that the place of the spot is equal with the nearby flesh, and that the hair is black, he shall seclude him for seven days,
verses.textLa: Sin autem viderit locum maculæ æqualem vicinæ carni, et capillum nigrum: recludet eum septem diebus,

verses.textEn: and on the seventh day he shall examine it. If the spot has not increased, and the hair has kept its color, and the place of the mark is equal with the rest of the flesh,
verses.textLa: et die septimo intuebitur. Si non creverit macula, et capillus sui coloris est, et locus plagæ carni reliquæ æqualis:

verses.textEn: the man shall be shaven, except in the place of the spot, and he shall be secluded for another seven days.
verses.textLa: radetur homo absque loco maculæ, et includetur septem diebus aliis.

verses.textEn: On the seventh day, if the mark seems to have stayed in its place, and it is not lower than the rest of the flesh, he shall declare him clean, and, his clothes having been washed, he shall be clean.
verses.textLa: Si die septimo visa fuerit stetisse plaga in loco suo, nec humilior carne reliqua, mundabit eum, lotisque vestibus suis mundus erit.

verses.textEn: But if, after his cleansing, the spot will have increased again in the skin,
verses.textLa: Sin autem post emundationem rursus creverit macula in cute,

verses.textEn: he shall no longer inquire as to whether the hair has turned yellow, because he is plainly unclean.
verses.textLa: non quæret amplius utrum capillus in flavum colorem sit immutatus, quia aperte immundus est.

verses.textEn: Furthermore, if the spot has not increased, and the hair is black, let him know that the man is healed: and let him confidently pronounce him clean.
verses.textLa: Porro si steterit macula, et capilli nigri fuerint, noverit hominem sanatum esse, et confidenter eum pronunciet mundum.
verses.notes: The spot has ‘stood still’ in the sense of not increasing size or spreading.

verses.textEn: If a whiteness will have appeared in the skin of a man or a woman,
verses.textLa: Vir, sive mulier, in cuius cute candor apparuerit,

verses.textEn: the priest shall examine them. If he detects an obscured whiteness shining in the skin, may he know that it is not leprosy, but a white-colored blemish, and that the man is clean.
verses.textLa: intuebitur eos sacerdos. Si deprehenderit subobscurum alborem lucere in cute, sciat non esse lepram, sed maculam coloris candidi, et hominem mundum.

verses.textEn: The man whose hair falls off of his head is bald and clean.
verses.textLa: Vir, de cuius capite capilli fluunt, calvus et mundus est:

verses.textEn: And if the hair falls off of his forehead, he is bald in front and clean.
verses.textLa: et si a fronte ceciderint pili, recalvaster et mundus est.

verses.textEn: But if in the bald head or bald forehead there has arisen a white or reddish color,
verses.textLa: Sin autem in calvitio sive in recalvatione albus vel rufus color fuerit exortus,

verses.textEn: and the priest will have seen this, he shall condemn him without doubt of leprosy, which has arisen in the baldness.
verses.textLa: et hoc sacerdos viderit, condemnabit eum haud dubiæ lepræ, quæ orta est in calvitio.

verses.textEn: Therefore, whoever will have been spotted by leprosy, and who has been separated at the judgment of the priest,
verses.textLa: Quicumque ergo maculatus fuerit lepra, et separatus est ad arbitrium sacerdotis,

verses.textEn: shall have his clothes unstitched, his head bare, his mouth covered with a cloth, and he himself shall cry out that he is contaminated and filthy.
verses.textLa: habebit vestimenta dissuta, caput nudum, os veste contectum, contaminatum ac sordidum se clamabit.

verses.textEn: The entire time that he is a leper and unclean he shall live alone outside the camp.
verses.textLa: Omni tempore quo leprosus est, et immundus, solus habitabit extra castra.

verses.textEn: A woolen or linen garment that will have held the leprosy,
verses.textLa: Vestis lanea sive linea, quæ lepram habuerit

verses.textEn: in the main fibers or in any of the threads, or certainly in a skin, or whatever has been made from a skin,
verses.textLa: in stamine atque subtegmine, aut certe pellis, vel quidquid ex pelle confectum est,

verses.textEn: if it has been infected with a white or red spot, it shall be considered to be leprosy, and it shall be shown to the priest.
verses.textLa: si alba vel rufa macula fuerit infecta, lepra reputabitur, ostendeturque sacerdoti.

verses.textEn: And he, having examined it, shall close it up for seven days.
verses.textLa: Qui consideratam recludet septem diebus:

verses.textEn: And on the seventh day, having looked at it again, if he detects an increase, it is a persistent leprosy; he shall judge the garment to be polluted, along with everything with which it has been found.
verses.textLa: et die septimo rursus aspiciens, si deprehenderit crevisse, lepra perseverans est: pollutum iudicabit vestimentum, et omne in quo fuerit inventa:

verses.textEn: And because of this, it shall be burned in flames.
verses.textLa: et idcirco comburetur flammis.

verses.textEn: But if he will have seen that it has not increased,
verses.textLa: Quod si eam viderit non crevisse,

verses.textEn: he shall instruct them, and they shall wash whatever has the leprosy in it, and he shall close it up for another seven days.
verses.textLa: præcipiet, et lavabunt id, in quo lepra est, recludetque illud septem diebus aliis.

verses.textEn: And when he will have seen that the former appearance has not returned, even if the leprosy has not increased, he shall judge it to be unclean, and he shall burn it with fire, for the leprosy has been infused in the exterior of the garment, or throughout the whole.
verses.textLa: Et cum viderit faciem quidem pristinam non reversam, nec tamen crevisse lepram, immundum iudicabit, et igne comburet, eo quod infusa sit in superficie vestimenti vel per totum, lepra.

verses.textEn: But if the place of the leprosy has become somewhat darker, after the garment has been washed, he shall tear it away, and separate it from the part that is sound.
verses.textLa: Sin autem obscurior fuerit locus lepræ, postquam vestis est lota, abrumpet eum, et a solido dividet.

verses.textEn: But if, after this, there will appear in those places which before were immaculate, a flying and wandering leprosy, it must be burned with fire.
verses.textLa: Quod si ultra apparuerit in his locis, quæ prius immaculata erant, lepra volatilis et vaga: debet igne comburi.

verses.textEn: If it will have ceased, he shall wash with water the parts which are pure for a second time, and they shall be clean.
verses.textLa: Si cessaverit, lavabit aqua ea, quæ pura sunt, secundo, et munda erunt.

verses.textEn: This is the law about leprosy for any woolen or linen garment, in the weave and in the threads, and for all items made from skins, how it must be declared either clean or contaminated.
verses.textLa: Ista est lex lepræ vestimenti lanei et linei, staminis, atque subtegminis, omnisque supellectilis pelliceæ, quomodo mundari debeat, vel contaminari.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: This is the rite for a leper, when he is to be cleansed. He shall be brought to the priest,
verses.textLa: Hic est ritus leprosi, quando mundandus est: Adducetur ad sacerdotem:

verses.textEn: who, departing from the camp, when he has found the leprosy to be cleansed,
verses.textLa: qui egressus de castris, cum invenerit lepram esse mundatam,

verses.textEn: shall instruct him who is to be purified to offer for himself two living sparrows, which it is lawful to eat, and cedar wood, and vermillion, and hyssop.
verses.textLa: præcipiet ei, qui purificatur, ut offerat duos passeres vivos pro se, quibus vesci licitum est, et lignum cedrinum, vermiculumque et hyssopum.

verses.textEn: And he shall order that one of the sparrows be immolated in an earthen vessel over living waters.
verses.textLa: Et unum ex passeribus immolari iubebit in vase fictili super aquas viventes:

verses.textEn: But the other living one, with the cedar wood, and the scarlet, and the hyssop, he shall dip in the blood of the immolated sparrow.
verses.textLa: alium autem vivum cum ligno cedrino, et cocco et hyssopo, tinget in sanguine passeris immolati,
verses.notes: In the earlier verse (14:4), the word ‘vermiculum’ was used to refer to the dyed cloth, but now ‘cocco’ is used. Each of those two Latin words refers to a dyed cloth by the source of the dye, which in both cases produces a reddish color in the cloth.

verses.textEn: And he shall sprinkle him who is to be cleansed seven times, so that he may be purified justly. And he shall release the living sparrow, so that it may fly away into the field.
verses.textLa: quo asperget illum, qui mundandus est, septies, ut iure purgetur: et dimittet passerem vivum, ut in agrum avolet.

verses.textEn: And when the man will have washed his clothes, he shall shave all the hair from his body, and he shall be washed with water. And having been purified, he shall enter into the camp, only to this extent: that he may remain outside his own tent for seven days.
verses.textLa: Cumque laverit homo vestimenta sua, radet omnes pilos corporis, et lavabitur aqua: purificatusque ingredietur castra, ita dumtaxat ut maneat extra tabernaculum suum septem diebus,

verses.textEn: And on the seventh day he shall shave the hair of his head, and his beard, and his eyebrows, as well as the hair of his entire body. And having washed his clothes again, and his body,
verses.textLa: et die septimo radet capillos capitis, barbamque et supercilia, ac totius corporis pilos. Et lotis rursum vestibus et corpore,

verses.textEn: on the eighth day, he shall take two immaculate lambs, and a one-year-old female sheep without blemish, and three tenths of fine wheat flour, which has been sprinkled with oil, as a sacrifice, and separately, one twelfth hin of oil.
verses.textLa: die octavo assumet duos agnos immaculatos, et ovem anniculam absque macula, et tres decimas similæ in sacrificium, quæ conspersa sit oleo, et seorsum olei sextarium.
verses.notes: A sextarium (Roman measure) is used in the Latin text to represent a ‘log’ which is an ancient Hebrew unit of liquid measure equivalent to 1/12th of a ‘hin’ or about 1/3 of a U.S. quart.

verses.textEn: And when the priest purifying the man has presented him and all these things in the sight of the Lord at the door of the tabernacle of the testimony,
verses.textLa: Cumque sacerdos purificans hominem, statuerit eum, et hæc omnia coram Domino in ostio tabernaculi testimonii,

verses.textEn: he shall take a lamb and offer it for transgression, with the twelfth hin of oil. And having offered all these before the Lord,
verses.textLa: tollet agnum, et offeret eum pro delicto, oleique sextarium. Et oblatis ante Dominum omnibus,

verses.textEn: he shall immolate the lamb, where the victim for sin is usually immolated with the holocaust, that is, in the holy place. For just as with the one for sin, so also the victim for transgression belongs to the priest. It is the Holy of holies.
verses.textLa: immolabit agnum, ubi solet immolari hostia pro peccato, et holocaustum, id est, in loco sancto. Sicut enim pro peccato, ita et pro delicto ad sacerdotem pertinet hostia: Sancta sanctorum est.

verses.textEn: And taking some of the blood of the victim, which was immolated for transgression, the priest shall place it upon the tip of the right ear of him who is being cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and likewise the foot.
verses.textLa: Assumensque sacerdos de sanguine hostiæ, quæ immolata est pro delicto, ponet super extremum auriculæ dextræ eius qui mundatur, et super pollices manus dextræ et pedis:

verses.textEn: And he shall send some of the twelfth hin of oil into his own left hand,
verses.textLa: et de olei sextario mittet in manum suam sinistram,

verses.textEn: and he shall dip his right finger in it, and he shall sprinkle it in the sight of the Lord seven times.
verses.textLa: tingetque digitum dextrum in eo, et asperget coram Domino septies.

verses.textEn: But the oil which remains in his left hand, he shall pour over the tip of the right ear of him who is being cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand as well as the foot, and upon the blood which was shed for transgression,
verses.textLa: Quod autem reliquum est olei in læva manu, fundet super extremum auriculæ dextræ eius qui mundatur, et super pollices manus ac pedis dextri, et super sanguinem qui effusus est pro delicto,

verses.textEn: and upon his head.
verses.textLa: et super caput eius.

verses.textEn: And he shall pray for him in the sight of the Lord, and he shall accomplish the sacrifice on behalf of sin. Then he shall immolate the holocaust,
verses.textLa: Rogabitque pro eo coram Domino, et faciet sacrificium pro peccato. Tunc immolabit holocaustum,

verses.textEn: and place it upon the altar with its libations, and the man will be duly cleansed.
verses.textLa: et ponet illud in altari cum libamentis suis, et homo rite mundabitur.

verses.textEn: But if he is poor, and his hand is not able to find what has been said, he shall take a lamb as an offering for transgression, so that the priest may pray for him, and a tenth part of fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil, as a sacrifice, and a twelfth hin of oil,
verses.textLa: Quod si pauper est, et non potest manus eius invenire quæ dicta sunt, pro delicto assumet agnum ad oblationem, ut roget pro eo sacerdos, decimamque partem similæ conspersæ oleo in sacrificium, et olei sextarium,

verses.textEn: and two turtledoves or two young pigeons, of which one may be for sin, and the other as a holocaust.
verses.textLa: duosque turtures sive duos pullos columbæ, quorum unus sit pro peccato, et alter in holocaustum:

verses.textEn: And he shall offer them on the eighth day of his purification to the priest at the door of the tabernacle of the testimony in the sight of the Lord.
verses.textLa: offeretque ea die octavo purificationis suæ sacerdoti, ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii coram Domino.

verses.textEn: And he, receiving the lamb for transgression, and the twelfth hin of oil, shall lift them up together.
verses.textLa: Qui suscipiens agnum pro delicto et sextarium olei, levabit simul:

verses.textEn: And when the lamb has been immolated, he shall place some of its blood upon the tip of the right ear of him who is being cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, as well as the foot.
verses.textLa: immolatoque agno, de sanguine eius ponet super extremum auriculæ dextræ illius qui mundatur, et super pollices manus eius ac pedis dextri:

verses.textEn: Yet truly, he shall send part of the oil into his own left hand,
verses.textLa: olei vero partem mittet in manum suam sinistram,

verses.textEn: and dipping the finger of his right hand in it, he shall sprinkle it seven times before the Lord.
verses.textLa: in quo tingens digitum dextræ manus asperget septies coram Domino:

verses.textEn: And he shall touch the tip of the right ear of him who is being cleansed, and the thumb of his right hand, as well as the foot, in the place of the blood which was shed for transgression.
verses.textLa: tangetque extremum dextræ auriculæ illius qui mundatur, et pollices manus ac pedis dextri in loco sanguinis qui effusus est pro delicto:

verses.textEn: But the remaining part of the oil which is in his left hand, he shall send upon the head of the one being purified, to appease the Lord on his behalf.
verses.textLa: reliquam autem partem olei, quæ est in sinistra manu, mittet super caput purificati, ut placet pro eo Dominum:

verses.textEn: And he shall offer a turtledove or a young pigeon,
verses.textLa: et turturem sive pullum columbæ offeret,

verses.textEn: one for transgression, and the other as a holocaust, with their libations.
verses.textLa: unum pro delicto, et alterum in holocaustum cum libamentis suis.

verses.textEn: This is the sacrifice of a leper, who is not able to obtain all of the things concerning his cleansing.
verses.textLa: Hoc est sacrificium leprosi, qui habere non potest omnia in emundationem sui.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:

verses.textEn: When you will have entered into the land of Canaan, which I will give to you as a possession, if there is the mark of leprosy in a building,
verses.textLa: Cum ingressi fueritis Terram Chanaan, quam ego dabo vobis in possessionem, si fuerit plaga lepræ in ædibus,

verses.textEn: he whose house it is shall go and report to the priest, saying: “It seems to me that the mark of leprosy is in my house.”
verses.textLa: ibit cuius est domus, nuncians sacerdoti, et dicet: Quasi plaga lepræ videtur mihi esse in domo mea.

verses.textEn: And he shall instruct them to carry all things out of the house, before he would enter it and see whether it is leprosy, lest all that is in the house become unclean. And after this, he shall enter to examine the leprosy of the house.
verses.textLa: At ille præcipiet ut efferant universa de domo, priusquam ingrediatur eam, et videat utrum leprosa sit, ne immunda fiant omnia quæ in domo sunt. Intrabitque postea ut consideret lepram domus:

verses.textEn: And when he will have seen in its walls something like little hollows, deformed with paleness or redness, and lower than the remaining surface,
verses.textLa: et cum viderit in parietibus illius quasi valliculas pallore sive rubore deformes, et humiliores superficie reliqua,

verses.textEn: he shall exit by the door of the house, and immediately close it up for seven days.
verses.textLa: egredietur ostium domus, et statim claudet illam septem diebus.

verses.textEn: And returning on the seventh day, he shall examine it. If he finds that the leprosy has spread,
verses.textLa: Reversusque die septimo, considerabit eam. Si invenerit crevisse lepram,

verses.textEn: he shall order the stones in which the leprosy is, to be dug out and cast outside the city in an unclean place,
verses.textLa: iubebit erui lapides in quibus lepra est, et proiici eos extra civitatem in locum immundum:

verses.textEn: and that the house be scraped on the inside all around, and that the dust of the scrapings be scattered outside the city in an unclean place,
verses.textLa: domum autem ipsam radi intrinsecus per circuitum, et spargi pulverem rasuræ extra urbem in locum immundum,

verses.textEn: and that other stones be put back, in place of those which had been taken away, and that the house be plastered with other mortar.
verses.textLa: lapidesque alios reponi pro his qui ablati fuerint, et luto alio liniri domum.

verses.textEn: But if, after the stones have been dug out, and the dust wiped away, and it is plastered with other clay,
verses.textLa: Sin autem postquam eruti sunt lapides, et pulvis erasus, et alia terra lita,

verses.textEn: the priest, upon entering, will have seen that the leprosy has returned, and that the walls are sprinkled with spots, then it is a persistent leprosy and the house is unclean.
verses.textLa: ingressus sacerdos viderit reversam lepram, et parietes respersos maculis, lepra est perseverans, et immunda domus:
verses.notes: The word ‘leprosy’ in this context probably refers to some type of mold that may have afflicted some of the houses, since these were built with stone and some type of clay mortar. Therefore, the word ‘leprosy’ in ancient times had a much broader meaning than it has today.

verses.textEn: And so they shall promptly destroy it, and shall cast its stones and timber, and also all the dust, outside the town in an unclean place.
verses.textLa: quam statim destruent, et lapides eius ac ligna, atque universum pulverem proiicient extra oppidum in locum immundum.

verses.textEn: Whoever enters into the house when it is closed up shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Qui intraverit domum quando clausa est, immundus erit usque ad vesperum:

verses.textEn: And whoever will have slept in it, or eaten anything, shall wash his clothes.
verses.textLa: et qui dormierit in ea, et comederit quippiam, lavabit vestimenta sua.
verses.notes: Here is an example where the word ‘et’ does not mean ‘and’, but means ‘or’ instead. The man who sleeps in it must surely wash his clothes, even if he does not eat anything. Also, clearly, the man who has a meal in it must also wash. So the meaning is ‘or’ not ‘and’.

verses.textEn: But if the priest, upon entering, will have seen that the leprosy has not spread in the house, after it had been newly plastered, he shall purify it, restoring it to health.
verses.textLa: Quod si introiens sacerdos viderit lepram non crevisse in domo, postquam denuo lita fuerit, purificabit eam reddita sanitate:

verses.textEn: And for its purification, he shall take two sparrows, and cedar wood, and vermillion, as well as hyssop,
verses.textLa: et in purificationem eius sumet duos passeres, lignumque cedrinum, et vermiculum atque hyssopum:

verses.textEn: and, having immolated one sparrow in an earthen vessel over living waters,
verses.textLa: et immolato uno passere in vase fictili super aquas vivas,

verses.textEn: he shall take the cedar wood, and the hyssop, and the scarlet, and the living sparrow, and he shall dip all these in the blood of the immolated sparrow, and also in the living water, and he shall sprinkle the house seven times.
verses.textLa: tollet lignum cedrinum, et hyssopum, et coccum et passerem vivum, et tinget omnia in sanguine passeris immolati, atque in aquis viventibus, et asperget domum septies,

verses.textEn: And he shall purify it as much with the blood of the sparrow as with the living water, and with the living sparrow, and the cedar wood, and the hyssop, and the vermillion.
verses.textLa: purificabitque eam tam in sanguine passeris quam in aquis viventibus, et in passere vivo, lignoque cedrino et hyssopo atque vermiculo.

verses.textEn: And when he has released the sparrow to fly freely away into the field, he shall pray for the house, and it shall be justly cleansed.
verses.textLa: Cumque dimiserit passerem avolare in agrum libere, orabit pro domo, et iure mundabitur.

verses.textEn: This is the law of every kind of leprosy and plague:
verses.textLa: Ista est lex omnis lepræ et percussuræ,

verses.textEn: of the leprosy of garments and houses,
verses.textLa: lepræ vestium et domorum,

verses.textEn: of scars and erupting pustules, of a shining spot, when the appearance is also variegated,
verses.textLa: cicatricis et erumpentium papularum, lucentis maculæ, et in varias species, coloribus immutatis,

verses.textEn: so that it can be known at what time a thing is clean or unclean.
verses.textLa: ut possit sciri quo tempore mundum quid, vel immundum sit.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to the sons of Israel, and say to them: The man who undergoes a flow of seed shall be unclean.
verses.textLa: Loquimini filiis Israel, et dicite eis: Vir, qui patitur fluxum seminis, immundus erit.

verses.textEn: And then he shall be judged subject to this fault, if a filthy fluid, at each moment, adheres to his flesh and gathers there.
verses.textLa: Et tunc iudicabitur huic vitio subiacere, cum per singula momenta adhæserit carni eius, atque concreverit fœdus humor.
verses.notes: Nocturnal emissions are mentioned in verse 15:2, but this next verse, and the following verses, refer to something further, such as an infection or disease that would cause an infected fluid to continually leak from his flesh. Hence the reference in verse 15:13 to being healed of a disease.

verses.textEn: Every bed on which he sleeps shall be unclean, and every place where he sits.
verses.textLa: Omne stratum, in quo dormierit, immundum erit, et ubicumque sederit.

verses.textEn: If any man has touched his couch, he shall wash his clothes, and having washed with water, he shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Si quis hominum tetigerit lectum eius, lavabit vestimenta sua: et ipse lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: If he will have sat where that man has sat, he shall also wash his clothes, and having washed with water, he shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Si sederit ubi ille sederat, et ipse lavabit vestimenta sua: et lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: Whoever has touched his flesh shall wash his clothes, and having washed with water, he shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Qui tetigerit carnem eius, lavabit vestimenta sua: et ipse lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: If such a man has cast his spittle upon him who is clean, he shall wash his clothes, and having washed with water, he shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Si salivam huiuscemodi homo iecerit super eum qui mundus est, lavabit vestimenta sua: et lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: The saddle on which he has sat shall be unclean.
verses.textLa: Sagma, super quo sederit, immundum erit:

verses.textEn: And whatever has been under him who has undergone a flow of seed shall be polluted until evening. Whoever carries any of these things shall wash his clothes, and having washed with water, he shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: et quidquid sub eo fuerit, qui fluxum seminis patitur, pollutum erit usque ad vesperum. Qui portaverit horum aliquid, lavabit vestimenta sua: et ipse lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.notes: The text says ‘flow of seed’ but the meaning is more general, encompassing various diseases that might produce some type of infected fluid.

verses.textEn: All whom such a one has touched, not having washed his hands before, shall wash his clothes, and having washed with water, he shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Omnis, quem tetigerit qui talis est, non lotis ante manibus, lavabit vestimenta sua: et lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: If he has touched an earthen vessel, it shall be broken. But if it is a wooden vessel, it shall be washed with water.
verses.textLa: Vas fictile quod tetigerit, confringetur: vas autem ligneum lavabitur aqua.

verses.textEn: If he who suffers from this affliction will have been healed, he shall number seven days after his cleansing, and having washed his clothes and his entire body in living water, he shall be clean.
verses.textLa: Si sanatus fuerit qui huiuscemodi sustinet passionem, numerabit septem dies post emundationem sui, et lotis vestibus et toto corpore in aquis viventibus, erit mundus.

verses.textEn: Then, on the eighth day, he shall take two turtledoves or two young pigeons, and he shall advance, in the sight of the Lord, toward the door of the tabernacle of the testimony, and he shall give these to the priest,
verses.textLa: Die autem octavo sumet duos turtures, aut duos pullos columbæ, et veniet in conspectum Domini ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii, dabitque eos sacerdoti.

verses.textEn: who shall offer one for sin, and the other as a holocaust. And he shall pray for him before the Lord, so that he may be cleansed from the flow of his seed.
verses.textLa: Qui faciet unum pro peccato, et alterum in holocaustum: rogabitque pro eo coram Domino, ut emundetur a fluxi seminis sui.

verses.textEn: A man from whom the seed of sexual intercourse goes out shall wash his entire body with water, and he shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Vir de quo egreditur semen coitus, lavabit aqua omne corpus suum: et immundus erit usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: The garment or skin which he will have, he shall wash with water, and it shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Vestem et pellem, quam habuerit, lavabit aqua, et immunda erit usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: The woman with whom he has had sexual intercourse shall be washed with water, and she shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Mulier, cum qua coierit, lavabitur aqua, et immunda erit usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: The woman who, at the return of the month, undergoes the flow of blood shall be separated for seven days.
verses.textLa: Mulier, quæ redeunte mense patitur fluxum sanguinis, septem diebus separabitur.

verses.textEn: All who will touch her shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Omnis qui tetigerit eam, immundus erit usque ad vesperum:

verses.textEn: And everything on which she sleeps or sits, in the days of her separation, shall be polluted.
verses.textLa: et in quo dormierit vel sederit diebus separationis suæ, polluetur.

verses.textEn: Whoever will have touched her bed shall wash his clothes, and having washed himself with water, he shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Qui tetigerit lectum eius, lavabit vestimenta sua: et ipse lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: Anyone who will have touched any item on which she has sat shall wash his clothes, and having washed himself with water, he shall be polluted until evening.
verses.textLa: Omne vas, super quo illa sederit, quisquis attigerit, lavabit vestimenta sua: et ipse lotus aqua, pollutus erit usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: If a man has sexual intercourse with her in the time of her monthly flow of blood, he shall be unclean for seven days, and every bed on which he sleeps shall be polluted.
verses.textLa: Si coierit cum ea vir tempore sanguinis menstrualis, immundus erit septem diebus: et omne stratum, in quo dormierit, polluetur.

verses.textEn: The woman who undergoes a flow of blood many days beyond her time of menstruation, or whose blood does not cease to flow after the menstrual blood, as long as she is subject to this affliction, she shall be unclean, just as if she were in her time of menstruation.
verses.textLa: Mulier, quæ patitur multis diebus fluxum sanguinis non in tempore menstruali, vel quæ post menstruum sanguinem fluere non cessat, quamdiu subiacet huic passioni, immunda erit quasi sit in tempore menstruo.

verses.textEn: Every bed on which she sleeps, and every item on which she sits, shall be polluted.
verses.textLa: Omne stratum, in quo dormierit, et vas in quo sederit, pollutum erit.

verses.textEn: Whoever will have touched these shall wash his clothes, and having washed himself with water, he shall be unclean until evening.
verses.textLa: Quicumque tetigerit ea, lavabit vestimenta sua: et ipse lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperam.

verses.textEn: If the blood has stopped and has ceased to flow, she shall number seven days for her purification,
verses.textLa: Si steterit sanguis, et fluere cessaverit, numerabit septem dies purificationis suæ:

verses.textEn: and on the eighth day she shall offer for herself, to the priest, two turtledoves or two young pigeons, at the door of the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.textLa: et die octavo offeret pro se sacerdoti duos turtures, aut duos pullos columbarum ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii:

verses.textEn: And he shall offer one for sin, and the other as a holocaust, and he shall pray for her before the Lord, and for the flow of her uncleanness.
verses.textLa: qui unum faciet pro peccato, et alterum in holocaustum, rogabitque pro ea coram Domino, et pro fluxu immunditiæ eius.

verses.textEn: Therefore, you shall teach the sons of Israel to be cautious of uncleanness, so that they may not die in their filth, when they will have polluted my tabernacle, which is among them.
verses.textLa: Docebitis ergo filios Israel ut caveant immunditiam, et non moriantur in sordibus suis, cum polluerint tabernaculum meum quod est inter eos.

verses.textEn: This is the law of him who undergoes a flow of seed, or who is polluted by sexual intercourse,
verses.textLa: Ista est lex eius, qui patitur fluxum seminis, et qui polluitur coitu,

verses.textEn: and of her who is separated in the time of menstruation, or who has a continual flow of blood, and of the man who sleeps with her.
verses.textLa: et quæ menstruis temporibus separatur, vel quæ iugi fluit sanguine, et hominis, qui dormierit cum ea.
verses.notes: There is a profound theological reason why such things are treated as ritual impurity: all these things are a result of the fall from grace of Adam and Eve, including sexual intercourse as a means of procreation. Ritual impurity is an acknowledgement of our fallen state, but it is a different matter than culpable personal sin.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they were destroyed for offering strange fire.
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen post mortem duorum filiorum Aaron, quando offerentes ignem alienum interfecti sunt:

verses.textEn: And he instructed him, saying: Speak to your brother Aaron, so that he may not, at any time, enter into the Sanctuary, which is within the veil, before the propitiatory by which the ark is covered, so that he may not die, (for I will appear in a cloud above the oracle)
verses.textLa: et præcepit ei, dicens: Loquere ad Aaron fratrem tuum, ne omni tempore ingrediatur Sanctuarium, quod est intra velum coram propitiatorio quo tegitur arca, ut non moriatur (quia in nube apparebo super oraculum)

verses.textEn: unless he will have done these things beforehand. He shall offer a calf for sin, and a ram as a holocaust.
verses.textLa: nisi hæc ante fecerit: Vitulum pro peccato offeret, et arietem in holocaustum.

verses.textEn: He shall be vested with a linen tunic. He shall conceal his nakedness with linen undergarments. He shall be wrapped with a linen belt, and he shall impose a linen headdress on his head. For these are holy vestments. All of these he shall put on, after he has been washed.
verses.textLa: Tunica linea vestietur, feminalibus lineis verenda celabit: accingetur zona linea, cidarim lineam imponet capiti: hæc enim vestimenta sunt sancta: quibus cunctis, cum lotus fuerit, induetur.

verses.textEn: And he shall receive, from the entire multitude of the sons of Israel, two he-goats for sin, and one ram as a holocaust.
verses.textLa: Suscipietque ab universa multitudine filiorum Israel duos hircos pro peccato, et unum arietem in holocaustum.

verses.textEn: And when he has presented the calf, and has prayed for himself and for his own house,
verses.textLa: Cumque obtulerit vitulum, et oraverit pro se et pro domo sua,

verses.textEn: he shall cause the two he-goats to stand in the sight of the Lord at the entrance to the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.textLa: duos hircos stare faciet coram Domino in ostio tabernaculi testimonii:

verses.textEn: And casting lots over them both, one is to be offered to the Lord, and the other is to be the emissary goat.
verses.textLa: mittensque super utrumque sortem, unam Domino, alteram capro emissario:

verses.textEn: The one whose lot fell out to be offered to the Lord, he shall offer for sin.
verses.textLa: cuius exierit sors Domino, offeret illum pro peccato:

verses.textEn: But the one who is to be the emissary goat shall stand before the Lord, so that he may pour the prayers upon him, and may send him away into the wilderness.
verses.textLa: cuius autem in caprum emissarium, statuet eum vivum coram Domino, ut fundat preces super eo, et emittat eum in solitudinem.

verses.textEn: After these things have been duly celebrated, he shall offer the calf, and praying for himself and for his own house, he shall immolate it.
verses.textLa: His rite celebratis, offeret vitulum et rogans pro se et pro domo sua, immolabit eum:

verses.textEn: And taking up the censer, which he has filled from the burning coals of the altar, and drawing up with his hands the aromatic compound for incense, he shall enter within the veil, into the holy place,
verses.textLa: assumptoque thuribulo, quod de prunis altaris impleverit, et hauriens manu compositum thymiama in incensum, ultra velum intrabit in Sancta:

verses.textEn: so that when the aromatics are placed upon the fire, its cloud and vapor may cover the oracle, which is above the testimony, and he may not die.
verses.textLa: ut positis super ignem aromatibus, nebula eorum et vapor operiat oraculum, quod est supra testimonium, et non moriatur.

verses.textEn: Likewise, he shall take some of the blood of the calf, and sprinkle it with his finger seven times opposite the propitiatory, toward the east.
verses.textLa: Tollet quoque de sanguine vituli, et asperget digito septies contra propitiatorium ad orientem.

verses.textEn: And when he has slain the he-goat for the sin of the people, he shall carry its blood within the veil, just as he was instructed to do with the blood of the calf, so that he may sprinkle it away from the area of the oracle,
verses.textLa: Cumque mactaverit hircum pro peccato populi, inferet sanguinem eius intra velum, sicut præceptum est de sanguine vituli, ut aspergat e regione oraculi,

verses.textEn: and so that he may expiate the Sanctuary from the uncleanness of the sons of Israel, and from their prevarications and every one of their sins. According to this rite, he shall act toward the tabernacle of the testimony, which is fixed among them in the midst of the filth of their habitation.
verses.textLa: et expiet Sanctuarium ab immunditiis filiorum Israel, et a prævaricationibus eorum, cunctisque peccatis. Iuxta hunc ritum faciet tabernaculo testimonii, quod fixum est inter eos in medio sordium habitationis eorum.

verses.textEn: Let no man be in the tabernacle when the high priest enters the Sanctuary in order to pray for himself, and for his house, and for the entire assembly of Israel, until he exits.
verses.textLa: Nullus hominum sit in tabernaculo quando pontifex Sanctuarium ingreditur, ut roget pro se et pro domo sua, et pro universo cœtu Israel donec egrediatur.

verses.textEn: And when he has exited to the altar which is before the Lord, let him pray for himself, and taking the blood of the calf, and of the he-goat, let him pour it upon its horns all around.
verses.textLa: Cum autem exierit ad altare quod coram Domino est, oret pro se, et sumptum sanguinem vituli atque hirci fundat super cornua eius per gyrum:

verses.textEn: And sprinkling with his finger seven times, let him expiate and sanctify it from the uncleanness of the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: aspergensque digito septies, expiet, et sanctificet illud ab immunditiis filiorum Israel.

verses.textEn: After he has cleansed the Sanctuary, and the tabernacle, and the altar, then let him offer the living goat.
verses.textLa: Postquam emundaverit Sanctuarium, et tabernaculum, et altare, tunc offerat hircum viventem:

verses.textEn: And placing both hands upon its head, let him confess all the iniquities of the sons of Israel, and all of their offenses and sins. And calling these down upon its head, he shall send it away, by means of a man prepared to do so, into the desert.
verses.textLa: et posita utraque manu super caput eius, confiteatur omnes iniquitates filiorum Israel, et universa delicta atque peccata eorum: quæ imprecans capiti eius, emittet illum per hominem paratum, in desertum.

verses.textEn: And when the goat has carried all their iniquities into a solitary land, and has been released into the desert,
verses.textLa: Cumque portaverit hircus omnes iniquitates eorum in terram solitariam, et dimissus fuerit in deserto,

verses.textEn: Aaron shall return into the tabernacle of the testimony. And placing aside the vestments, which he had worn before when he entered into the Sanctuary, and leaving them there,
verses.textLa: revertetur Aaron in tabernaculum testimonii, et depositis vestibus, quibus prius indutus erat cum intraret Sanctuarium, relictisque ibi,

verses.textEn: he shall wash his flesh in the holy place, and he shall be clothed in his own garments. And departing afterwards, he shall present his own holocaust and that of the people: he shall pray as much for himself as for the people.
verses.textLa: lavabit carnem suam in loco sancto, indueturque vestibus suis. Et postquam egressus obtulerit holocaustum suum ac plebis, rogabit tam pro se quam pro populo:

verses.textEn: And the fat which is offered for sins, he shall burn upon the altar.
verses.textLa: et adipem, qui oblatus est pro peccatis, adolebit super altare.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, he who has sent away the emissary goat shall wash his clothes and his body with water, and so he shall enter into the camp.
verses.textLa: Ille vero, qui dimiserit caprum emissarium, lavabit vestimenta sua et corpus aqua, et sic ingredietur in castra.

verses.textEn: But the calf and the he-goat, which were immolated for sin, and whose blood was brought into the Sanctuary to complete the expiation, these shall be carried outside the camp and be burned with fire: as with their skins, so also with their flesh and dung.
verses.textLa: Vitulum autem et hircum, qui pro peccato fuerant immolati, et quorum sanguis illatus est in Sanctuarium ut expiatio compleretur, asportabunt foras castra, et comburent igni tam pelles quam carnes eorum ac fimum:

verses.textEn: And whoever will have burned them shall wash his clothes and flesh with water, and so he shall enter into the camp.
verses.textLa: et quicumque combusserit ea, lavabit vestimenta sua, et carnem aqua, et sic ingredietur in castra.

verses.textEn: And this shall be to you an everlasting ordinance. In the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall afflict your souls, and you shall do no work, neither someone native born, nor the newcomer who sojourns among you.
verses.textLa: Eritque vobis hoc legitimum sempiternum: Mense septimo, decima die mensis affligetis animas vestras, nullumque opus facietis, sive indigena, sive advena qui peregrinatur inter vos.

verses.textEn: On this day, there shall be atonement for you, and also a cleansing from all your sins. You shall be cleansed in the sight of the Lord.
verses.textLa: In hac die expiatio erit vestri, atque mundatio ab omnibus peccatis vestris: coram Domino mundabimini.

verses.textEn: For it is a Sabbath of rest, and you shall afflict your souls as a perpetual observance.
verses.textLa: Sabbatum enim requietionis est, et affligetis animas vestras religione perpetua.

verses.textEn: And the priest who has been anointed, and whose hands have been consecrated to exercise the priesthood in the place of his father, shall make atonement. And he shall be clothed with the linen robe and the holy vestments.
verses.textLa: Expiabit autem sacerdos, qui unctus fuerit, et cuius manus initiatæ sunt ut sacerdotio fungatur pro patre suo: indueturque stola linea et vestibus sanctis,

verses.textEn: And he shall expiate the Sanctuary and the tabernacle of the testimony and the altar, likewise the priest and all the people.
verses.textLa: et expiabit Sanctuarium et tabernaculum testimonii atque altare, sacerdotes quoque et universum populum.

verses.textEn: And this shall be to you a perpetual law, that you pray for the sons of Israel, and for all their sins once a year. Therefore, he did just as the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: Eritque vobis hoc legitimum sempiternum, ut oretis pro filiis Israel, et pro cunctis peccatis eorum semel in anno. Fecit igitur sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to Aaron and his sons, and to all the sons of Israel, saying to them: This is the word, which the Lord has commanded, saying:
verses.textLa: Loquere Aaron et filiis eius, et cunctis filiis Israel, dicens ad eos: Iste est sermo quem mandavit Dominus, dicens:
verses.notes: So, the reason that quotation marks are not used for the ‘speak to’ sections of Leviticus is seen in verses 17:1-2. There would be quotes within quotes within quotes; this would be too confusing. The quotations are not needed because the context makes it clear who is speaking to whom.

verses.textEn: Any man at all of the house of Israel, if he will have killed an ox, or a sheep, or a goat in the camp or beyond the camp,
verses.textLa: Homo quilibet de domo Israel, si occiderit bovem aut ovem, sive capram in castris vel extra castra,

verses.textEn: and not have presented it as an oblation to the Lord at the door of the tabernacle, he shall be guilty of blood. It is just as if he had shed blood; so then, he shall perish from the midst of his people.
verses.textLa: et non obtulerit ad ostium tabernaculi oblationem Domino, sanguinis reus erit: quasi si sanguinem fuderit, sic peribit de medio populi sui.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the sons of Israel must offer to the priest their victims, which they kill in the field, so that they may be sanctified to the Lord before the door of the tabernacle of the testimony, and so that they may immolate them as peace offerings to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Ideo sacerdoti offerre debent filii Israel hostias suas, quas occident in agro, ut sanctificentur Domino ante ostium tabernaculi testimonii, et immolent eas hostias pacificas Domino.

verses.textEn: And the priest shall pour the blood upon the altar of the Lord, at the door of the tabernacle of the testimony, and he shall burn the fat as a sweet odor to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Fundetque sacerdos sanguinem super altare Domini ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii, et adolebit adipem in odorem suavitatis Domino:

verses.textEn: And they shall no longer immolate their victims to demons, with whom they have committed fornication. It shall be an everlasting ordinance for them and for their posterity.
verses.textLa: et nequaquam ultra immolabunt hostias suas dæmonibus, cum quibus fornicati sunt. Legitimum sempiternum erit illis et posteris eorum.

verses.textEn: And you shall say to them: The man of the house of Israel, or of the newcomers who sojourn with you, who offers a holocaust or a victim,
verses.textLa: Et ad ipsos dices: Homo de domo Israel, et de advenis, qui peregrinantur apud vos, qui obtulerit holocaustum sive victimam,

verses.textEn: and who does not bring it to the door of the tabernacle of the testimony, so that it may be offered to the Lord, shall pass away from his people.
verses.textLa: et ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii non adduxerit eam, ut offeratur Domino, interibit de populo suo.

verses.textEn: Any man at all of the house of Israel, or of the newcomers who sojourn among them, if he has eaten blood, I will harden my face against his soul, and I will drive him from his people.
verses.textLa: Homo quilibet de domo Israel, et de advenis qui pereginantur inter eos, si comederit sanguinem, obfirmabo faciem meam contra animam illius, et disperdam eam de populo suo,

verses.textEn: For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have given it to you, so that you may atone with it upon the altar for your souls, and so that the blood may be for an expiation of the soul.
verses.textLa: quia anima carnis in sanguine est: et ego dedi illum vobis, ut super altare in eo expietis pro animabus vestris, et sanguis pro animæ piaculo sit.

verses.textEn: For this reason, I have said to the sons of Israel: No soul among you shall eat blood, nor among the newcomers who sojourn with you.
verses.textLa: Idcirco dixi filiis Israel: Omnis anima ex vobis non comedet sanguinem, nec ex advenis, qui peregrinantur apud vos.

verses.textEn: Any man at all from the sons of Israel, or from the newcomers who sojourn with you, whether by hunting or bird-catching, if he seizes a wild beast or a bird, which is lawful to eat, let him pour out its blood and cover the earth with it.
verses.textLa: Homo quicumque de filiis Israel, et de advenis, qui peregrinantur apud vos, si venatione, atque aucupio ceperit feram vel avem, quibus vesci licitum est, fundat sanguinem eius, et operiat illum terra.

verses.textEn: For the life of all flesh is in the blood. Therefore, I said to the sons of Israel: You shall not eat the blood of any flesh at all, because the life of the flesh is in the blood, and whoever has eaten it shall perish.
verses.textLa: Anima enim omnis carnis in sanguine est: unde dixi filiis Israel: Sanguinem universæ carnis non comedetis, quia anima carnis in sanguine est: et quicumque comederit illum, interibit.

verses.textEn: The soul who eats what has died on its own, or what has been caught by a beast, whether he is native born or a newcomer, shall wash his clothes and himself with water, and he shall be contaminated until evening. And by this means he shall be made clean.
verses.textLa: Anima, quæ comederit morticinum, vel captum a bestia, tam de indigenis, quam de advenis, lavabit vestimenta sua et semetipsum aqua, et contaminatus erit usque ad vesperum: et hoc ordine mundus fiet.

verses.textEn: But if he will not wash his clothes and his body, he shall bear his iniquity.
verses.textLa: Quod si non laverit vestimenta sua et corpus, portabit iniquitatem suam.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Ego Dominus Deus vester:

verses.textEn: You shall not act according to the custom of the land of Egypt, in which you have lived; nor shall you behave according to the habit of the region of Canaan, into which I will lead you; neither shall you walk in their ordinances.
verses.textLa: iuxta consuetudinem Terræ Ægypti, in qua habitastis, non facietis: et iuxta morem Regionis Chanaan, ad quam ego introducturus sum vos, non agetis, nec in legitimis eorum ambulabitis.

verses.textEn: You shall accomplish my judgments, and you shall observe my precepts, and you shall walk in them. I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Facietis iudicia mea, et præcepta mea servabitis, et ambulabitis in eis. Ego Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: Keep my laws and judgments; when a man does these, he shall live by them. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Custodite leges meas atque iudicia, quæ faciens homo, vivet in eis. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: No man shall approach her who is a close blood-relative to him, so as to uncover her nakedness. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Omnis homo ad proximam sanguinis sui non accedet, ut revelet turpitudinem eius. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: You shall not expose the nakedness of your father, or the nakedness of your mother. She is your mother; you shall not uncover her nakedness.
verses.textLa: Turpitudinem patris tui et turpitudinem matris tuæ non discooperies: mater tua est, non revelabis turpitudinem eius.

verses.textEn: You shall not expose the nakedness of your father’s wife; for it is the nakedness of your father.
verses.textLa: Turpitudinem uxoris patris tui non discooperies: turpitudo enim patris tui est.

verses.textEn: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your sister, whether from father or from mother, whether she was born at home or abroad.
verses.textLa: Turpitudinem sororis tuæ ex patre, sive ex matre, quæ domi vel foris genita est, non revelabis.

verses.textEn: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your son’s daughter, or your daughter’s daughter; for it is your own nakedness.
verses.textLa: Turpitudinem filiæ filii tui vel neptis ex filia non revelabis: quia turpitudo tua est.

verses.textEn: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s wife’s daughter, whom she bore to your father, and who is your sister.
verses.textLa: Turpitudinem filiæ uxoris patris tui, quam peperit patri tuo, et est soror tua, non revelabis.

verses.textEn: You shall not expose the nakedness of your father’s sister; for she is the flesh of your father.
verses.textLa: Turpitudinem sororis patris tui non discooperies: quia caro est patris tui.

verses.textEn: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister, because she is the flesh of your mother.
verses.textLa: Turpitudinem sororis matris tuæ non revelabis, eo quod caro sit matris tuæ.

verses.textEn: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s brother, nor shall you approach his wife, who is joined to you by affinity.
verses.textLa: Turpitudinem patrui tui non revelabis, nec accedes ad uxorem eius, quæ tibi affinitate coniungitur.

verses.textEn: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law, for she is your son’s wife; neither shall you expose her dishonor.
verses.textLa: Turpitudinem nurus tuæ non revelabis, quia uxor filii tui est, nec discooperies ignominiam eius.

verses.textEn: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your brother’s wife; for it is the nakedness of your brother.
verses.textLa: Turpitudinem uxoris fratris tui non revelabis: quia turpitudo fratris tui est.

verses.textEn: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your wife and her daughter. You shall not take her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter, so as to uncover her dishonor; for they are her flesh, and such sexual intercourse is incest.
verses.textLa: Turpitudinem uxoris tuæ et filiæ eius non revelabis. Filiam filii eius, et filiam filiæ illius non sumes, ut reveles ignominiam eius: quia caro illius sunt, et talis coitus incestus est.

verses.textEn: You shall not take your wife’s sister as a rival mistress; nor shall you uncover her nakedness, while your wife is still living.
verses.textLa: Sororem uxoris tuæ in pellicatum illius non accipies, nec revelabis turpitudinem eius adhuc illa vivente.
verses.notes: The pronoun ‘illa’ refers to the wife, not the wife’s sister; but the use of a pronoun in translation would obscure the meaning.

verses.textEn: You shall not approach a woman who is undergoing menstruation, nor shall you uncover her foulness.
verses.textLa: Ad mulierem, quæ patitur menstrua, non accedes, nec revelabis fœditatem eius.

verses.textEn: You shall not have sexual intercourse with your neighbor’s wife, nor shall you be defiled by the mingling of seed.
verses.textLa: Cum uxore proximi tui non coibis, nec seminis commistione maculaberis.

verses.textEn: You shall not give some of your seed to be consecrated to the idol Moloch, nor to pollute the name of your God. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: De semine tuo non dabis ut consecretur idolo Moloch, nec pollues nomen Dei tui. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: You shall not commit sexual acts with a male, in place of sexual intercourse with a female, for this is an abomination.
verses.textLa: Cum masculo non commiscearis coitu femineo, quia abominatio est.

verses.textEn: You shall not commit sexual acts with any animal, nor shall you be defiled by it. A woman shall not lie down with a beast, nor commit sexual acts with it; for this is wickedness.
verses.textLa: Cum omni pecore non coibis, nec maculaberis cum eo. Mulier non succumbet iumento, nec miscebitur ei: quia scelus est.

verses.textEn: Do not pollute yourselves with any of these things, by which all of the nations, which I will cast out in your sight, have been contaminated
verses.textLa: Nec polluamini in omnibus his, quibus contaminatæ sunt universæ gentes, quas ego eiiciam ante conspectum vestrum,

verses.textEn: and by which the land has been polluted. I will visit the wickedness of the land, so that it may vomit out its inhabitants.
verses.textLa: et quibus polluta est terra: cuius ego scelera visitabo, ut evomat habitatores suos.

verses.textEn: Keep my ordinances and judgments, and do not do any of these abominations: the native born, as well as the settler, who sojourns among you.
verses.textLa: Custodite legitima mea atque iudicia, et non faciatis ex omnibus abominationibus istis, tam indigena quam colonus qui peregrinantur apud vos.

verses.textEn: For all these detestable things were done by the inhabitants of the land who were here before you, and they have polluted it.
verses.textLa: Omnes enim execrationes istas fecerunt accolæ terræ qui fuerunt ante vos, et polluerunt eam.

verses.textEn: Therefore, beware, lest in a similar manner, it may vomit you out as well, if you do these same things, just as it vomited out the people who were before you.
verses.textLa: Cavete ergo ne et vos similiter evomat, cum paria feceritis, sicut evomuit gentem, quæ fuit ante vos.

verses.textEn: Every soul who shall commit any of these abominations shall perish from the midst of his people.
verses.textLa: Omnis anima, quæ fecerit de abominationibus his quippiam, peribit de medio populi sui.

verses.textEn: Keep my commandments. Do not be willing to do the things which have been done by those who were before you, and do not be polluted by these things. I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Custodite mandata mea. Nolite facere quæ fecerunt hi qui fuerunt ante vos, et ne polluamini in eis. Ego Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to the entire assembly of the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: Be holy, for I, the Lord your God, am holy.
verses.textLa: Loquere ad omnem cœtum filiorum Israel, et dices ad eos: Sancti estote, quia ego sanctus sum, Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: Let each one fear his father and his mother. Observe my Sabbaths. I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Unusquisque patrem suum, et matrem suam timeat. Sabbata mea custodite. Ego Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: Do not be willing to convert to idols, neither should you make molten gods for yourselves. I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Nolite converti ad idola, nec deos conflatiles faciatis vobis. Ego Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: If you immolate a victim of peace offerings to the Lord, so that he may be appeased,
verses.textLa: Si immolaveritis hostiam pacificorum Domino ut sit placabilis,

verses.textEn: you shall eat it on the same day as when it was immolated, and the next day. Then whatever will remain on the third day you shall burn with fire.
verses.textLa: eo die quo fuerit immolata, comedetis eam, et die altero: quidquid autem residuum fuerit in diem tertium, igne comburetis.

verses.textEn: If anyone, after two days, will have eaten from it, he shall be profane and guilty of impiety.
verses.textLa: Si quis post biduum comederit ex ea, profanus erit, et impietatis reus:

verses.textEn: And he shall bear his iniquity, for he has polluted what is holy to the Lord. And that soul shall perish from his people.
verses.textLa: portabitque iniquitatem suam, quia sanctum Domini polluit, et peribit anima illa de populo suo.

verses.textEn: When you will have harvested the grain fields of your land, you shall not cut it down to the surface of the land, even to the ground, nor shall you gather the remaining ears of grain.
verses.textLa: Cumque messueris segetes terræ tuæ, non tondebis usque ad solum superficiem terræ: nec remanentes spicas colliges.

verses.textEn: Neither shall you gather the clusters or individual grapes which fall down in your vineyard, but you shall leave them for paupers and travelers to take. I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Neque in vinea tua racemos et grana decidentia congregabis, sed pauperibus et peregrinis carpenda dimittes. Ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.notes: The word ‘grana’ means ‘seeds’, but in the context of grapes, it refers to individual grapes (which in those days were not seedless).

verses.textEn: You shall not steal. You shall not lie. Neither shall anyone deceive his neighbor.
verses.textLa: Non facietis furtum. Non mentiemini, nec decipiet unusquisque proximum suum.

verses.textEn: You shall not commit perjury in my name, nor shall you pollute the name of your God. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Non periurabis in nomine meo, nec pollues nomen Dei tui. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: You shall not slander your neighbor, nor shall you oppress him by violence. The wages of a hired hand, you shall not delay with you until tomorrow.
verses.textLa: Non facies calumniam proximo tuo, nec vi opprimes eum. Non morabitur opus mercenarii tui apud te usque mane.

verses.textEn: You shall not speak evil of the deaf, nor shall you place a stumbling block before the blind, but you shall fear the Lord your God, for I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Non maledices surdo, nec coram cæco pones offendiculum: sed timebis Dominum Deum tuum, quia ego sum Dominus.

verses.textEn: You shall not do what is unjust, nor shall you judge unjustly. You shall not consider the reputation of the poor, nor shall you honor the countenance of the powerful. Judge your neighbor justly.
verses.textLa: Non facies quod iniquum est, nec iniuste iudicabis. Non consideres personam pauperis, nec honores vultum potentis. Iuste iudica proximo tuo.

verses.textEn: You shall not be a detractor, nor a whisperer, among the people. You shall not stand against the blood of your neighbor. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Non eris criminator, nec susurro in populo. Non stabis contra sanguinem proximi tui. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: You shall not hate your brother in your heart, but reprove him openly, lest you have sin over him.
verses.textLa: Non oderis fratrem tuum in corde tuo, sed publice argue eum, ne habeas super illo peccatum.

verses.textEn: Do not seek revenge, neither should you be mindful of the injury of your fellow citizens. You shall love your friend as yourself. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Non quæras ultionem, nec memor eris iniuriæ civium tuorum. Diliges amicum tuum sicut teipsum. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: Observe my laws. You shall not cause your cattle to breed with other kinds of animals. You shall not sow your field with diverse seeds. You shall not be clothed with a garment which has been woven from two things.
verses.textLa: Leges meas custodite. Iumentum tuum non facies coire cum alterius generis animantibus. Agrum tuum non seres diverso semine. Veste, quæ ex duobus texta est, non indueris.
