verses.textEn: If a man will have slept in sexual intercourse with a woman, who is a servant and who is also able to be married, and yet he has not redeemed her with a price, nor paid to set her free, they both shall be beaten, but they shall not die, for she was not a free woman.
verses.textLa: Homo si dormierit cum muliere coitu seminis, quæ sit ancilla etiam nubilis, et tamen pretio non redempta, nec libertate donata: vapulabunt ambo, et non morientur, quia non fuit libera.

verses.textEn: But, for his offense, he shall offer a ram to the Lord at the door of the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.textLa: Pro delicto autem suo offeret Domino ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii arietem:

verses.textEn: And the priest shall pray for him, and for his sin, before the Lord, and he shall win his favor again for him, and the sin shall be forgiven.
verses.textLa: orabitque pro eo sacerdos, et pro peccato eius coram Domino, et repropitiabitur ei, dimitteturque peccatum.

verses.textEn: When you will have entered into the land, and will have planted in it fruit trees, you shall take away their first-fruits; the fruit that germinates shall be unclean to you, neither shall you eat from these.
verses.textLa: Quando ingressi fueritis terram, et plantaveritis in ea ligna pomifera, auferetis præputia eorum: poma, quæ germinant, immunda erunt vobis, nec edetis ex eis.

verses.textEn: But in the fourth year, all their fruit shall be sanctified for the praise of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Quarto autem anno omnis fructus eorum sanctificabitur laudabilis Domino.

verses.textEn: And in the fifth year you shall eat the produce, gathering the fruits which are brought forth. I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Quinto autem anno comedetis fructus, congregantes poma quæ proferunt. Ego Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: You shall not eat with blood. You shall not practice divination, nor the observation of dreams.
verses.textLa: Non comedetis cum sanguine. Non augurabimini, nec observabitis somnia.

verses.textEn: And you shall not cut the hair of your head circularly, nor shave your beard.
verses.textLa: Neque in rotundum attondebitis comam: nec radetis barbam.

verses.textEn: You shall not cut your flesh for the dead, and you shall not make other figures or marks on yourself. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Et super mortuo non incidetis carnem vestram, neque figuras aliquas, aut stigmata facietis vobis. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: Do not prostitute your daughter, lest the land be contaminated and filled with crimes.
verses.textLa: Ne prostituas filiam tuam, ne contaminetur terra, et impleatur piaculo.

verses.textEn: Observe my Sabbaths, and be apprehensive toward my Sanctuary. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Sabbata mea custodite, et Sanctuarium meum metuite. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: Do not turn aside to astrologers, nor consult with soothsayers, so as to be polluted through them. I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Non declinetis ad magos, nec ab ariolis aliquid sciscitemini, ut polluamini per eos. Ego Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: Rise up in the presence of a gray-haired head, and honor the reputation of an elder, and fear the Lord your God. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Coram cano capite consurge, et honora personam senis: et time Dominum Deum tuum. Ego sum Dominus.

verses.textEn: If a newcomer lives in your land and abides among you, do not reproach him,
verses.textLa: Si habitaverit advena in terra vestra, et moratus fuerit inter vos, non exprobretis ei:

verses.textEn: but let him be among you like one native born. And you shall love him as yourselves. For you were also newcomers in the land of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: sed sit inter vos quasi indigena: et diligetis eum quasi vosmetipsos: fuistis enim et vos advenæ in Terra Ægypti. Ego Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: Do not be willing to accomplish iniquity in judgment, in lengths, in weights, in quantities.
verses.textLa: Nolite facere iniquum aliquid in iudicio, in regula, in pondere, in mensura.

verses.textEn: Let the scales be just and the weights equal, let the dry measure be just and the liquid measure be equal. I am the Lord your God, who led you away from the land of Egypt.
verses.textLa: Statera iusta, et æqua sint pondera, iustus modius, æquusque sextarius. Ego Dominus Deus vester, qui eduxi vos de Terra Ægypti.
verses.notes: The ‘modius’ is a unit of dry measure; the ‘sextarius’ is a unit of liquid measure; or rather, these Latin terms are intended to represent the corresponding Hebrew terms.

verses.textEn: Keep all my precepts, and all my judgments, and accomplish them. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Custodite omnia præcepta mea, et universa iudicia, et facite ea. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: You shall speak these things to the sons of Israel: A man among the sons Israel, or among the newcomers who live in Israel, if he will have given from his seed to the idol Moloch, he shall be put to death: the people of the land shall stone him.
verses.textLa: Hæc loqueris filiis Israel: Homo de filiis Israel, et de advenis, qui habitant in Israel, si quis dederit de semine suo idolo Moloch, morte moriatur: populus terræ lapidabit eum.
verses.notes: Here again is an example where ‘et’ means ‘or’ not ‘and’. The repetition of ‘morte moriatur’ intensifies the meaning of the verb: ‘he must certainly die’ or ‘he shall die a death’ or ‘he must be put to death’ or similarly.

verses.textEn: And I will set my face against him. And I will cut him down from the midst of his people, because he has given from his seed to Moloch, and he has contaminated my Sanctuary, and polluted my holy name.
verses.textLa: Et ego ponam faciem meam contra illum: succidamque eum de medio populi sui, eo quod dederit de semine suo Moloch, et contaminaverit Sanctuarium meum, ac polluerit nomen sanctum meum.

verses.textEn: But if the people of the land, having been neglectful and holding little regard for my authority, release the man who has given from his seed to Moloch, and they are not willing to kill him,
verses.textLa: Quod si negligens populus terræ, et quasi parvipendens imperium meum, dimiserit hominem qui dedit de semine suo Moloch, nec voluerit eum occidere:

verses.textEn: I will set my face over that man and over his kindred, and I will cut down both him and all who consented with him to fornicate with Moloch, from the midst of their people.
verses.textLa: ponam faciem meam super hominem illum, et super cognationem eius, succidamque et ipsum, et omnes qui consensuerunt ei ut fornicarentur cum Moloch, de medio populi sui.

verses.textEn: The soul who will have turned aside to astrologers and soothsayers, and who will have fornicated with them, I will set my face against him, and I will destroy him from the midst of his people.
verses.textLa: Anima, quæ declinaverit ad magos et ariolos, et fornicata fuerit cum eis, ponam faciem meam contra eam, et interficiam illam de medio populi sui.

verses.textEn: Be sanctified and be holy, for I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Sanctificamini et estote sancti, quia ego sum Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: Observe my precepts, and do them. I am the Lord, who sanctifies you.
verses.textLa: Custodite præcepta mea, et facite ea: Ego Dominus qui sanctifico vos.

verses.textEn: Whoever curses his father or mother shall die a death; he has cursed his father and mother. So let his blood be upon him.
verses.textLa: Qui maledixerit patri suo, aut matri, morte moriatur: patri, matrique maledixit, sanguis eius sit super eum.

verses.textEn: If anyone will have committed sexual acts with the wife of another, or will have perpetrated adultery with his neighbor’s spouse, they shall die a death, both the adulterer and the adulteress.
verses.textLa: Si mœchatus quis fuerit cum uxore alterius, et adulterium perpetraverit cum coniuge proximi sui, morte moriantur et mœchus et adultera.

verses.textEn: Whoever will have slept with his stepmother, or will have uncovered the shame of his father, they shall both die a death. So let their blood be upon them.
verses.textLa: Qui dormierit cum noverca sua, et revelaverit ignominiam patris sui, morte moriantur ambo: sanguis eorum sit super eos.

verses.textEn: If any man will have slept with his daughter-in-law, both shall die, for they have acted according to wickedness. So let their blood be upon them.
verses.textLa: Si quis dormierit cum nuru sua, uterque moriatur, quia scelus operati sunt: sanguis eorum sit super eos.

verses.textEn: If any man has slept with a male in place of sexual intercourse with a female, both have committed a nefarious act, they shall die a death. So let their blood be upon them.
verses.textLa: Qui dormierit cum masculo coitu femineo, uterque operatus est nefas, morte moriantur: sit sanguis eorum super eos.
verses.notes: The word ‘Qui’ is masculine here, and the gender of the word is relevant to the context. The word ‘nefas’ could also be translated as ‘a crime against God’ or ‘a crime against divine law’.

verses.textEn: If any man, having taken the daughter as a wife, will have married her mother, he has acted according to wickedness. He shall be burnt alive with them. Neither shall so great a nefarious act persist in your midst.
verses.textLa: Qui supra uxorem filiam, duxerit matrem eius, scelus operatus est: vivus ardebit cum eis, nec permanebit tantum nefas in medio vestri.

verses.textEn: Whoever will have committed sexual acts with any animal or cattle, he shall die a death. Likewise, you shall slay the beast.
verses.textLa: Qui cum iumento et pecore coierit, morte moriatur: pecus quoque occidite.

verses.textEn: The woman who will have lain under any animal at all shall be destroyed together with it. So let their blood be upon them.
verses.textLa: Mulier, quæ succubuerit cuilibet iumento, simul interficietur cum eo: sanguis eorum sit super eos.

verses.textEn: Whoever will have taken his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother, and will have seen her nakedness, and she will have looked upon her brother’s shame, they have committed a nefarious act. They shall be slain in the sight of their people, because they have uncovered one another’s nakedness. And they shall bear their iniquity.
verses.textLa: Qui acceperit sororem suam filiam patris sui, vel filiam matris suæ, et viderit turpitudinem eius, illaque conspexerit fratris ignominiam: nefariam rem operati sunt: occidentur in conspectu populi sui, eo quod turpitudinem suam mutuo revelaverint, et portabunt iniquitatem suam.

verses.textEn: Whoever has sexual intercourse with a woman in her menstrual flow, and has uncovered her nakedness, and she has opened the fountain of her blood, both shall be destroyed from the midst of their people.
verses.textLa: Qui coierit cum muliere in fluxu menstruo, et revelaverit turpitudinem eius, ipsaque aperuerit fontem sanguinis sui, interficientur ambo de medio populi sui.

verses.textEn: You shall not expose the nakedness of your maternal or paternal aunt. Whoever does this has laid bare the shame of his own flesh; both shall bear their iniquity.
verses.textLa: Turpitudinem materteræ, et amitæ tuæ non discooperies: qui hoc fecerit, ignominiam carnis suæ nudavit, portabunt ambo iniquitatem suam.

verses.textEn: If any man has had sexual intercourse with the wife of his paternal or maternal uncle, and he has uncovered the shame of his close relative, both shall bear their sin. They shall die without children.
verses.textLa: Qui coierit cum uxore patrui, vel avunculi sui, et revelaverit ignominiam cognationis suæ, portabunt ambo peccatum suum: absque liberis morientur.

verses.textEn: Whoever will have married his brother’s wife has done an unlawful thing; he has uncovered his brother’s nakedness. They shall be without children.
verses.textLa: Qui duxerit uxorem fratris sui, rem facit illicitam, turpitudinem fratris sui revelavit: absque liberis erunt.
verses.notes: This applies while the brother is still living.

verses.textEn: Observe my laws as well as my judgments, and act according to them, lest the land, into which you will enter and live, may vomit you out, too.
verses.textLa: Custodite leges meas, atque iudicia, et facite ea: ne et vos evomat terra quam intraturi estis et habitaturi.

verses.textEn: Do not be willing to walk by the ordinances of the nations, which I will expel before you. For they have done all these things, and so I abominate them.
verses.textLa: Nolite ambulare in legitimis nationum, quas ego expulsurus sum ante vos. Omnia enim hæc fecerunt, et abominatus sum eas.

verses.textEn: But I say to you: Possess their land, which I will give to you as an inheritance, a land flowing with milk and honey. I am the Lord your God, who has separated you from the other peoples.
verses.textLa: Vobis autem loquor: Possidete terram eorum, quam dabo vobis in hereditatem, terram fluentem lacte et melle. Ego Dominus Deus vester, qui separavi vos a ceteris populis.

verses.textEn: Therefore, you must also separate the clean animals from the unclean, and the clean birds from the unclean. Do not pollute your souls with cattle, or birds, or anything that moves upon the earth, and which I have shown you to be unclean.
verses.textLa: Separate ergo et vos iumentum mundum ab immundo, et avem mundam ab immunda: ne polluatis animas vestras in pecore, et avibus, et cunctis quæ moventur in terra, et quæ vobis ostendi esse polluta.

verses.textEn: You shall be holy unto me, because I, the Lord, am holy, and I have separated you from the other peoples, so that you would be mine.
verses.textLa: Eritis mihi sancti, quia sanctus sum Ego Dominus, et separavi vos a ceteris populis, ut essetis mei.

verses.textEn: A man or a woman, in whom there is an oracle-like or a divining spirit, shall be put to death. They shall stone them. So let their blood be upon them.
verses.textLa: Vir, sive mulier, in quibus pythonicus, vel divinationis fuerit spiritus, morte moriantur. Lapidibus obruent eos: sanguis eorum sit super illos.

verses.textEn: The Lord also said to Moses: Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and you shall say to them: Do not allow a priest to be contaminated by the death of his citizens,
verses.textLa: Dixit quoque Dominus ad Moysen: Loquere ad sacerdotes filios Aaron, et dices ad eos: Ne contaminetur sacerdos in mortibus civium suorum,

verses.textEn: except only by his blood-relatives and near-relatives, that is, by a father or mother, or by a son or daughter, or also a brother,
verses.textLa: nisi tantum in consanguineis, ac propinquis, id est, super patre et matre, et filio, et filia, fratre quoque,

verses.textEn: or a virgin sister, who is not married to a husband.
verses.textLa: et sorore virgine quæ non est nupta viro:

verses.textEn: But not even by the leader of his people shall he be contaminated.
verses.textLa: sed nec in principe populi sui contaminabitur.

verses.textEn: Neither shall they shave their head or their beard, and they shall not make incisions in their flesh.
verses.textLa: Non radent caput, nec barbam, neque in carnibus suis facient incisuras.

verses.textEn: They shall be holy to their God, and they shall not pollute his name. For they offer the incense of the Lord and the bread of their God, and because of this they shall be holy.
verses.textLa: Sancti erunt Deo suo, et non polluent nomen eius: incensum enim Domini, et panes Dei sui offerunt, et ideo sancti erunt.

verses.textEn: They shall not take as a wife a promiscuous woman, or a prostitute, or her who has been repudiated by her husband. For they are consecrated to their God,
verses.textLa: Scortum et vile prostibulum non ducent uxorem, nec eam, quæ repudiata est a marito: quia consecrati sunt Deo suo,

verses.textEn: and they offer the bread of the presence. Therefore, let them be holy, for I also am holy: the Lord, who sanctifies them.
verses.textLa: et panes propositionis offerunt. Sint ergo sancti, quia et ego sanctus sum, Dominus, qui sanctifico eos.

verses.textEn: If the daughter of a priest will have been taken into prostitution, and will have violated the name of her father, she shall be consumed by fire.
verses.textLa: Sacerdotis filia si deprehensa fuerit in stupro, et violaverit nomen patris sui, flammis exuretur.

verses.textEn: The high priest, that is, the priest who is the greatest among his brothers, upon whose head the oil of anointing has been poured, and whose hands have been consecrated for the priesthood, and who has been vested with the holy vestments: he shall not expose his head; he shall not rend his vestments.
verses.textLa: Pontifex, id est, sacerdos maximus inter fratres suos, super cuius caput fusum est unctionis oleum, et cuius manus in sacerdotio consecratæ sunt, vestitusque est sanctis vestibus, caput suum non discooperiet, vestimenta non scindet:

verses.textEn: And he shall not enter to any dead body whatsoever; likewise, not even by his father or mother shall he be contaminated.
verses.textLa: et ad omnem mortuum non ingredietur omnino, super patre quoque suo, et matre non contaminabitur.

verses.textEn: Neither shall he exit from the holy places, lest he pollute the Sanctuary of the Lord. For the oil of the holy anointing of his God is upon him. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Nec egredietur de sanctis, ne polluat Sanctuarium Domini, quia oleum sanctæ unctionis Dei sui super eum est. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: He shall take a virgin as his wife.
verses.textLa: Virginem ducet uxorem:

verses.textEn: But a widow, or one who has been repudiated or defiled, or also a mistress, he shall not accept, but only a maiden from among his own people.
verses.textLa: Viduam autem et repudiatam, et sordidam, atque meretricem non accipiet, sed puellam de populo suo:

verses.textEn: He shall not mingle the stock of his family with the common people of his nation. For I am the Lord, who sanctifies him.
verses.textLa: ne commisceat stirpem generis sui vulgo gentis suæ: quia Ego Dominus qui sanctifico eum.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Say to Aaron: A man from your offspring, throughout their families, who has a blemish, shall not offer the bread to his God.
verses.textLa: Loquere ad Aaron: Homo de semine tuo per familias qui habuerit maculam, non offeret panes Deo suo,

verses.textEn: Neither shall he approach to minister to him: if he is blind, if he is lame, if he is small, or large, or has a crooked nose,
verses.textLa: nec accedet ad ministerium eius: si cæcus fuerit, si claudus, si parvo vel grandi, vel torto naso,

verses.textEn: if his foot or hand is broken,
verses.textLa: si fracto pede, si manu,

verses.textEn: if he has a bulging back or bleary eyes, or if he has a white spot in his eye, or a chronic scab, or a skin disease on his body, or a hernia.
verses.textLa: si gibbus, si lippus, si albuginem habens in oculo, si iugem scabiem, si impetiginem in corpore, vel herniosus.

verses.textEn: Anyone from the offspring of Aaron, the priest, who has a blemish, shall not approach to offer sacrifices to the Lord, nor the bread to his God.
verses.textLa: Omnis qui habuerit maculam de semine Aaron sacerdotis, non accedet offerre hostias Domino, nec panes Deo suo:

verses.textEn: Nevertheless, he shall eat from the loaves which are offered in the Sanctuary.
verses.textLa: vescetur tamen panibus, qui offeruntur in Sanctuario,

verses.textEn: But even so, he may not enter within the veil, nor approach to the altar. For he has a blemish, and he must not contaminate my Sanctuary. I am the Lord, who sanctifies them.
verses.textLa: ita dumtaxat, ut intra velum non ingrediatur, nec accedat ad altare, quia maculam habet, et contaminare non debet Sanctuarium meum. Ego Dominus qui sanctifico eos.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Moses spoke to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all of Israel, everything that had been commanded to him.
verses.textLa: Locutus est ergo Moyses ad Aaron, et ad filios eius, et ad omnem Israel cuncta quæ fuerant sibi imperata.

verses.textEn: The Lord also spoke to Moses saying:
verses.textLa: Locutus quoque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to Aaron and to his sons, so that they may be careful of those things which have been consecrated for the sons of Israel, and so that they may not contaminate the name of the things sanctified to me, which they offer. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Loquere ad Aaron et ad filios eius, ut caveant ab his quæ consecrata sunt filiorum Israel, et non contaminent nomen sanctificatorum mihi, quæ ipsi offerunt. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: Say to them and to their posterity: Every man of your stock, who approaches toward those things which have been consecrated, and which the sons of Israel have brought forward to the Lord, in whom there is uncleanness, shall perish before the Lord. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Dic ad eos, et ad posteros eorum: Omnis homo, qui accesserit de stirpe vestra ad ea quæ consecrata sunt, et quæ obtulerunt filii Israel Domino, in quo est immunditia, peribit coram Domino. Ego sum Dominus.

verses.textEn: The man of the offspring of Aaron, who is a leper or who is suffering a flow of seed, shall not eat of those things which have been sanctified to me, until he is healed. Whoever will have touched what is unclean because of the dead, and he whose seed goes out from him, as if from sexual intercourse,
verses.textLa: Homo de semine Aaron, qui fuerit leprosus, aut patiens fluxum seminis, non vescetur de his quæ sanctificata sunt mihi donec sanetur. Qui tetigerit immundum super mortuo, et ex quo egreditur semen quasi coitus,

verses.textEn: and whoever has touched a creeping thing, or any kind of unclean thing, the touching of which is filthy,
verses.textLa: et qui tangit reptile, et quodlibet immundum, cuius tactus est sordidus,

verses.textEn: shall be unclean until evening, and shall not eat those things which have been sanctified. But when he has washed his flesh with water,
verses.textLa: immundus erit usque ad vesperum, et non vescetur his quæ sanctificata sunt: sed cum laverit carnem suam aqua,

verses.textEn: and the sun has set, then, having been purified, he shall eat from what has been sanctified, because it is his food.
verses.textLa: et occubuerit sol, tunc mundatus vescetur de sanctificatis, quia cibus illius est.

verses.textEn: Whatever dies on its own, and whatever has been seized by a wild beast, they shall not eat, nor shall they be polluted by these. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Morticinum et captum a bestia non comedent, nec polluentur in eis. Ego sum Dominus.

verses.textEn: Let them observe my precepts, so that they may not fall under sin, and die in the Sanctuary, when they will have defiled it. I am the Lord, who sanctifies them.
verses.textLa: Custodiant præcepta mea, ut non subiaceant peccato, et moriantur in Sanctuario, cum polluerint illud. Ego Dominus qui sanctifico eos.

verses.textEn: No foreigner shall eat from what has been sanctified; a guest of the priests and a hired servant shall not eat from them.
verses.textLa: Omnis alienigena non comedet de sanctificatis, inquilinus sacerdotis, et mercenarius non vescentur ex eis.

verses.textEn: But whomever the priest has bought, and whoever has been born into his house, these shall eat from them.
verses.textLa: Quem autem sacerdos emerit, et qui vernaculus domus eius fuerit, his comedent ex eis.

verses.textEn: If the daughter of a priest has been married to any of the people, she shall not eat from what has been sanctified, nor from the first-fruits.
verses.textLa: Si filia sacerdotis cuilibet ex populo nupta fuerit: de his quæ sanctificata sunt, et de primitiis non vescetur.

verses.textEn: But if she is a widow or divorced, and, being without children, she returns to her father’s house, she shall be nourished by her father’s foods, just as she was accustomed to do as a girl. No foreigner shall have the authority to eat from them.
verses.textLa: Sin autem vidua, vel repudiata, et absque liberis reversa fuerit ad domum patris sui: sicut puella consueverat, aletur cibis patris sui. Omnis alienigena comedendi ex eis non habet potestatem.

verses.textEn: Whoever, through ignorance, eats from what has been sanctified shall add a fifth part to that which he ate, and he shall give it to the priest at the Sanctuary.
verses.textLa: Qui comederit de sanctificatis per ignorantiam, addet quintam partem cum eo quod comedit, et dabit sacerdoti in Sanctuarium.
verses.notes: So this rule is like the 20% restocking fee that some stores today have : )

verses.textEn: And they shall not contaminate what has been sanctified from the sons of Israel, which they offer to the Lord,
verses.textLa: Nec contaminabunt sanctificata filiorum Israel, quæ offerunt Domino:

verses.textEn: lest perhaps they may suffer the iniquity of their offense, when they will have eaten what has been sanctified. I am the Lord, who sanctifies them.
verses.textLa: ne forte sustineant iniquitatem delicti sui, cum sanctificata comederint. Ego Dominus qui sanctifico eos.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: The man from the house of Israel, or from the newcomers who live with you, who would bring forward his oblation, either fulfilling his vows or offering spontaneously, whatever he brings forward as a holocaust for the Lord,
verses.textLa: Loquere ad Aaron et filios eius et ad omnes filios Israel, dicesque ad eos: Homo de domo Israel, et de advenis qui habitant apud vos, qui obtulerit oblationem suam, vel vota solvens, vel sponte offerens, quidquid illud obtulerit in holocaustum Domini,

verses.textEn: in order to be offered through you, shall offer an immaculate male from the oxen, or from the sheep, or from the goats.
verses.textLa: ut offeratur per vos masculus immaculatus erit ex bobus, et ovibus, et ex capris:
verses.notes: The text literally says ‘it shall be’, but the sentence is grammatically awkward in English, so the translation is ‘shall offer’. This aligns the subject of the sentence (‘the man’) with the verb.

verses.textEn: If it has a blemish, you shall not offer it, and it shall not be acceptable.
verses.textLa: si maculam habuerit, non offeretis, neque erit acceptabile.

verses.textEn: The man who will have offered a victim of peace offerings to the Lord, either fulfilling his vows or offering spontaneously, whether of oxen, or of sheep, shall offer what is immaculate, so that it may be acceptable. There shall be no blemish in it.
verses.textLa: Homo qui obtulerit victimam pacificorum Domino, vel vota solvens, vel sponte offerens, tam de bobus quam de ovibus, immaculatum offeret, ut acceptabile sit: omnis macula non erit in eo.

verses.textEn: If it is blind, or if it is broken, or if it has a scar, or if it is has a boil, or a skin disease or infection, you shall not offer these to the Lord, nor shall you burn any of these upon the altar of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Si cæcum fuerit, si fractum, si cicatricem habens, si papulas, aut scabiem, aut impetiginem: non offeretis ea Domino, nec adolebitis ex eis super altare Domini.

verses.textEn: An ox or a sheep, having an amputated ear or tail, you are able to offer voluntarily, but a vow is not able to be fulfilled by these.
verses.textLa: Bovem et ovem, aure et cauda amputatis, voluntarie offerre potes, votum autem ex eis solvi non potest.

verses.textEn: You shall not offer to the Lord any animal which has the testicles bruised, or crushed, or cut and taken away, and you shall not cause any of these things in your land.
verses.textLa: Omne animal, quod vel contritis, vel tusis, vel sectis ablatisque testiculis est, non offeretis Domino, et in terra vestra hoc omnino ne faciatis.

verses.textEn: From the hand of a foreigner, you shall not offer bread to your God, nor anything else that he would choose to give; for all this has been corrupted and blemished. You shall not accept them.
verses.textLa: De manu alienigenæ non offeretis panes Deo vestro, et quidquid aliud dare voluerit: quia corrupta, et maculata sunt omnia: non suscipietis ea.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: An ox, a sheep, or a goat, when they have been born, shall be under the udder of their mother for seven days. But on the eighth day and thereafter, they are able to be offered to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Bos, ovis, et capra cum genita fuerint, septem diebus erunt sub ubere matris suæ: die autem octavo, et deinceps offerri poterunt Domino.

verses.textEn: Whether it is an ox, or a sheep, they shall not be immolated on the same day with their newborns.
verses.textLa: Sive illa bos, sive ovis, non immolabuntur una die cum fœtibus suis.

verses.textEn: If you immolate a victim as an act of thanksgiving to the Lord, so that he may be pleased,
verses.textLa: Si immolaveritis hostiam pro gratiarum actione Domino, ut possit esse placabilis,

verses.textEn: you shall eat it on the same day; none of it shall remain until morning on the next day. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: eodem die comedetis eam, non remanebit quidquam in mane alterius diei. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: Observe my commandments, and do them. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Custodite mandata mea, et facite ea. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: Do not pollute my holy name, so that I may be sanctified in the midst of the sons of Israel. I am the Lord, who sanctifies you,
verses.textLa: Ne polluatis nomen meum sanctum, ut sanctificer in medio filiorum Israel. Ego Dominus qui sanctifico vos,

verses.textEn: and who led you away from the land of Egypt, so that I may be to you as God. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: et eduxi de Terra Ægypti, ut essem vobis in Deum. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: These are the feasts of the Lord, which you shall call holy.
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Hæ sunt feriæ Domini, quas vocabitis sanctas.

verses.textEn: For six days you shall do work; the seventh day, because it is the rest of the Sabbath, shall be called holy. You shall do no work on that day; it is the Sabbath of the Lord in all your dwelling places.
verses.textLa: Sex diebus facietis opus: dies septimus, quia Sabbati requies est, vocabitur sanctus. Omne opus non facietis in eo. Sabbatum Domini est in cunctis habitationibus vestris.

verses.textEn: Therefore, these are the feasts of the Lord, which you must celebrate in their times.
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt ergo feriæ Domini sanctæ, quas celebrare debetis temporibus suis.

verses.textEn: The first month, the fourteenth day of the month, at evening, is the Passover of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Mense primo, quartadecima die mensis ad vesperum, Phase Domini est:

verses.textEn: And the fifteenth day of this month is the solemnity of the unleavened bread of the Lord. For seven days shall you eat unleavened bread.
verses.textLa: et quintadecima die mensis huius, sollemnitas azymorum Domini est. Septem diebus azyma comedetis.

verses.textEn: The first day shall be greatly honored and holy to you; you shall do no servile work in it.
verses.textLa: Dies primus erit vobis celeberrimus, sanctusque: omne opus servile non facietis in eo:

verses.textEn: But you shall offer a sacrifice with fire, for seven days, to the Lord. Then the seventh day shall be more honored and more holy; and you shall do no servile work in it.
verses.textLa: sed offeretis sacrificium in igne Domino septem diebus. Dies autem septimus erit celebrior et sanctior: nullumque servile opus facietis in eo.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: When you will have entered into the land which I will give to you, and you will have harvested your grain fields, you shall carry the sheaves of grain, the first-fruits of your harvest, to the priest.
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Cum ingressi fueritis terram, quam ego dabo vobis, et messueritis segetem, feretis manipulos spicarum, primitias messis vestræ ad sacerdotem:

verses.textEn: He shall lift up a sheaf before the Lord, on the day after the Sabbath, so that it may be acceptable for you, and he shall sanctify it.
verses.textLa: qui elevabit fasciculum coram Domino, ut acceptabile sit pro vobis, altero die Sabbati, et sanctificabit illum.

verses.textEn: And on the same day that the sheaf is consecrated, a one-year-old immaculate lamb shall be slain as a holocaust of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Atque in eodem die quo manipulus consecratur, cædetur agnus immaculatus anniculus in holocaustum Domini.

verses.textEn: And the libations shall be offered with it: two-tenths of fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil, as an incense and a most sweet odor for the Lord; likewise, libations of wine, the fourth part of a hin.
verses.textLa: Et libamenta offerentur cum eo, duæ decimæ similæ conspersæ oleo in incensum Domini, odoremque suavissimum: liba quoque vini, quarta pars hin.

verses.textEn: Bread, and parched grain, and boiled grain, you shall not eat from the grain field, until the day when you shall offer from it to your God. It is an everlasting precept in your generations and in all of your dwelling places.
verses.textLa: Panem, et polentam, et pultes non comedetis ex segete, usque ad diem qua offeretis ex ea Deo vestro. Præceptum est sempiternum in generationibus, cunctisque habitaculis vestris.
verses.notes: The day for this offering of the first-fruits from the grain field is the day after the first Sabbath of the Passover. The disciples of Jesus were eating from the grain field on the second-first Sabbath, that is, on the first Sabbath after the Passover, not on the first Sabbath during the Passover. Therefore, they were eating from the grain field after the first-fruits had been offered.

verses.textEn: Therefore, you shall number from the day after the Sabbath, in which you offered a sheaf of the first-fruits, seven full weeks,
verses.textLa: Numerabitis ergo ab altero die Sabbati, in quo obtulistis manipulum primitiarum, septem hebdomadas plenas,

verses.textEn: all the way to the day after the completion of the seventh week, that is, fifty days, and then you shall offer a new sacrifice to the Lord,
verses.textLa: usque ad alteram diem expletionis hebdomadæ septimæ, id est quinquaginta dies: et sic offeretis sacrificium novum Domino

verses.textEn: from all of your dwelling places: two loaves from the first-fruits, from two-tenths of leavened fine wheat flour, which you shall bake as the first-fruits of the Lord.
verses.textLa: ex omnibus habitaculis vestris, panes primitiarum duos de duabus decimis similæ fermentatæ, quos coquetis in primitias Domini.

verses.textEn: And you shall offer with the bread: seven immaculate one-year-old lambs, and one calf from the herd, and two rams, and these shall be a holocaust, with their libations, as a most sweet odor to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Offeretisque cum panibus septem agnos immaculatos anniculos, et vitulum de armento unum, et arietes duos, et erunt in holocaustum cum libamentis suis, in odorem suavissimum Domini.

verses.textEn: You shall also offer a he-goat for sin, and two one-year-old lambs as victims of peace offerings.
verses.textLa: Facietis et hircum pro peccato, duosque agnos anniculos hostias pacificorum.

verses.textEn: And when the priest has lifted them up with the loaves of the first-fruits, in the sight of the Lord, they shall fall to his use.
verses.textLa: Cumque elevaverit eos sacerdos cum panibus primitiarum coram Domino, cedent in usum eius.

verses.textEn: And you shall call this day most honored and most holy; you shall do no servile work in it. It shall be an everlasting ordinance in all your dwelling places and generations.
verses.textLa: Et vocabitis hunc diem celeberrimum, atque sanctissimum: omne opus servile non facietis in eo. Legitimum sempiternum erit in cunctis habitaculis, et generationibus vestris.

verses.textEn: And when you will have harvested the grain fields of your land, you shall not cut it down all the way to the ground; neither shall you gather the remnants of the ears of grain, but you shall leave these for paupers and strangers. I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Postquam autem messueritis segetem terræ vestræ, nec secabitis eam usque ad solum: nec remanentes spicas colligetis, sed pauperibus et peregrinis dimittetis eas. Ego sum Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Say to the sons of Israel: The seventh month, the first day of the month, shall be a Sabbath for you, a memorial, with the sounding of trumpets, and it shall be called holy.
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel: Mense septimo, prima die mensis, erit vobis sabbatum, memoriale, clangentibus tubis, et vocabitur sanctum:

verses.textEn: You shall do no servile work in it, and you shall offer a holocaust to the Lord.
verses.textLa: omne opus servile non facietis in eo, et offeretis holocaustum Domino.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: The tenth day of this seventh month shall be the day of atonement; it shall be most honored, and it shall be called holy. And you shall afflict your souls on that day, and you shall offer a holocaust to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Decimo die mensis huius septimi, dies expiationum erit celeberrimus, et vocabitur sanctus: affligetisque animas vestras in eo, et offeretis holocaustum Domino.

verses.textEn: You shall do no servile work in the time of this day; for it is a day of propitiation, so that the Lord your God may be merciful to you.
verses.textLa: Omne opus servile non facietis in tempore diei huius: quia dies propitiationis est, ut propitietur vobis Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: Every soul that has not been afflicted on this day shall perish from his people,
verses.textLa: Omnis anima, quæ afflicta non fuerit die hac, peribit de populis suis:

verses.textEn: and anyone who will have done work, I shall wipe him away from his people.
verses.textLa: et quæ operis quippiam fecerit, delebo eam de populo suo.

verses.textEn: Therefore, you shall do no work on that day. This shall be an everlasting ordinance for you in all your generations and dwelling places.
verses.textLa: Nihil ergo operis facietis in eo: legitimum sempiternum erit vobis in cunctis generationibus, et habitationibus vestris.

verses.textEn: It is a Sabbath of rest, and you shall afflict your souls beginning on the ninth day of the month: from evening until evening you shall celebrate your Sabbaths.
verses.textLa: Sabbatum requietionis est, et affligetis animas vestras die nono mensis: A vespera usque ad vesperam celebrabitis sabbata vestra.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Say to the sons of Israel: From the fifteenth day of this seventh month, there shall be the Feast of Tabernacles: seven days for the Lord.
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel: A quintodecimo die mensis huius septimi, erunt feriæ tabernaculorum septem diebus Domino.

verses.textEn: The first day shall be called most honored and most holy; you shall do no servile work in it.
verses.textLa: Dies primus vocabitur celeberrimus atque sanctissimus: omne opus servile non facietis in eo.

verses.textEn: And for seven days you shall offer holocausts to the Lord. Likewise, the eighth day shall be most honored and most holy, and you shall offer holocausts to the Lord. For it is the day of assembly and gathering. You shall do no servile work in it.
verses.textLa: Et septem diebus offeretis holocausta Domino. Dies quoque octavus erit celeberrimus atque sanctissimus, et offeretis holocaustum Domino: est enim cœtus atque collectæ: omne opus servile non facietis in eo.

verses.textEn: These are the feasts of the Lord, which you shall call most honored and most holy, and in them you shall offer oblations to the Lord: holocausts and libations according to the rite of each particular day,
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt feriæ Domini, quas vocabitis celeberrimas atque sanctissimas, offeretisque in eis oblationes Domino, holocausta et libamenta iuxta ritum uniuscuiusque diei:

verses.textEn: aside from the Sabbaths of the Lord, and your donations, and that which you offer by a vow, or which you give to the Lord spontaneously.
verses.textLa: exceptis sabbatis Domini, donisque vestris, et quæ offeretis ex voto, vel quæ sponte tribuetis Domino.

verses.textEn: Therefore, from the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you will have gathered together all the fruits of your land, you shall celebrate the feast of the Lord for seven days. The first day and the eighth day shall be a Sabbath, that is, a day of rest.
verses.textLa: A quintodecimo ergo die mensis septimi, quando congregaveritis omnes fructus terræ vestræ, celebrabitis ferias Domini septem diebus. Die primo et die octavo erit sabbatum, id est requies.

verses.textEn: And you shall take for yourselves, on the first day, the fruits of the most beautiful tree, and branches of palm trees, and branches of trees with thick foliage, and willows from the torrent. And you shall rejoice in the sight of the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Sumetisque vobis die primo fructus arboris pulcherrimæ, spatulasque palmarum, et ramos ligni densarum frondium, et salices de torrente, et lætabimini coram Domino Deo vestro.
verses.notes: The word ‘tree’ is singular because it is a foreshadowing of the Virgin Mary, the most beautiful tree from the human race, who gave birth to the Messiah as the fruit of her womb.

verses.textEn: And you shall celebrate its solemnity for seven days each year. This shall be an everlasting ordinance in your generations. In the seventh month, you shall celebrate the feast,
verses.textLa: Celebrabitisque sollemnitatem eius septem diebus per annum. Legitimum sempiternum erit in generationibus vestris. Mense septimo festa celebrabitis,

verses.textEn: and you shall live under shelters for seven days. All who are of the family of Israel shall dwell in tabernacles,
verses.textLa: et habitabitis in umbraculis septem diebus. Omnis, qui de genere est Israel, manebit in tabernaculis:

verses.textEn: so that your posterity may learn that I caused the sons of Israel to live in tabernacles, when I led them away from the land of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: ut discant posteri vestri quod in tabernaculis habitare fecerim filios Israel, cum educerem eos de Terra Ægypti. Ego Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: And Moses spoke about the solemnities of the Lord to the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Moyses super sollemnitatibus Domini ad filios Israel.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Instruct the sons of Israel, so that they may bring to you clear oil from the purest olives, in order to supply the lamps continuously
verses.textLa: Præcipe filiis Israel, ut afferant tibi oleum de olivis purissimum, ac lucidum, ad concinnandas lucernas iugiter,

verses.textEn: outside the veil of the testimony in the tabernacle of the covenant. And Aaron shall place these, from evening until morning, before the Lord, as a perpetual worship and ritual in your generations.
verses.textLa: extra velum testimonii in tabernaculo fœderis. Ponetque eas Aaron a vespere usque ad mane coram Domino, cultu rituque perpetuo in generationibus vestris.

verses.textEn: They shall be placed upon the most pure candlestick in the sight of the Lord always.
verses.textLa: Super candelabrum mundissimum ponentur semper in conspectu Domini.

verses.textEn: You shall also receive fine wheat flour, and you shall bake twelve loaves from it, each loaf of which shall have two-tenths.
verses.textLa: Accipies quoque similam, et coques ex ea duodecim panes, qui singuli habebunt duas decimas:

verses.textEn: And you shall arrange them, six on each side, upon the most pure table before the Lord.
verses.textLa: quorum senos altrinsecus super mensam purissimam coram Domino statues:

verses.textEn: And you shall place upon them the clearest frankincense, so that the bread may be a memorial of oblation for the Lord.
verses.textLa: et pones super eos thus lucidissimum, ut sit panis in monimentum oblationis Domini.

verses.textEn: On each Sabbath, they shall be changed before the Lord, having been received from the sons of Israel as an everlasting covenant.
verses.textLa: Per singula sabbata mutabuntur coram Domino suscepti a filiis Israel fœdere sempiterno:

verses.textEn: And they shall be for Aaron and his sons, so that they may eat these in the holy place; for it is the Holy of holies from the sacrifices of the Lord, as a perpetual right.
verses.textLa: eruntque Aaron et filiorum eius, ut comedant eos in loco sancto: quia Sanctum sanctorum est de sacrificiis Domini iure perpetuo.

verses.textEn: Then, behold, the son of an Israelite woman, whom she had born of an Egyptian man among the sons of Israel, going out, was quarreling in the camp with a man of Israel.
verses.textLa: Ecce autem egressus filius mulieris Israelitidis, quem pepererat de viro Ægyptio inter filios Israel, iurgatus est in castris cum viro Israelita.

verses.textEn: And when he had blasphemed the name, and had cursed it, he was led to Moses. (Now his mother was called Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri from the tribe of Dan.)
verses.textLa: Cumque blasphemasset nomen, et maledixisset ei, adductus est ad Moysen. (Vocabatur autem mater eius Salumith, filia Dabri de tribu Dan.)

verses.textEn: And they sent him to prison, until they might know what the Lord would command,
verses.textLa: Miseruntque eum in carcerem, donec nossent quid iuberet Dominus.

verses.textEn: who spoke to Moses,
verses.textLa: Qui locutus est ad Moysen,

verses.textEn: saying: Lead away the blasphemer beyond the camp, and let all who heard him place their hands upon his head, and let the entire people stone him.
verses.textLa: dicens: Educ blasphemum extra castra, et ponant omnes qui audierunt, manus suas super caput eius, et lapidet eum populus universus.

verses.textEn: And you shall say to the sons of Israel: The man who curses his God shall bear his sin,
verses.textLa: Et ad filios Israel loqueris: Homo, qui maledixerit Deo suo, portabit peccatum suum:

verses.textEn: and whoever will have blasphemed the name of the Lord shall be put to death. The entire multitude shall overwhelm him with stones, whether he be a citizen or a sojourner. Whoever blasphemes the name of the Lord shall be put to death.
verses.textLa: et qui blasphemaverit nomen Domini, morte moriatur: lapidibus opprimet eum omnis multitudo, sive ille civis, sive peregrinus fuerit. Qui blasphemaverit nomen Domini, morte moriatur.

verses.textEn: Whoever will have struck and killed a man shall be put to death.
verses.textLa: Qui percusserit, et occiderit hominem, morte moriatur.

verses.textEn: Whoever will have struck down an animal shall repay its equivalent, that is, a life for a life.
verses.textLa: Qui percusserit animal, reddet vicarium, id est animam pro anima.

verses.textEn: Whoever will have inflicted a blemish on any of his citizens, just as he has done, so shall it be done to him:
verses.textLa: Qui irrogaverit maculam cuilibet civium suorum: sicut fecit, sic fiet ei:

verses.textEn: fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, shall he repay. Whatever degree of blemish he has inflicted, so shall he be compelled to suffer.
verses.textLa: fracturam pro fractura, oculum pro oculo, dentem pro dente restituet. Qualem inflixerit maculam, talem sustinere cogetur.

verses.textEn: Whoever strikes down a beast, shall repay another. Whoever strikes a man shall be punished.
verses.textLa: Qui percusserit iumentum, reddet aliud. Qui percusserit hominem, punietur.

verses.textEn: Let there be equal judgment among you, whether it is a sojourner or a citizen who will have sinned. For I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Æquum iudicium sit inter vos, sive peregrinus, sive civis peccaverit: quia ego sum Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: And Moses spoke to the sons of Israel. And they led away him who had blasphemed, beyond the camp, and they overwhelmed him with stones. And the sons of Israel did just as the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Moyses ad filios Israel: et eduxerunt eum, qui blasphemaverat, extra castra, ac lapidibus oppresserunt. Feceruntque filii Israel sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses on mount Sinai, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen in monte Sinai, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: When you will have entered into the land which I will give to you, rest on the Sabbath of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Quando ingressi fueritis terram quam ego dabo vobis, sabbatizes sabbatum Domino.
verses.notes: The Hebrew word Shabbat (Shin-Bet-Tav) means to rest; so the Latin expression ‘sabbatizes sabbatum’ means to rest on the Sabbath.

verses.textEn: For six years you shall sow your field, and for six years you shall care for your vineyard, and you shall gather its fruits.
verses.textLa: Sex annis seres agrum tuum, et sex annis putabis vineam tuam, colligesque fructus eius:

verses.textEn: But in the seventh year, there shall be a Sabbath of the land, a resting of the Lord. You shall not sow your field, and you shall not care for your vineyard.
verses.textLa: septimo autem anno sabbatum erit terræ, requietionis Domini: agrum non seres, et vineam non putabis.

verses.textEn: What the soil shall spontaneously produce, you shall not harvest. And you shall not gather the grapes of the first-fruits as a crop. For it is a year of rest for the land.
verses.textLa: Quæ sponte gignet humus, non metes: et uvas primitiarum tuarum non colliges quasi vindemiam: annus enim requietionis terræ est:

verses.textEn: But these shall be yours for food, for you and for your men and women servants, and for your hired hands, and for the newcomers who sojourn with you:
verses.textLa: sed erunt vobis in cibum, tibi et servo tuo, ancillæ et mercenario tuo, et advenæ qui peregrinantur apud te:

verses.textEn: all that grows on its own shall provide food for your beasts and cattle.
verses.textLa: iumentis tuis et pecoribus omnia quæ nascuntur, præbebunt cibum.

verses.textEn: You shall also number for yourselves seven weeks of years, that is, seven times seven, which together makes forty-nine years.
verses.textLa: Numerabis quoque tibi septem hebdomadas annorum, id est, septies septem, quæ simul faciunt annos quadraginta novem:

verses.textEn: And you shall sound the trumpet in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, at the time of the atonement, throughout all your land.
verses.textLa: et clanges buccina mense septimo, decima die mensis, propitiationis tempore, in universa terra vestra.

verses.textEn: And you shall sanctify the fiftieth year, and you shall proclaim a remission for all the inhabitants of your land: for the same is the Jubilee. A man shall return to his possession, and each one shall go back to his original family,
verses.textLa: Sanctificabisque annum quinquagesimum, et vocabis remissionem cunctis habitatoribus terræ tuæ: ipse est enim Iubilæus. Revertetur homo ad possessionem suam, et unusquisque rediet ad familiam pristinam:
verses.notes: The Sabbatical years began in springtime, but the Jubilee year began in autumn, so it overlapped the 49th and Sabbatical year and the 50th year, which was also the first year in the next cycle of years.

verses.textEn: for it is the Jubilee and the fiftieth year. You shall not sow, and you shall not reap what grows in the field of its own accord, and you shall not gather the first-fruits of the crop,
verses.textLa: quia Iubilæus est et quinquagesimus annus. Non seretis, neque metetis sponte in agro nascentia, et primitias vindemiæ non colligetis,

verses.textEn: due to the sanctification of the Jubilee. But you shall eat them as they present themselves.
verses.textLa: ob sanctificationem Iubilæi, sed statim oblata comedetis.
verses.notes: The word ‘statim’ does not always mean ‘immediately’, but often has more of the meaning of ‘in the present time’.

verses.textEn: In the year of the Jubilee, all shall return to their possessions.
verses.textLa: Anno Iubilæi redient omnes ad possessiones suas.

verses.textEn: When you will sell anything to your fellow citizen, or buy anything from him, do not cause your brother grief, but buy from him according to the number of years from the Jubilee,
verses.textLa: Quando vendes quippiam civi tuo, vel emes ab eo, ne contristes fratrem tuum, sed iuxta numerum annorum Iubilei emes ab eo,

verses.textEn: and he shall sell to you according to the computation of the produce.
verses.textLa: et iuxta supputationem frugum vendet tibi.

verses.textEn: The more years that will remain after the Jubilee, the more the price shall increase, and the less the time is numbered, so much less shall the purchase price be. For he will sell to you the time for the produce.
verses.textLa: Quanto plures anni remanserint post Iubilæum, tanto crescet et pretium: et quanto minus temporis numeraveris, tanto minoris et emptio constabit. Tempus enim frugum vendet tibi.

verses.textEn: Do not be willing to afflict your countrymen, but let each one fear his God. For I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Nolite affligere contribules vestros, sed timeat unusquisque Deum suum, quia Ego Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: Accomplish my precepts, and observe my judgments, and complete them, so that you may be able to live in the land without any fear,
verses.textLa: Facite præcepta mea, et iudicia custodite, et implete ea, ut habitare possitis in terra absque ullo pavore,

verses.textEn: and so that the soil may produce its fruits for you, from which you may eat, even to fullness, dreading violence by no one.
verses.textLa: et gignat vobis humus fructus suos, quibus vescamini usque ad saturitatem, nullius impetum formidantes.

verses.textEn: But if you will say: What shall we eat in the seventh year, if we do not sow and do not gather our produce?
verses.textLa: Quod si dixeritis: Quid comedemus anno septimo, si non severimus, neque collegerimus fruges nostras?

verses.textEn: I will give my blessing to you in the sixth year, and it shall yield the produce of three years.
verses.textLa: Dabo benedictionem meam vobis anno sexto, et faciet fructus trium annorum:

verses.textEn: And in the eighth year you shall sow, but you shall eat from the old produce, until the ninth year, until what is new matures, you shall eat what is old.
verses.textLa: seretisque anno octavo, et comedetis veteres fruges usque ad nonum annum: donec nova nascantur, edetis vetera.
verses.notes: The Sabbatical year, in the times before Herod the great captured Jerusalem, was counted from spring to spring, not from fall to fall, as the Jews today count it. The Jews could plant in the fall of year 6; they could not harvest the following spring, because year 7, the Sabbatical year, had begun. But there would be a full crop in the field from the previous fall’s planting. Then, in the fall of year 7, the crop would self-sow, producing a full crop for harvest in year 8, that is, in year 1 of the next cycle of seven years. But the Jubilee year began in the fall, that is, in the fall of year 7. So the following spring, in year 8, they still could not harvest the crop, but again they could eat from the field what had self-sown the previous fall. Then in the fall of year 8 the Jubilee year would be over, since it began in the fall of the previous year, overlapping with the end of the Sabbatical year. That is why they could then plant in the fall of year 8, because the Jubilee year was over. After the Jews changed the count of the Sabbatical years to the fall, they began to suffer from famine during Sabbatical and Jubilee years because the crops no longer self-sowed and the time for refraining from sowing and planting became extended to 2 full years, from one full Sabbatical year and one overlapping Jubilee year.

verses.textEn: Also, the land shall not be sold in perpetuity, for it is mine, and you are newcomers and settlers to me.
verses.textLa: Terra quoque non vendetur in perpetuum: quia mea est, et vos advenæ et coloni mei estis.

verses.textEn: Therefore, every region of your possession shall be sold under the condition of redemption.
verses.textLa: Unde cuncta regio possessionis vestræ sub redemptionis conditione vendetur.

verses.textEn: If your brother, being in need, will have sold his little possession and his close relative is willing, he is able to redeem what he had sold.
verses.textLa: Si attenuatus frater tuus vendiderit possessiunculam suam, et voluerit propinquus eius, potest redimere quod ille vendiderat.

verses.textEn: But if he has no near relative, and he himself is able to find the price to redeem it,
verses.textLa: Sin autem non habuerit proximum, et ipse pretium ad redimendum potuerit invenire:

verses.textEn: the produce shall be calculated from that time when he sold it. And what is lacking, he shall repay to the buyer, and so he shall receive his possession.
verses.textLa: computabuntur fructus ex eo tempore quo vendidit: et quod reliquum est, reddet emptori, sicque recipiet possessionem suam.

verses.textEn: But if his hand will not have discovered a way to repay the price, the buyer shall have what he bought, until the year of the Jubilee. For in that year all that has been sold shall return to the owner, and to the original possessor.
verses.textLa: Quod si non invenerit manus eius ut reddat pretium, habebit emptor quod emerat, usque ad annum Iubileum. In ipso enim omnis venditio redibit ad dominum, et ad possessorem pristinum.

verses.textEn: Whoever will have sold a house within the walls of a city shall have the freedom to redeem it, until one year has been completed.
verses.textLa: Qui vendiderit domum intra urbis muros, habebit licentiam redimendi, donec unus impleatur annus.

verses.textEn: If he has not redeemed it, and the year will have turned full circle, the buyer and his posterity shall possess it, in perpetuity, and it is not able to be redeemed, even in the Jubilee.
verses.textLa: Si non redemerit, et anni circulus fuerit evolutus, emptor possidebit eam, et posteri eius in perpetuum, et redimi non poterit, etiam in Iubileo.

verses.textEn: But if the house is in a village, which has no walls, it shall be sold by the law of the fields. If it has not been redeemed beforehand, then in the Jubilee it shall return to the owner.
verses.textLa: Sin autem in villa domus, quæ muros non habet, agrorum iure vendetur. Si ante redempta non fuerit, in iubileo revertetur ad dominum.

verses.textEn: The buildings of the Levites, which are in the cities, are always able to be redeemed.
verses.textLa: Ædes Levitarum, quæ in urbibus sunt, semper possunt redimi:

verses.textEn: If they have not been redeemed, then in the Jubilee they shall return to the owners, for the houses of the cities of the Levites are for their possession among the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: si redemptæ non fuerint, in iubileo revertentur ad dominos, quia domus urbium Levitarum pro possessionibus sunt inter filios Israel.

verses.textEn: But let not their suburbs be sold, for it is an everlasting possession.
verses.textLa: Suburbana autem eorum non veneant, quia possessio sempiterna est.

verses.textEn: If your brother has become impoverished, or infirm of hand, and you take him in, like a newcomer or a sojourner, and he lives with you,
verses.textLa: Si attenuatus fuerit frater tuus, et infirmus manu, et susceperis eum quasi advenam, et peregrinum, et vixerit tecum,

verses.textEn: do not accept usury from him, nor anything more than what you gave. Fear your God, so that your brother may be able to live with you.
verses.textLa: ne accipias usuras ab eo, nec amplius quam dedisti. Time Deum tuum, ut vivere possit frater tuus apud te.

verses.textEn: You shall not give him your money by usury, nor exact from him an overabundance of produce.
verses.textLa: Pecuniam tuam non dabis ei ad usuram, et frugum superabundantiam non exiges.

verses.textEn: I am the Lord your God, who led you away from the land of Egypt, so that I might give to you the land of Canaan, and so that I may be your God.
verses.textLa: Ego Dominus Deus vester, qui eduxi vos de Terra Ægypti, ut darem vobis Terram Chanaan, et essem vester Deus.

verses.textEn: If your brother, having been compelled by poverty, will have sold himself to you, you shall not oppress him with the servitude of indentured servants.
verses.textLa: Si paupertate compulsus vendiderit se tibi frater tuus, non eum opprimes servitute famulorum,

verses.textEn: But he shall be like a hired hand or a settler; he shall work with you, until the year of the Jubilee.
verses.textLa: sed quasi mercenarius et colonus erit: usque ad annum Iubileum operabitur apud te,

verses.textEn: And after that, he shall depart with his children, and he shall return to his kindred, to the possession of his fathers.
verses.textLa: et postea egredietur cum liberis suis, et revertetur ad cognationem ad possessionem patrum suorum.

verses.textEn: For these are my servants, and I led them away from the land of Egypt; let them not be sold into the condition of servitude.
verses.textLa: Mei enim servi sunt, et ego eduxi eos de Terra Ægypti, non veneant conditione servorum:

verses.textEn: Do not afflict him by power, but be fearful of your God.
verses.textLa: ne affligas eum per potentiam, sed metuito Deum tuum.

verses.textEn: Let your male and female servants be from the nations which are all around you,
verses.textLa: Servus et ancilla sint vobis de nationibus quæ in circuitu vestro sunt,

verses.textEn: and from the newcomers who sojourn with you, or who have been born from them in your land. These you shall have as servants,
verses.textLa: et de advenis qui peregrinantur apud vos, vel qui ex his nati fuerint in terra vestra: hos habebitis famulos:

verses.textEn: and, by the right of inheritance, you shall transmit them to your posterity, and you shall possess them forever. But do not oppress your brothers, the sons of Israel, by power.
verses.textLa: et hereditario iure transmittetis ad posteros, ac possidebitis in æternum. Fratres autem vestros filios Israel ne opprimatis per potentiam.

verses.textEn: If the hand of a newcomer or a sojourner will have grown strong among you, and your brother, having become impoverished, will have sold himself to him, or to any of his stock,
verses.textLa: Si invaluerit apud vos manus advenæ atque peregrini, et attenuatus frater tuus vendiderit se ei, aut cuiquam de stirpe eius:

verses.textEn: after the sale, he is able to be redeemed. Whoever is willing among his brothers shall redeem him:
verses.textLa: post venditionem potest redimi. Qui voluerit ex fratribus suis, redimet eum,

verses.textEn: either the paternal uncle, or the paternal uncle’s son, or his close relative, by blood or by affinity. But if he himself will be able also, he shall redeem himself,
verses.textLa: et patruus, et patruelis, et consanguineus, et affinis. Sin autem et ipse potuerit, redimet se,

verses.textEn: considering only the years from the time of his selling until the year of the Jubilee, and calculating the money for which he was sold, according to the number of years and the accounting of a hired hand.
verses.textLa: supputatis dumtaxat annis a tempore venditionis suæ usque ad annum Iubileum: et pecunia, qua venditus fuerat, iuxta annorum numerum et rationem mercenarii supputata.

verses.textEn: If there will have been many years which remain until the Jubilee, according to these shall he also repay the price.
verses.textLa: Si plures fuerint anni qui remanent usque ad Iubileum, secundum hos reddet et pretium.

verses.textEn: If few, he shall determine the accounting with him according to the number of years, and he shall repay to the buyer by what is left remaining of the years;
verses.textLa: Si pauci, ponet rationem cum eo iuxta annorum numerum, et reddet emptori quod reliquum est annorum,

verses.textEn: his wages being charged by what served before. He shall not afflict him violently in your sight.
verses.textLa: quibus ante servivit mercedibus imputatis: non affliget eum violenter in conspectu tuo.

verses.textEn: But if, by these means, he will not be able to be redeemed, then in the year of the Jubilee he shall depart with his children.
verses.textLa: Quod si per hæc redimi non potuerit, anno Iubileo egredietur cum liberis suis.

verses.textEn: For they are my servants, the sons of Israel, whom I led away from the land of Egypt.
verses.textLa: Mei enim sunt servi, filii Israel, quos eduxi de Terra Ægypti.

verses.textEn: I am the Lord your God. You shall not make for yourselves an idol or a graven image. Neither shall you erect a monument, or set up a conspicuous stone in your land, in order that you may adore it. For I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Ego Dominus Deus vester: Non facietis vobis idolum et sculptile, nec titulos erigetis, nec insignem lapidem ponetis in terra vestra, ut adoretis eum. Eo enim sum Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: Observe my Sabbaths, and be fearful toward my Sanctuary. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Custodite sabbata mea, et pavete ad Sanctuarium meum. Ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: If you will walk in my precepts, and observe my commandments, and accomplish them, I will give to you rain in its time,
verses.textLa: Si in præceptis meis ambulaveritis, et mandata mea custodieritis, et feceritis ea, dabo vobis pluvias temporibus suis,

verses.textEn: and the ground shall bring forth its seedlings, and the trees shall be filled again with fruit.
verses.textLa: et terra gignet germen suum, et pomis arbores replebuntur.

verses.textEn: The threshing of the harvest shall last until the vintage, and the vintage shall overtake the sowing. And you shall eat your bread to fullness, and you shall live in your land without fear.
verses.textLa: Apprehendet messium tritura vindemiam, et vindemia occupabit sementem: et comedetis panem vestrum in saturitate, et absque pavore habitabitis in terra vestra.

verses.textEn: I will give peace to your most distant regions. You will sleep, and there will be no one to strike you with terror. I will take away harmful wild beasts, and the sword will not cross your borders.
verses.textLa: Dabo pacem in finibus vestris: dormietis, et non erit qui exterreat. Auferam malas bestias: et gladius non transibit terminos vestros.

verses.textEn: You will pursue your enemies, and they will fall down at the sight of you.
verses.textLa: Persequemini inimicos vestros, et corruent coram vobis.

verses.textEn: Five of yours will pursue a hundred foreigners, and a hundred of you will pursue ten thousand. Your enemies will fall by the sword in your sight.
verses.textLa: Persequentur quinque de vestris centum alienos, et centum de vobis decem millia: cadent inimici vestri gladio in conspectu vestro.

verses.textEn: I will look with favor upon you, and I will cause you to increase; you will be multiplied, and I will confirm my covenant with you.
verses.textLa: Respiciam vos, et crescere faciam: multiplicabimini, et firmabo pactum meum vobiscum.

verses.textEn: You will eat the oldest of what is old, and, when what is new arrives, you will throw away what is old.
verses.textLa: Comedetis vetustissima veterum, et vetera novis supervenientibus proiicietis.

verses.textEn: I will set my tabernacle in your midst, and my soul will not cast you out.
verses.textLa: Ponam tabernaculum meum in medio vestri, et non abiiciet vos anima mea.

verses.textEn: I will walk among you, and I will be your God, and you shall be my people.
verses.textLa: Ambulabo inter vos, et ero Deus vester, vosque eritis populus meus.

verses.textEn: I am the Lord your God, who led you away from the land of the Egyptians, lest you serve them, and who broke the chains around your necks, so that you would walk upright.
verses.textLa: Ego Dominus Deus vester: qui eduxi vos de Terra Ægyptiorum, ne serviretis eis, et qui confregi catenas cervicum vestrarum, ut incederetis erecti.

verses.textEn: But if you will not listen to me, nor accomplish all of my commandments,
verses.textLa: Quod si non audieritis me, nec feceritis omnia mandata mea,

verses.textEn: if you despise my laws, and disdain my judgments, so that you do not accomplish those things which have been established by me, and so that you lead my covenant away into nullification,
verses.textLa: si spreveritis leges meas, et iudicia mea contempseritis, ut non faciatis ea quæ a me constituta sunt, et ad irritum perducatis pactum meum:

verses.textEn: then I also will do these things to you. I will quickly visit you with destitution, and burning heat, which will waste away your eyes, and consume your lives. In vain will you sow your seed, which will be devoured by your enemies.
verses.textLa: ego quoque hæc faciam vobis: Visitabo vos velociter in egestate, et ardore, qui conficiat oculos vestros, et consumat animas vestras. Frustra seretis sementem, quæ ab hostibus devorabitur.

verses.textEn: I will set my face against you, and you will fall down before your enemies, and you will be subjugated to those who hate you. You will flee, though no one pursues.
verses.textLa: Ponam faciem meam contra vos, et corruetis coram hostibus vestris, et subiiciemini his qui oderunt vos. Fugietis, nemine persequente.

verses.textEn: But if you will not be obedient to me in this way, then I will add sevenfold to your chastisement, because of your sins.
verses.textLa: Sin autem nec sic obedieritis mihi, addam correptiones vestras septuplum propter peccata vestra,

verses.textEn: And I will crush the pride in your hardness, and I will give to you heaven above like iron, and the earth below like brass.
verses.textLa: et conteram superbiam duritiæ vestræ. Daboque vobis cælum desuper sicut ferrum, et terram æneam.

verses.textEn: Your labor will be consumed to no purpose; the land will not bring forth seedlings, nor will the trees provide their fruit.
verses.textLa: Consumetur incassum labor vester, non proferet terra germen, nec arbores poma præbebunt.

verses.textEn: If you walk as an adversary to me, and if you are not willing to listen to me, I will add sevenfold to your plagues, because of your sins.
verses.textLa: Si ambulaveritis ex adverso mihi, nec volueritis audire me, addam plagas vestras in septuplum propter peccata vestra:

verses.textEn: And I will send upon you the wild beasts of the field, which will consume you and your cattle, and which will reduce everything to paucity, and cause your roadways to become desolate.
verses.textLa: immittamque in vos bestias agri, quæ consumant vos, et pecora vestra, et ad paucitatem cuncta redigant, desertæque fiant viæ vestræ.

verses.textEn: But if you are not willing to receive discipline in this way, and you still walk as an adversary to me,
verses.textLa: Quod si nec sic volueritis recipere disciplinam, sed ambulaveritis ex adverso mihi:

verses.textEn: likewise, I will advance against you as an adversary, and I will strike you seven times, because of your sins.
verses.textLa: ego quoque contra vos adversus incedam, et percutiam vos septies propter peccata vestra.

verses.textEn: And I will lead over you the sword that shall avenge my covenant. And when you will have fled into the cities, I will send a pestilence into your midst, and you will be delivered into the hands of your enemies.
verses.textLa: Inducamque super vos gladium ultorem fœderis mei. Cumque confugeritis in urbes, mittam pestilentiam in medio vestri, et trademini in manibus hostium,

verses.textEn: After this, I will have broken the staff of your bread, so that ten women bake bread in one oven, and distribute it by weight. And you shall eat and not be filled.
verses.textLa: postquam confregero baculum panis vestri: ita ut decem mulieres in uno clibano coquant panes, et reddant eos ad pondus: et comedetis, et non saturabimini.

verses.textEn: Then, if you will not listen to me through these things, and you still walk against me,
verses.textLa: Sin autem nec per hæc audieritis me, sed ambulaveritis contra me:

verses.textEn: then I also will advance against you, with an opposing fury, and I will chastise you with seven plagues, because of your sins:
verses.textLa: et ego incedam adversus vos in furore contrario, et corripiam vos septem plagis propter peccata vestra,

verses.textEn: so much so that you will eat the flesh of your sons and your daughters.
verses.textLa: ita ut comedatis carnes filiorum vestrorum et filiarum vestrarum.

verses.textEn: I will destroy your high places, and I will break apart your false images. You will fall among the ruins of your idols, and my soul will abominate you:
verses.textLa: Destruam excelsa vestra, et simulacra confringam. Cadetis inter ruinas idolorum vestrorum, et abominabitur vos anima mea,

verses.textEn: so much so that I will reduce your cities to a wilderness, and I will make your Sanctuaries desolate, and I will no longer accept the most sweet odors.
verses.textLa: in tantum ut urbes vestras redigam in solitudinem, et deserta faciam Sanctuaria vestra, nec recipiam ultra odorem suavissimum.

verses.textEn: And I will utterly ruin your land, and your enemies shall be stupefied at it, when they will have become its inhabitants.
verses.textLa: Disperdamque terram vestram, et stupebunt super ea inimici vestri, cum habitatores illius fuerint.

verses.textEn: Then I will scatter you among the Gentiles, and I will unsheathe the sword after you. And your land will be deserted, and your cities will be demolished.
verses.textLa: Vos autem dispergam in Gentes, et evaginabo post vos gladium, eritque terra vestra deserta, et civitates vestræ dirutæ.

verses.textEn: Then the land will be pleased by her Sabbaths, throughout all the days of her solitude. So, while you will be
verses.textLa: Tunc placebunt terræ sabbata sua cunctis diebus solitudinis suæ: quando fueritis

verses.textEn: in the land of the enemy, she will worship and rest in the Sabbath of her solitude, because she will not have rested in your Sabbaths, when you lived in her.
verses.textLa: in terra hostili, sabbatizabit, et requiescet in sabbatis solitudinis suæ, eo quod non requieverit in sabbatis vestris quando habitabatis in ea.
verses.notes: Now here is a common translation dilemma; two words are used together, either one of which by itself would be translated by the same word. So both ‘sabbatizabit’ and ‘requiescet’ can properly be translated as ‘shall rest,’ but when used together they must be translated differently: ‘worship and rest’ is the fitting choice.

verses.textEn: And whoever of you will remain, I will send terror into their hearts in the regions of their enemies. The sound of a flying leaf will terrify them, and so they will flee, as if from the sword. They will fall, though no one pursues.
verses.textLa: Et qui de vobis remanserint, dabo pavorem in cordibus eorum in regionibus hostium, terrebit eos sonitus folii volantis, et ita fugient quasi gladium: cadent, nullo persequente,

verses.textEn: And they will each fall upon their brothers, as if they were fleeing from wars; no one among you will dare to resist your foes.
verses.textLa: et corruent singuli super fratres suos quasi bella fugientes, nemo vestrum inimicis audebit resistere.

verses.textEn: You will perish among the Gentiles, and the land of the enemy will consume you.
verses.textLa: Peribitis inter Gentes, et hostilis vos terra consumet.

verses.textEn: But if some few of these still remain, they shall waste away in their iniquities, in the land of their enemies, and they will be afflicted, because of the sins of their fathers and their own sins,
verses.textLa: Quod si et de iis aliqui remanserint, tabescent in iniquitatibus suis, in terra inimicorum suorum, et propter peccata patrum suorum et sua affligentur:

verses.textEn: until they confess their iniquities, and those of their ancestors, by which they have transgressed against me and walked as adversaries to me.
verses.textLa: donec confiteantur iniquitates suas, et maiorum suorum, quibus prævaricati sunt in me, et ambulaverunt ex adverso mihi.

verses.textEn: Therefore, I also will walk against them, and I will lead them into a hostile land, until their uncircumcised mind shall be ashamed. Then shall they pray on behalf of their impiety.
verses.textLa: Ambulabo igitur et ego contra eos, et inducam illos in terram hostilem, donec erubescat incircumcisa mens eorum: tunc orabunt pro impietatibus suis.

verses.textEn: And I will remember my covenant, which I formed with Jacob, and Isaac, and Abraham. I will also remember the land,
verses.textLa: Et recordabor fœderis mei quod pepigi cum Iacob, et Isaac, et Abraham. Terræ quoque memor ero:

verses.textEn: which, when she will be left behind by them, shall be pleased by her Sabbaths, enduring solitude because of them. Yet truly, they shall pray for their sins, because they cast aside my judgments, and they despised my laws.
verses.textLa: quæ cum relicta fuerit ab eis, complacebit sibi in sabbatis suis, patiens solitudinem propter illos. Ipsi vero rogabunt pro peccatis suis, eo quod abiecerint iudicia mea, et leges meas despexerint.

verses.textEn: And even after so much, when they were in the land of their enemy, I did not cast them off entirely, and I did not so despise them that they would be consumed, nor so that I would nullify my covenant with them. For I am the Lord their God.
verses.textLa: Et tamen etiam cum essent in terra hostili, non penitus abieci eos, neque sic despexi ut consumerentur, et irritum facerent pactum meum cum eis. Ego enim sum Dominus Deus eorum,

verses.textEn: And I will remember my original covenant, when I led them away from the land of Egypt, in the sight of the Gentiles, so as to be their God. I am the Lord. These are the judgments, and precepts, and laws, which the Lord has granted between himself and the sons of Israel, on mount Sinai, by the hand of Moses.
verses.textLa: et recordabor fœderis mei pristini, quando eduxi eos de Terra Ægypti in conspectu Gentium, ut essem Deus eorum. Ego Dominus. Hæc sunt iudicia atque præcepta et leges, quas dedit Dominus inter se et filios Israel in monte Sinai per manum Moysi.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: Speak to the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: The man who will have made a vow and espoused his soul to God shall give the price according to the estimation.
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Homo qui votum fecerit, et spoponderit Deo animam suam, sub æstimatione dabit pretium.

verses.textEn: If it is a male from twenty years to sixty years, he shall give fifty shekels of silver, by the measure of the Sanctuary;
verses.textLa: Si fuerit masculus a vigesimo anno usque ad sexagesimum annum, dabit quinquaginta siclos argenti ad mensuram Sanctuarii:

verses.textEn: if it is a woman, thirty.
verses.textLa: si mulier, triginta.
